Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with delusions of grandeur”
Reviews.Author: Sheilsy
Reviews.Content: Despite booking a twin room in January we arrived the first week of April to find we had been allocated a double room. The receptionist who booked us in didn't bother to tell us this, in fact we were lucky he decided to come off the phone to book us in at all. When I queried the room he told me he knew we had requested a twin but there were none available but we would be moved the next day. The following morning I reminded the receptionist of this ( a new member of staff) and he stood there with the room list and announced that he didn't know where we were going to be moved to as there was nothing available, and he didn't know why his colleague had made such promises. Needless to stay we remained in the double room. In general we found the reception staff to be rude and unhelpful. As to the room, the kettle socket didn't work and we had to use the socket in the bathroom, there were no tissues, the toilet paper was hard, a stained tea tray cloth remained unchanged all week and we had to keep requesting milk as they did not appear to replace it each day. We were also disturbed in the early morning and from about 11pm because we were directly under the dining room and we were treated to the clicking of a staff member's heels across the floor and the dragging of tables. This hotel is most certainly not of 4 star quality.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Libanio
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine with this hotel: our accomodations were very good In an old European style; very clean; excellent breakfast; reliable Service.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Mecenate Palace”
Reviews.Author: Brian D
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here this Easter in a triple room. The hotel was very clean and the room spacious enough for the three of us. Having read previous reviews, I had requested a room overlooking the piazza. Triple rooms overlook the courtyard which, on reflection, was a blessing. After a long day walking the beautiful cobbled Roman streets, a good nights sleep is essential and we enjoyed 4 peaceful nights. Staff are friendly and very helpful. The decor is charactful and is a pleasant change from the usual bland city offerings. Happy hour on the roof terrace was a bonus and the breakfast a perfect start to our day. The location is great for all the usual sights and a 10 min walk from Termini. A taxi rank is located just off the piazza. Plenty of bars and restaurants within a short walk. All in all, we had a fantastic visit to Rome and would definitely return to the Mecenate Palace.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: JohnInVirginia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my wife and 2 kids. We had a suite, which for the 4 of us proved to be plenty of room and indeed more room than I expected in downtown Rome. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful at all times. The room, furnishings, etc. all felt clean and everything worked properly. Breakfast was plentiful with a lot of variety - better than I had expected and with something to satisfy everyone. All in all this was a great place to stay, and I'd recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Hotel”
Reviews.Author: grandma73034
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel across the piazza from Santa maria Maggiore cathedral. Bells from the church were wonderful. Rooms although smal by US standards were clean and a very adequate oasis after a long day of sight seeing. Roof top breakfast room was nice whether indoors or outdoors. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Hworlock
Reviews.Content: This place was perfect! Excellent location, excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: nadler
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed here last week for 6 nights for a family Spring Break vacation. We stayed in the "newer" section of the hotel, with a separate entrance next door to the main lobby. It was very secure and the room was very clean with enough room for 3 people comfortably. One large king size bed and one fold out couch (double size). All beds were very firm and very comfortable. It is true that they do not provide face cloths (aka wash cloths), so if that is important to you, bring your own. The bath tub had wonderful jacuzzi jets which felt great after a long day of walking. It also had a shower with great water pressure. There was a fridge (mini bar) but we used it for left overs. The TV was small but did have two English news channels and honestly, we didn't miss having TV at all since we were in Rome for sightseeing and after dinner and gelato we were ready for bed. The best part was the breakfast setting, included in the price of the room. It was a lovely dining hall with an attached roof garden patio with an amazing view of the city and the cathedral across the street. I especially liked having the wait staff greet us every morning fully dressed in suits and ties and escort us to a table and bring the coffee (with steamed milk) and tea. Then we'd visit the buffet which was pretty much the same every day but with something for everyone. I loved the giant kiwis. A couple of nights the free wifi in the room didn't work because it was down throughout the hotel, but they helped us out by looking up the weather on the lobby computer or checking on out return flight. The weather had turned surprisingly warm and our room was hot at night, even with the one small window open, so we asked for a fan, which they brought up immediately and it helped a lot. They said the air conditioning doesn't work until May. I also liked that we could drink the water out of the tap and it tasted great, so we saved money by filling our water bottles every day. Because the room was not on the street it was extremely quiet and we all slept great. It was a 5 minute walk to the Termini train station and there were lots of good looking restaurants near by. I would definitely recommend this hotel for couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, small rooms OK service”
Reviews.Author: CBxGBG
Reviews.Content: A family visit to Rome for 4 days, staying at this hotel. Rooms much smaller than shown at the web when we made our reservation. Staff OK but did not really try to get us better rooms. Breakfast at terrace on the roof was good and the rooms where quiet and fairly clean. In short, the best thing with this hotel is the location, most of the sights in the sity within 30 min walking distance

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and central”
Reviews.Author: Gabriele60
Reviews.Content: Location and descriptions in the on-line oirtals are true: near Termini, opposite Santa Maira di Maggiore. Old-fashioned, but nicely equipped, windows can be opened. Room to the yard was very quiet, could sleep with open window. Nothing to be heard from the other guests. Room rather small but sufficient space for two, bathroom large and comfortable, however, no tissues provided among the amenities. Otherwise ok. Breakfast very nicely on the terrace with good selection of pastries and other food, but not an American breakfast, however, really ok for Northern Europeans. REception personnel English speaking and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Gwattley
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small which was expected for Europe. However this hotel was dated and badly in need of repair and refurbishment. They had a small pc monitor size tv in rooms. There was no access to English stations such as CNN or CNBC. In the bathrooms there were bath towels and hand towels but no face cloths. When you showering you either use a hand towel or your HAND to shower??? Staff not very friendly at all especially male desk clerk who works weekdays during the day shift.

Reviews.Title: “Age is starting to show”
Reviews.Author: Lesley N
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had stayed at the Mecenate Palace before. This time walls had stains. Bathroom fixtures rusting, missing bits. Overall the hotel is getting rundown. Top sheets on the bed had small holes and tears. The location is great, you can walk to all the top sites. The hotel just isn't a four star anymore. Beware the "deluxe room" standard room at the front of the hotel overlooking the noisy square.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: Tristan331
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 days. While the hotel does have an old Italian charm to it, the best thing about it is its location. 5 minute walk to Termini Station with a map, 7-10 min otherwise! Metro station down the block. 15 minute walk to the Colloseum. It was super convenient to get around Rome from here. We stayed in a standard room and I agree with the other reviewers about standard rooms. VERY small. The smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. It was a squeeze with two people and two suitcases. The bedspread, curtains and carpet were dingy and musty, but the sheets and towels were always crisp and clean - which is the important thing. Very firm bed. I personally prefer softer beds but you will probably be so tired walking around Rome, that it wont matter. TV is really a computer monitor about 11" or so. Breakfast is included, but no hot foods (cereals, pastries, hard boiled eggs, cold cuts). Staff - some super helpful, others not as much. Oh and one warning.....they turn off electricity to the room when you give them the key so make sure no one is taking a shower while someone else goes for a walk! They also add "city" taxes (not covered in your booking fees or package). I don't know if I would stay here again but from the other reviews if you go for a suite you might be better off and have a great experience. Overall, we liked the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kmbperdon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in March 2012. It was a great pick! We arrived by train at the Termini Station, which was a short walk from the hotel. Check-in was easy. Our rooms were clean and good in size. Beds were very comfortable, and bathrooms were nice. We also had a pull-out sofabed. Wi-fi (with surcharge) was pretty fast. Buffet breakfast (included for us) on the top floor was delicious every morning. To get to our room, you have to climb up some stairs from outside of the hotel, enter from the side of the hotel, and cross a little garden area. It was nice because it was pretty secluded and very quiet at night. We had privacy and were able to rest from our busy days. In between the lobby and the outdoor stairs you pass by a gelato place which was delicious and cheap too! We checked other gelato places in the area, and this was the one we liked the best. Every night before going back to our room, we would get some gelato as a treat! The location of the hotel was also great in regards to getting to the major tourist sites. We were able to walk to the Coliseum, and the Metro was also close by for getting to the Vatican. There are several good restaurants around the area so eating out was not a problem. There is a bank right across the street with an ATM so it was easy to withdraw some cash. Watch out for the fees though because that bank charged us quite a bit of fees. I would try another bank which you can find within short walking distance. There are several souvenir shops near the hotel for last minute shopping which was great. Overall, I would stay in this hotel again, no questions.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and romantic”
Reviews.Author: betsywillo
Reviews.Content: I've just got back from mecenate palace, my husband and I went for five days, the hotel is lovely and clean, rooms were spotless, large bathroom, dressing room and bedroom. All the staff were very friendly.I would love to go back to this hotel and Rome as soon as possible, loved every minute of it

Reviews.Title: “5 Star quality in a 4star hotel”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the Mecenate Palace in Rome last week. The hotel is well located, a short walk from the main station. This is a old fashioned hotel where the rooms are elegantly furnished. There was a separate dressing area with plenty of hanging space. The bedrooms and bathrooms are beautifully finished, the latter in marble. Breakfast, which was served on the elegant roof terrace, had a very good choice of fresh cereals cold meats and a good bread selection. The staff are courteous and well informed. I will definitely use this hotel whenever I visit Rome again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gregliam
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and location at the top of the main road (Quattro Fontane) to walk to all of the main attractions. Termini metro station is 5 minutes walk away to get you to the vatican, and the station also houses the shopping centre. There are some great local resteraunts leading up to the station which are reasonably priced, and it is well worth paying the small extra to get a deluxe room which has great views. Hotel staff were really friendly and we also used their taxi service to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: lesnoless
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a group of ten who were over to watch the rugby. We stayed for 4 nights and apart from the first night when we had to stay next door in an appartment because our room was not available, apparently because of the snow, we had a lovely time. The staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms very nice. There was a cosy little bar which we frequented before going out for a meal,( the hotel restaurant seemed to be closed but you could get light meals in the bar). There were plemty of restaurants within walking distance. Termini station was about a 5 min walk and in a tabac shop within the station you could get a rover ticket for 4 euros. We used it to get to the vatican but walked everywhere else. One disappointment was the Colisseum was closed for the week because of the snow. watching the rugby in the snow was a bit surreal and the next day we were outside the Pantheon basking in the sun and bartering for a bag off one of the street dealers. He wanted 30Euros but I got it for 10! All in all we had a lovely time and will definitely go back there when next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, and good value”
Reviews.Author: sykander
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after cancelling my first choice hotel, and I'm glad I made the swap. Really, I couldn't find anything to complain about in this hotel - the room we were allocated was a good size double, with a perfect view of the church. The room was comfortable, clean and the en suite very well maintained: even the 1950/60s built in radio still worked! Breakfast was also very good. I've read other reviewers complaining about having to pay for bacon and eggs - seriously? Try something different! You're in Rome - if you want an English breakfast guaranteed, don't leave the UK. We also ate at the hotel for our first night, and had the set menu. The meal was well cooked and very tasty, and again, nothing to complain about. Pretty good value I thought for the hotel - they're usually overpriced. There's a fantastic view across the city from the restaurant too. The Mecenate Palace is under five minutes' walk (unless you're slow) from termini station. There are plenty of restaurants and shops in the area, and although it's not a quiet area, we had no problems with sleeping. Termini is somewhat seedy - think Kings Cross in the 90s - but there are so many people around that it doesn't feel inherently unsafe. It's often a gamble, trying to find a good value, clean, comfortable place to stay, but the Mecenate Palace did exceed expectations, and I would definitely choose it again for a future stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ideal for long or short stays, we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Laz_and_Nat
Reviews.Content: An easy to find hotel that's less than 10 minutes walk from Termini station. It is situated directly opposite Santa Maria Maggiore Basillica, a stunning church that we had the most amazing view of from our huge bedroom window. Reception staff were very helpful and welcoming. The included breakfast buffet had lots of choice and certainly sets you up for a busy day of sight-seeing - just don't leave it until the last 15 minutes of breakfast time or you may struggle to find a table. Our room was much bigger than we expected, some pictures may make it appear dated but we thought it was true Italian charm! We only stayed for 2 nights but would definitely have stayed longer if we could. Overall a very clean, beautiful hotel in the perfect location for exploring all the sights of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Donna L
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I traveled to Rome in April 2011. It was our first time visiting so location was important for us. We chose Mecenate palace because of the location, price and reviews and we chose right! The hotel is centrally located and is close to pretty much everything except for the Vatican. You can easily walk to Termini station, the Colosseum, restaurants and many other sites. We had a standard room which was a good size for European standards. Rooms were clean, bed comfy and the shower was hot with plenty of water pressure.To be honest we were really only had the hotel to sleep, because Rome has so much to see during the day. The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful. The breakfast which is held on a breathtaking terrace was great! No hot food, but the cereal, muffins, fruit and yogurt filled us. Definitely get the cappuccino which is no extra charge! We used the wireless internet a few times which worked well. Unlike other reviews, I did not find it to be expensive. I would def recommend this hotel and stay here again. I am sure that there are more luxurious hotels in Rome, but if you aren't looking to spend a ton and plan to site see most of time, then definitely stay here! Some tips for Rome, book your tickets to Colosseum ahead of time and get there early! Also if you can go on a week day to avoid the crowds. Do the same for the Vatican too. You can walk pretty much everywhere so we never took a cab. The subway is great and very reliable. Make sure to go to Ostia Antica right outside Rome! You can take the train there.

Reviews.Title: “It was...ok...”
Reviews.Author: gmjpeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights on our honeymoon. We got a decent price, and our package came with free transfers and breakfast. Location: Ok. It is right accross the street from a great market, which we used a lot. It was accross the street from St. Margaret Majorie church, which was nice. It also had a park and a subway stop at the end of the street, which was ideal, about a 5 minute walk. It was also a 15 minute walk to Termini station, and we did walk there with our luggage. However, there were no good resteraunts that were close. We were really close to "China Town" and a bunch of made in China cheap shops. The deli next door was ok, but not great, meaning that most of our dinning was far. One night we ate at a resteraunt that was 3 blocks away, and it was nice but expensive. Go an farther, and we were surrounded by McDonalds, and super touristy resteraunts. Rooms: Small, old, stained carpet and bedspread. I know that this is the average Rome experience, so it didn't bother me too much. Breakfast: Ok. The one thing that annoyed me was our package specified that we got "Hot American Breakfast" and there were signs on the table that said the hot eggs and food was extra. Only upon insisting that it was included in our package could we get it. Is that really so expensive to offer? It was never a big serving. The regular spread was cheese, lunchmeat, and bread, very mediocre. So was the coffee and capuccinos. Service: The best thing about this place was the front desk. We spoke to many people who were very helpful with recommendations, directions, and advice. Would I stay here again? Not really. I think I could have a better room and location for not much more money,

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms unless you upgrade”
Reviews.Author: CharlieH6
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend in Rome at the Mecenate Palace, the hotel overall is of a good standard but the quality of the rooms is very variable. Having seen photos of the suites on the website, we were disappointed by the size of our room and bed, which was a small double pushed against one wall. The room was one of the smallest I have ever found in a hotel, so if you book a standard room be prepared! The suites seem to be bigger and better positioned with good views of the piazza, it's just a shame that the rest of the rooms are sub-standard. The restaurant had a limited food menu for evening meals and drinks weren't great value at 6 euros for a beer, but breakfast was good. The location isn't the most central but quite convenient for the train station, the area is pretty quiet at night so I'd recommend heading to the centre for bars and restaurants. The hotel certainly had its good points but there were disappointments too so overall it failed to really impress.

Reviews.Title: “love the presential suite”
Reviews.Author: suzysw
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel. We had a group of 9 adults staying here for two nights in November after a cruise. My husband and I upgraded to the Pres Suite (only about $50.00/nt more) because it has a beautiful large terrace that would hold all 9 of us for after dinner drinks...the suite was on the small side but perfectly fine for the two of us. Furniture was very old, antiquey but nice....Our friends rooms were all fine, a bit small but not too bad. Location is great, good shopping nearby and plenty of restaurants. Staff was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in one of the most Romantic Cities in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Hist0ricTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mecenate Palace in Rome for three days during our honeymoon last year. It's an excellent location, much more quiet than other parts of the city. The Colosseum and the Forum are only about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. You are always very close to the Termini Station (about 4 blocks, I believe) from which you can to pretty much every other part of the city. The Roof Top restaurant served excellent breakfast, with very friendly and attentive staff. The last night of our trip, we ate dinner here, which was delicious - albeit EXPENSIVE. I would suggest the homemade Triamisu which was awesome. The roof was very spacious and well appointed. The view of Santa Maria Maggiore from our room was amazing. If you want a true Roman experience, I highly suggest this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovedisney10
Reviews.Content: This was my families first time in Rome, The first room we were given was old and so small that my walk in closet at home is larger than this room,It was smelly and dirty, old ground in gum in carpet. My husband complained and asked to be switched but they told us that they were full. He complained about the musty old foul odor of the room again the next day and they sent someone up there to investigate. They had the nerve to tell us that it was our fault that the room smelled and that we had too much luggage. I hardly think that one large suitcase and two small carryons for a familyof three was excessive. The last night they moved us into another room, same type of room different floor. No odor there. It smelled fresh, The staff was not helpful and rude. On top of this I had to pay a luxury tax which was about 40;euros. I could not recommend this hotel even to my worst enemy. This was supposed to be a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Reviews were accurate”
Reviews.Author: adnanita358
Reviews.Content: My Partner and myself stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of December, and all I can say is from the start of our stay all the staff were great and so helpful. We had a beautiful room overlooking the Bassilica, the bed was firm and very comfortable, the bathroom was clean and spacious. The location is fantastic, 5 minutes walk from the Termini station, 10 minutes from the ancient centre. We managed to get a great deal, and this meant that it was excellent value for money. If we were to return to Rome, we would definitely stay here again, and would have no problem recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: DAVIDXOTIC
Reviews.Content: The Mecenate Palace Hotel was close to the Termini, and all major sites, about 15 minutes walk in any direction and you were in the living breathing heart of the Eternal City. The hotel was clean comfortable and the breakfast better that expected. Staff were courteous if not a little distracted which seems to be the Roman way, never focus on too much at once. All in all a good hotel in a great part of town with a great little restaurant. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “AS GOOD AS I HAD HOPED”
Reviews.Author: PaulSnood
Reviews.Content: Found the Mecenate Palace because we're always looking for "a room with a view" and this one didn't disappoint- 5th floor directly overlooking the awsome Basilica Santa Maria Maggiore and the incredible mosaics. The hotel was very accomodating, with clean room and bathroom, and FIRM new bed with soft duvet and sheets. Nice breakfast buffet included, including all the cappucinos and espressos you want, with nice pastries, italian cold meats and breads. I'd return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “No curtains!”
Reviews.Author: 85James
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 4th-8th November, it was a god location, reception staff were very helpful and the rom very spacious and clean however we had no curtains in the room. we asked the porter who told us they were in the laundry and they had no spares and there were no othr rooms together we could move to so we had to sleep the first night with no curtains and light pouring in! Drinks at the bar were nice and reaonable and free snacks were provided. The breakfast was very average, all fruit was tinned.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great view!”
Reviews.Author: jimmythec1
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay in a room overlooking Santa Maria Maggiore church...the bells were beautiful! (8 am to 9 pm). Window overlooking the Piazza with all its activity. Room was very nice, great large bathroom with tub/shower combination. The rooftop restaurant/bar was great...spent many evenings enjoying the view of the city, wine, etc. Breakfast was good, the usual European fare, cheeses, meats, hard boiled eggs, cold cereals, yogurt, various breads, juice and coffee. Only a 10 minute walk to ancient Rome. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful !”
Reviews.Author: loloneill57
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel,lovely staff,brilliant location.....

Reviews.Title: “convenient, welcoming with great pastries for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DannyACMA
Reviews.Content: a very well placed hotel near the station, and a short walk to the colosseum. The staff were very welcoming, and helpful for booking restaurants. We had a nice en-suite room- good size and clean. The breakfast was nice with great pastries and a variety of other options. The only problem was the room was not big enough for everyone, and you could easily have to wait a while. The restaurant was on the top floor which also had a cocktail bar and fantastic view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel with balcony city view”
Reviews.Author: StHelensLes1959
Reviews.Content: we went august and had a grandstand view of the our lady of the snow dedication at santa maria maggiore. the only draw back was we had paid for a hotel meal on the top floor and had a worse view of the celebrations. still meal done and back to very nice room for the finale. this hotel is close to the train station and with the extra event well worth a visit. we paid for a cheaper room at the end of or holiday and this was equally of a good standard.Just watch out as the closer you are to the Basillica the more expensive the restaraunts are.

Reviews.Title: “A Top of Range 3 Star Hotel, but an Average 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller1170
Reviews.Content: Looking for a high quality 3 Star Hotel in an excellent location downtown Rome for a reasonable price, then you may want to consider this hotel. However if you are looking for extensive service in a 4/5 Star hotel, then you may want to look else where. This hotel should be ranked as an excellent 3 star. The positives: Location (10-15 minutes walk to Coliseum and other major sights and shopping) Roof top garden (amazing views and service) Price for location Wifi all rooms The Averages: Room size and quality Two double beds (quite hard) pushed together to make king size. I do not mind this, but others may not like. Buffet breakfast on roof, average selection but adequate, same every day. Minibar in Room The Poor: Concierge (not existent), you may get a little information from front desk depending who was on duty. Lunch time service (not existent) Facilities (no gym) Unknown: Did not use restaurant in evening nor room service. Would I stay here again, sure, because it is my 2nd time in Rome now, know the area and where to go, what to do, and the location and cost was the best. The hotel is clean, but has a few "rough spots". If I was new to Rome and want a hotel that has a more extensive services or looking for that "up-market feel", then I would look at the 5 Stars. A few tips: Executive Rooms are not in the same building but across the road. For water ask the roof top bar. For EUR3 you can get a huge liter bottle to take to your room. Floors 4A & 5A have stairs to the rook top garden, very convenient than taking the really small elevator. This hotel is not for the mobility challenged. You will need to use stairs. Find out about Rome. Best thing to do is take open top bus, and look around, then you know where the shops/sights are. The open top bus stops at the Church square right next to the hotel (very useful). Also the best evening eating area is across the river SW of the Circus Maximus, across the river (a 10 min taxi ride). Ask the locals, they all eat there. The restaurants are more extensive in that area and the narrow cobble stones roads are just breath taking at night.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Bennett16_50
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 Nights in early October 2011. This is a genuine 4* Hotel in the very centre of Rome and comes highly recommended. The hotel is well appointed with very attentive and genuinely helpful staff, The rooms are typical of good quality European hotels, clean, tidy, well maintained, good standard accommodation and reasonably sized (They are small by US standards but this is the case in almost all European Cities). The Hotel is very well placed for all the typical Rome attractions, mostly in easy walking distance but also very well placed for the Metro which is also easy to use and navigate. The food in the roof top restaurant is very good, you can however expect 4* prices, the bar service is also first class. Breakfast is a little dissapointing not having a 'hot' option, given the accommodation price requiring extra for scrambled eggs is a little mean.This is a very minor gripe however and we would strongly recommend this hotel for a sight seeing trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4* Hotel in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: G M
Reviews.Content: The 'Mecenate Hotel' is an excellent Roman 4* Hotel. Perfect location - most of the Roman landmarks are within walking distance (Colloseum, Trevii Foutain, Pantheon), The Rome 'Terminii Train Station', is only a 5 mins walk also Very friendly and helpful staff - provide you with plenty of Tourist information with maps etc. at check-in. Lovely restaurant & bar located on the rooftop also - quality of food was excellent also. Only minor negative is the size of the rooms - fairly small for a 4* Hotel. However I believe this is a common complaint for most 4* Hotels in Rome. -------- Overall Hotel Rating 9 / 10.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Staff, restaurants and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: moshisan
Reviews.Content: A true 4 star property. Well maintained, they put us in a corner suite overlooking the Basilica Santa Maria. Roof Garden was very nice particularly for an evening drink and dinner. Staff was always excellent. All property restaurants were reasonably priced, with good food and service. Looked at menu at the restaurant next door closer to the basilica and it was 2X's as pricey and not as good, clearly aimed at the basilica tourist. Location was great for a quick visit. We walked to the Coliseum, Forums and Trevi Fountains with ease. Hotel is a short 4 blocks from the Termini Station also

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable!!”
Reviews.Author: youknowwhoToronto
Reviews.Content: We arrived early at the hotel after our cruise. Check in time was listed at 2 pm but when we arrived at 10:00am the front desk staff check to see if our room was ready. We were surprised that we were able to get in our room earlier with out any extra cost. The front desk staff gave us a map and circled where the hotel was and the main attractions in the vicinitiy. Very helpful!! The room was clean & spacious. We had 1 single bed and the other was 2 single beds put together to make a double and seperate hallway with armoire/ dresser where we kept our suitcases. The washroom was large in size, decked out in marble and very clean and bright. Location of the hotel was across from the Santa Maria Maggiore church.The hotel had a roof top terrace/ restaurant. You can see all around, just a gorgeous view. Breakfast was a plus on the roof top terrace. The spread offered an extensive variety of cereals, breads cheeses fruit & yogurt. The hotel was close to many of the attractions, all of which was within walking distance. We thoroughly enjoyed our post cruise stay at the Mecenate Palace. .

Reviews.Title: “Mecenate Hotel Rome-Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Frank D
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at this hotel and everything about it was excellent. From the friendly staff to the wonderful big breakfast served each day. If you choose to stay there, I recommend getting a room with the view if the Basilica of St. Mary Major. We had Rm 509. The view is perfect. I stood at the window many hours just looking over Rome watching the Romans go about their business, and you are only minutes from Termini Station. From there you can get the Metro and go anywhere you wish. There is also a deli right across the street. The pizza is great and the bread is made fresh. I give this hotel 5 stars. Hope you enjoy the Mecenate Hotel as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed breakfast on the roof balcony”
Reviews.Author: Baltan
Reviews.Content: We booked online directly with the hotel. They proactively suggested they would arrange the transportation from the airport at 75 Euro. This was very convenient for the family of six people. Our family stayed for 4 nights at 2 rooms next to the hotel. The room was OK, spacious. One thing we liked most was the breakfast which was included. The food was great and we could also enjoy the view of the town from the other side of the restaurant. 5-10 minutes from Termini Station which was also convenient for us.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, friendly hotel with a superb rooftop terrace!”
Reviews.Author: sarlou82
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with our stay here, for two nights in very hot and very busy August. Staff were very courteous and helpful both on the front desk and in the restaurant at breakfast time. If you're travelling into or out of Rome by train or airport transfer bus it's ideal as it's less than 5 minutes walk from Termini station. To find it come out of Termini station on the side opposite to where the transfer buses stop, walk straight down Via Gilberti and you will come to the big square of Santa Maria Maggiore church. Turn to your left and the hotel is then on Via Carlo Alberto which should be straight ahead of you if you have followed these directions. There is a posh looking cafe on the corner and the hotel is immediately after that on the right hand side of the road. It may sound silly to give these directions but we walked around the outside of the church several times before we spotted the correct road and it was very hot! Although it's excellently located for the station this hotel is not in the main area for sites so we took lots of buses and the occasional metro. Not being in the middle of everything can be an advantage too as it was nice to return to the relatively quiet square after a day fighting your way through the tourist hoardes! Beware though as we found Rome hard to navigate since there are only a couple of metro lines, most of which do not run under the 'sites' (for obvious reasons as the ancient buildings might not take too kindly to being destabilised for an underground railway!). So, if you are trying to utilise public transport you will be taking a lot of buses and we found it hard to get on the right one, in the right direction and they were often full to bursting! If we visited again we might well consider buying a pass for one of the 'hop on hop off' tourist buses. Fortunately Termini train station is also a huge bus terminal so you can usually find a bus going there wherever you are in Rome. Like in many cities the area around the station is quite seedy and can be somewhat intimidating at night time. However, we too kept very alert and had no problems. In terms of the quality and value for money of the hotel room we were quite satisfied. We had room 516 which faces the central courtyard of the hotel. Whilst it would have been fabulous to have a view of the church we were quite happy with our room as you could see over the rooftops to the hills in the distance and get a taster of the residents of Rome living out their lives. Plus, since we didn't overlook a noisy street we were able to keep our window open all night, which was a blessing in the August heat! Yes the decor could be considered a little dated, but I have stayed in a dozen other european hotels with similar dark wood, chintzy wallpaper and brass fittings style decor and it's not unpleasant - and it is certainly not dirty! The bathroom was marble and brass, truly Italian style and yes, maybe a little dated, but again clean and workable with a vast array of complimentary toiletries, shaving kit, comb, shoe cleaning kit etc. The only thing that we would suggest is that if you are not a smoker make sure to request a 'non smoking room'. I did not realise that you can still smoke in Italian hotel rooms and there was a faint odour of cigarettes about our room which was unpleasant, especially since we don't smoke. I'm sure that had we addressed this to the concierge we may have been moved but we didn't bother since we were only there for 2 nights and didn't intend on spending much of that in our room. I completely agree with other reviewers that the hotel's crowning glory (literally!) is the rooftop terrace. The view of the church and over the surrounding area is fantastic and it was excellent to be able to eat your breakfast in such lovely surroundings. The breakfast spread was really good and perfectly what you would expect for a continental breakfast. Yes you do have to pay extra for a hot breakfast, but again this is quite normal for a european hotel. There is a great choice of cereals, fruit, hams, cheeses, bread rolls, jams, spreads and some fantastic looking (and tasting) croissants, doughnuts and pastries, which we know arrive fresh daily as we saw them being delivered! We didn't dine in the hotel other than breakfast as we agree with a previous reviewer that Rome is full of restaurants where you can go and soak up the atmosphere so you'd really be missing out if you eat in your hotel. The only other thing to add about this hotel are a few tips about the surrounding area if you do stay here. Turn right out of the hotel and explore the area at the other end of the Via Carlo Alberto where there is a typical european square park with iron railings and all the buildings around the square have huge arches that you can walk through in the shade. It was obviously once a grand area and is now populated with an interesting mix of shops and food outlets. I think it would be a good place to go if you're looking to buy presents outside of the usual tourist traps. There were lots of cheaper clothes shops, jewellery stores, electronic shops and a couple of shops selling nick-nacks and souvaniers for less than the busier tourist areas. There's also a couple of restaurants and cafes, some serving typical Roman fayre but some serving other different types of ethnic foods such as Indian food and halal food, if you fancied a break from pizza and pasta. Definitely go into the the Santa Maria Maggiore church - it's beautiful! It's more the size of a cathedral than a church, with beautiful intricate mosaic work. It also has a great feel of a true working church rather than just a tourist attraction. We ate lunch at the restaurant on the left of the church square (as you face the front facade of the church). The food was tasty and we would return. The place is small on the outside but inside it's huge and looks like the sort of place locals take a working lunch, with good honest food (obviously it was quite empty in August during the summer feria). We took the 'tourist menu' which was 10 euros each for a pizza/pasta and a carafe of wine. However I did notice that it would actually have been cheaper if we had ordered the items individually so do bare this in mind. All in all we enjoyed our two night stay at the Mecanate Palace. We thought it was reasonably good value for money - not exactly cheap but mostly worth what we paid, especially if you consider the good breakfast included in the price where breakfast was offered in a cafe down the road for 10 euros each! If we came back to Rome we'd probably try to stay somewhere within walking distance of the main tourist sites as the travel by bus was not enjoyable. However, if we needed a hotel for a comfortable stay within very easy and quick reach of the train station we would readily consider the Mecanate Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, helpful staff and good location.”
Reviews.Author: Lulew81
Reviews.Content: We had a small but clean and tidy room (room 304). The staff were helpful even drawing onto maps the best routes to take. The view from the roof terrace was lovely and watching the sun set over the sky line of Rome was just beautiful! Good location with easy walking distance to the majority of the sites. My only real complaint is the price of any drink (both alcoholic or soft drinks) were very expensive but this is true for most of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Highly recommend Rome and this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MikeP54
Reviews.Content: Front staff was very friendly and helpful. Located several blocks from metro, which was extremely convenient. Small bathroom, but fulfilled needs. Free continental breakfast was adequate. Had lunch once which was excellent and cheaper than neighboring cafe'. Grocery store across the street had everything we needed, including a large beer and wine selection. Did not utilize rooftop bar but had lunch on the rooftop (from the grocery store) which had great views of the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore (a spectactular church) and decent views of the Colliseum. Hotel is close to the Colliseum but some distance from piazza navona/Trevi fountain/Spanish Steps area. We walked several times to these sites including at midnight, without issue but its a hike. Helps burn off all the wine calories. The subway is the furtheset underground I've seen but was safe and efficient. No issues w/ pickpockets (unlike Barcelona) but had a moneybelt (which I highly recommend). Villa Borghese was nice while the Vatican/Sistene chapel/St Peters was absolutely awesome. Rome was spectacular. I can't wait to go back. Would stay at the Mecenate Palace in a heartbeat. Get the Roma pass, it covers 2 sites (ie Colliseum, Villa Borghese) and metro/bus for 2 days and order tix for Vatican online (its 4 euro more but saved 1-2 hrs in line).

Reviews.Title: “Great value, spacious room, really enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: TerryinAylmer
Reviews.Content: With the breakfast included, made it an even better value. Courteous staff, well located near subway, train terminus and within a short walk of the Colliseum and other interesting attractions. Use the subway, it's cheap, safe and stops at tourist attractions. For traonsport to the airport, it costs around 50 euros, so try a limo or even the train, the terminus is very close.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great location to see the main attractions of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Lynda442
Reviews.Content: The Mecenate Palace was actually our third choice of hotel. We had stayed in the Albergo del Senato on our first trip to Rome, and the staff there spoiled us I suppose, but the agency we went through this trip didn't list it as one of our choices, so we decided on another hotel close to the Trevi Fountain. However, we had read some not-so-good reviews of our second choice hotel here on Trip Advisor. When we contacted the agency, their representative gave us three other choices, and after consulting a map and reading up on these hotels, the Mecenate Palace seemed the best choice out of the three. The hotel itself wasn't bad; in fact, the room was nice although the mattress was a bit hard. The room was large enough and clean, the bathroom fine. The view from our room was nice, too, overlooking a tree lined avenue. The rooftop restaurant and bar is really the main reason to stay at this hotel though. The view of the Church of Santa Maria Maggiore right across the piazza from the hotel is quite impressive from there, and the food is very good--they have a chocolate cake to die for. However, the special of the evening stayed the same two out of the three nights we were there. The hotel is also located several miles from most of Rome's major attractions, such as the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, the Vatican, and the ruins of ancient Rome including the Colosseum. We had to take public transportation everywhere we went. We couldn't always depend on the staff behind the reception desk to be friendly either. There was one concierge that was quite helpful; however, he was only there in the mornings. Others seemed a bit put out with us when we asked questions. If you want to walk to the main Roman attractions from your hotel, then this is probably not the place to stay unless you don't mind reading maps, asking for lots of directions from the locals, and hiking a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Just as great as last time!”
Reviews.Author: melchior1
Reviews.Content: We have just had a short stay of 5 nights at this hotel, our second time staying there but definitely not our last! Wonderful location, walking distance from Termini station, close to Colosseum and Roman Forum, good restaurants (Ristorante Strega is a short walk), supermarket and shops nearby. The hotel itself is lovely, situated opposite Santa Maria Maggiore, has a wonderful rooftop breakfast room with breathtaking views and very helpful staff. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything & Very Helpful”
Reviews.Author: TerpinVA
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Mecenate Palace Hotel was extremely helpful. We drove to the hotel from a villa in Tuscany and they were great in helping us return our rental car to the train station (very close) rather than the airport (not so close). Breakfast up on the terrace was a great way to start the day. The hotel is close to Termini (train station) and the metro and easy walking to the sites in Rome. The gelato shop just down the street was a favorite of our kids.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated but fine”
Reviews.Author: flyfishflyfish
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean enough, but the price wasn't worth it. The price gets you a nice private bathroom and breakfast, nothing more. Also, the neighborhood is probably safe enough but a little bit sketchy by night. I didn't always feel comfortable with my surroundings when my female friend and I were walking home from eating and drinking out. We stayed alert though and had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: darcysmile
Reviews.Content: I took a chance and tried booking our European hotels through Priceline for the first time. Boy, did that go well! Both in Rome and Paris, we were able to get a much higher class hotel than we could have afforded otherwise. Mecenate Palace was lovely except for one issue ... when my credit card was stolen and I had to call my bank, NO ONE on their staff was able to help me dial the states! It was ridiculous - and I have hundreds of euros worth of phone bills to prove just how ridiculous it was. That aside, the room was very beautiful. Yes older, but more in a historical way than an outdated one. And that's what we were hoping for - something with a little history. And things that should be updated WERE updated, so that was nice. LOVELY marble tub, for example. The breakfast on the roof each morning was really lovely and a nice addition. Sliced meats and cheeses, breads, fresh kiwi, cereal, etc. Staff was very friendly. The only drawback to this hotel is the location, but it's not a BAD location, it's just not as central to the main sights as some other in-town hotels are. You can still walk everywhere, but I think if we went again I'd aim for a hotel at/near the Pantheon. HOWEVER, this hotel IS right next to the square where many of the guided tours depart from, so THAT was a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...amenities”
Reviews.Author: Madalyn810
Reviews.Content: Situated a short 3 block walk from the Termini just opposite the beautiful Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore, the Mecenate Palace is conveniently located for public transportation and walking to the Colosseum and other attractions. There is a lovely open air cafe just next door that served excellent gelati, coffee and luncheon fare. We enjoyed an extensive breakfast in the roof-top terrace: assorted cereals, fresh fruits, yoghurts, breads and pastries, meats and cheeses in the European tradition. Service was excellent and the terrace is open for drinks in the evening providing colorful sunsets and a spectacular view of the city. Our room faced the Basilica which is on a busy traffic square but the soundproof windows ensured absolute quiet for late afternoon naps and peaceful nights. The room was nicely appointed, spotlessly clean and the bathroom was quite large by European standards and tiled in marble with a tub and shower. We never had need to call for any repairs or problems with the room. The desk staff helped arrange a couple of tours for us and were very accommodating. The Mecenate Palace was our home base for 5 days and we enjoyed every minute of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice rooms, Terrible customer service!!! Beware.”
Reviews.Author: RadCam66
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed in this hotel. We had booked a reservation for 4 rooms several months prior. When we arrived at the hotel, after traveling all morning, we were told that one of our rooms had been cancelled. The person at the front desk could not tell us who, or when our reservation had been cancelled. He shrugged and said that the hotel was completely full and that two groups in our party could share a room. No concessions were made and the person at the front desk was unfriendly and rude. We eventually ended up contracting two groups into one room and since we were only staying in Rome one night that sufficed. In addition, my Dad called down to ask where to obtain ice. He was told by the front desk that room service could bring the ice up for him. When the ice came to the door he was asked to pay 4 euros. He was told that the 4 euros were the room service charge. In addition, the ice container could not fit in the refridgerator. How ridiculous is that? Not only was he not told that there was a room service charge for ice, but when he refused to pay, the person at the front desk (different from before) was very nasty. To cut a long story short, my Dad went and got the ice himself. We were so disappointed in the service, epecially after reading so many rave reviews of this hotel. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: bostoniantraveler4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very charming and seemed very traditionally Italian. The rooms were older but clean, and were decorated in florals and lots of draping fabric. The roof terrace was the best part - you can see the lights of the city and enjoy a great glass of wine, or eat dinner up there if you prefer. The worst part was that they lost our reservation and put us in another hotel for one of our three nights as a result. We were not compensated appropriately for the inconvenience of having to move hotels that night and back the next morning. Only after I complained for five minutes did they take 14 euro off of our drink bill upon checkout. I felt strongly that they should have taken at least half of the night's rate for the night we were at the other hotel off the bill, if not the whole thing. It's unfortunate, but I would be very hesitant to book here again because of this negative experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and definately recommend it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JLJ101
Reviews.Content: We were more than surprised at the courteous and polite staff right from the start. They helped us with everything and anything we needed from taxi service to setting up tours of the Vatican. The staff spoke great English which was very helpful as well. The rooms were very nice and clean (ask for a room with a view of the Santa Maria Maggiore). The bed we had was very comfortable and the air conditioning worked very well. The roof top restaurant and bar had not only spectacular views of Rome but the staff was so friendly and helpful with suggestions of places to visit and eat. The location of the hotel was excellent. Easy walking distance to the Colosseum, and all other must see sites in the city. The only site we took a taxi to was the Vatican. We highly recommend the hotel to anyone traveling to Rome with or without children. Loved it!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and conveniently located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gung_ho_in_TO
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights during a week long vacation throughout Italy. Hotel is VERY close to the Termini train station (~5 minutes once you get your bearings). It's on a relatively quiet street and is across the street from a nice church (the Pope was there one evening). It's close to various subway stops and various sites too. There's plenty of restaurants/patios and a few gelato places nearby as well. The room's pretty small as is the bathroom (esp. for two people) but that's par for the course in Italy. There's a safety box and a minibar. There was a small computer-like tv screen but no english channels. There's a small lift/elevator but the stairs are convenient too. The roof top patio is pretty nice (great view of the church), which is where you can have a drink, breakfast (free buffet) and lounge on some comfy seats. There is also a computer and printer in the foyer to use, which was helpful if not a bit pricey (Euro6/hr I think), although, I don't think we were charged for using it. Breakfast was ok - bread, pastries, yogurt, luncheon meats, fruit (canned), and juices. Pretty basic stuff but edible. There is a bar/restaurant on the main floor as well. We always ate out for lunch and dinner. The staff were pleasant although, when we inquired about how to avoid the lineups at the Vatican we were told to join a tour group (for ~Euro60+/pp but weren't told about buying a ticket online for ~Euro18 in advance to avoid the lineups - fyi - there were no lines early aft). Our stay was both very comfortable and conviently located and we would recommend this place. (Note, I believe they lock the doors at 1am so double check that if you're planning to be out late).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Would stay there again if return to Rome”
Reviews.Author: kars_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so beautiful and clean. Majority of staff spoke english and were so helpful. The beds in the deluxe rooms are wonderful (foam), really good if you have a back condition. We had a room overlooking the square, it was beautiful! Their breakfasts were really good, meats, cheese, rolls, cereal, yogurt and fruit. I really enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rhondamckane
Reviews.Content: Having arrived at the hotel we had originally booked to find it very unsatisfactory (HOTEL BRASILE) we found mecenate palace on the internet. It was lovely and a proper 4*. We breathed a sigh of relief on walking into the foyer and the roof top restaurant gave amazing views of the city. The mecenate palace made the difference to our trip which could have been ruined by nasty accommodation. Hotel Brasile was booked by my friend and when i reviewed it on trip advisor it was poor and unfortunately lived up to expectations. A lesson to be learned ' always check trip advisor before booking!'

Reviews.Title: “Old and dirty”
Reviews.Author: ArinaGavrilova
Reviews.Content: Didn't like the hotel - stayed there with parents (the trip was my present for them). The hotel claims to be 4+, but it's nothing even close. In reality, i think about 15 years ago it was 4 (no +), but since then no reparation was made. The rooms are pretty dirty, the shower and bath were rusty! We booked a suite. For the hotel in Rome the room was rather big, but the heating system was terrible and my dad got sick. The staff is quite pleasant, breackfast ok, but it's definitly not worth the money paid. A general tip: when choosing a hotel in Rome pay special attention to the words "recently renovated" - they are important

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: dub24046
Reviews.Content: I had some reservations about the location close to Termini but these were unfounded. We had a good sized room on the 5th floor with a great view of the Basillica and square. The bathroom was spacious and the room had tea/coffee making facilities, a safe, air conditioning and an very modern TV.The staff were friendly and helpful at all times. The roof top restaurant was an excellent location but breakfast was a bit disappointing. There was a great selection of pastries (not my choice in the morning) but little variety of bread. Cereals, meats and cheeses were available but the selection was limited. Most disapponting was the use of juices from packs and tinned fruits. There was an extra charge for cooked eggs. The hotel is within walking distance of many of the sights and very close to a metro stop. I would advise against using Termini metro as there is a lot of walking involved. Emmanuelle on Line A is very close. Buses and tram lines are also close. A three day ticket for all public transport at 11 euro is very good value. We found it invaluable when caught in the rain and took an unscheduled bus tour on no. 71. The hotel provided transport to the airport for 55 euro. While expensive, we thought it worthwhile after an early start. All in all, I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “location was great, but staff was anything but friendly”
Reviews.Author: barbarapitts
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was great. The rooms were actually fairly large by European standards. The staff, however, was anything but friendly. We felt like we were really bothering any of them when we asked for anything. The happy hour and breakfast on the top floor was great, and so was the view. I would recommend this hotel if you don't mind being treated like a third class citizen.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place and people 1”
Reviews.Author: liviusorin
Reviews.Content: I've visited Rome city . It's indeed a great place for visiting ! I've stayed near the S.Maria Maggiore basilica . Rome is a city that might be admired by walking :piazza di Spagna,Il Pantheon,Fontana di Trevi,Il Colosseo,Altare della Patria are beautiful places very close to each other ! My great dissapoitment is regarding the hotel ! I booked a superior room and I got a standard one at the same price (be aware of it )! As I told Rome is a lovely place ! When you are in Rome do as Rome does ! So I said 'thank you!' and I really enjoyed my stay !

Reviews.Title: “Small friendly hotel - Great location, excellent front office staff, very comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mecenate Palace is located within walking distance (as tourists are wont to walk!) of all the sights you want to see in Ancient Rome. Also only a 10 minute walk to the Vito Emmanuelle Metro station on the Red Line that will take you to the Vatican in 15 minutes. Many grocery stores and Eaterias (pardon the expression - all the trattorias and pizzerias etc.) are close at hand. Cabs to Piazza Popollo and the Via Corso were about 7 Euro one way. The Hotel arranged for a taxi to pick us up at FCO - and when our flight was delayed at Munich - quickly re-scheduled the pick-up time. The journey took about 45 minutes at mid-day on a weekday. We spent 4 nights at the hotel with 2 teenage kids - although we spent most days outside the room, tramping around Rome and more - returning to clean comfortable rooms was a very pleasant experience. The rooms were comfortable - we had 2 adjoining rooms - the bathrooms were clean and comfortable - there was running hot water at all times, adequate supply of Italian and fluffy towels. Since we returned late each night the rooms being tightly insulated against street noise was a great plus. There was a somewhat slow wifi connection in the hotel, however the 3 day free wifi package was very useful in catching up on email, browsing etc. Wifi charges were an extra 7 Euro per day after the package expired. Would have liked a few extra power points for charging all the things that need to be charged - cellphones/cameras/ipods etc. Breakfast on the roofop terrace was the one sub-par experience - only cold breakfast of cerealss, bread and cheeses - not a good way to prepare for a long day out for most tourists. Service wasnt great - though staff were friendly - dishes werent cleared off the tables quickly enough. The front office staff was extremely efficient and helpful - we even asked for and got packed breakfast in a box for an early trip to Pompeii and Sorrento. They rescheduled the airport pickup without a murmur when we called to say that we had missed our connecting flight to Rome. All in all - a place we will recommend to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stevetharp
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, free breakfast great, within walking distance from termini station and colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: LondonMickeyp
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, well located in the centre of Rome and only 5 minute walk from the main train station, Termini so you can get train straight from the airport. The hotel had a beautiful roof terrace bar/restaurant .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LauraLoretti
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March and had a great time. Many thanks to Roberto at Reception who was really helpful. The breakfast area is situated on the top floor and offers amazing views of the surroundings. Close to Termini Station, therefore handy to get to the airport. Would definitely recommend for a romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “I am a world traveler & this hotel gets my highest recommendation!”
Reviews.Author: elizscarb
Reviews.Content: We agonized over making room reservations for our most recent trip to Europe because we had never been to Rome and had no idea where to stay. This hotel was clean, elegant, charming and in a great location. Just a few blocks from the Metro (which was easier to navigate than some I've used in the US) and close to restaraunts/shops. We arrived b y train. The hotel is just 4 blocks from the Termini station. Breakfast was included and we enjoyed it very much. The staff all spoke English (which I don't expect but was a pleasant surprise) and they went out of their way to make our stay great. I will return to the Macenate Palace whenever I am in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, friendly, handy”
Reviews.Author: MikeOpollo
Reviews.Content: 4th floor superior rooms comfortable and quiet, decorated in a style not of this millenia but fitting for the hotel setting and Rome. Breakfast cold continental buffet and cereals, hot breakfast an extra euro 4 ! coffee strong and plentiful you must add hotel tax onto your original price..not explained when we booked :-euro 6 / night Welcoming at the reception and very helpful Good location for everything in Rome. Terminii just up the road for your open topped bus tour (Hop on hop off) Euro 15

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: PatrickStafford
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best hotel we have ever stayed in Rome. We were able to walk to most of the sights and only used the bus and Metro on a couple of occasions. The hotel is charming with the dining room at the top with lovely views. Our accommodation was a few yards from the main hotel but was set within a terrace garden with our own front door to our room. It was really pretty and it was lovely to have our own outside space shared with about 5 other rooms around the terrace. The room was very clean and comfortable and the bathroom was large and well-equipped (even a jacuzzi bath) The staff were very welcoming and helpful. Breakfast was also very good with plenty of choice of fresh food. The downside to the hotel was the restaurant for evening dining. The food was dreadful and overpriced but there are lots of good eating places around the vicinity so no need to use the hotel restaurant. Also, there is a lovely bar where it is nice to relax and chat after a tiring day, but it closes at 7pm!!! It should stay open and guest not have to go to the restaurant if they want a drink. We would definitely stay at this hotel next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Jenks333
Reviews.Content: Seventeen of us from one church stayed in a variety of rooms on several different floors for eight days. We had a great stay. The staff were marvelously helpful, the rooms were clean, the breakfast was good, the location was superb. Good variety of eateries nearby and grocery stores as well. Easy access to the Metro. Be sure to see St Prassede, a nearby but not always advertised church; awesome mosaics. The only fly in the ointment was the exorbitant cost of wireless internet (10 euros for 24 hours!). I will definitely stay here the next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sciontc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in walking distance of major sites like the Coloseum and Roman Forum. The beautiful Santa Maria Maggiore Church is right across the street. Termini Station is three blocks away where bus, metro, and train transportation is available. There is a supermarket across the street from the hotel and there are many reasonably priced restaurants in the immediate area. My hotel room on the fifth floor was quiet, clean, and comfortable. The front desk people were helpful and cordial.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MrTSomerset
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel situated about 10 minutes walk from the Termini (Railway/bus station) and 20 minutes to the Colleseum. From the moment we arrived we felt most welcome, the receptionist was helpful, professional and efficient. The lobby, bar and rooms were all clean and tidy. Our room didn't have a spectacular view but then we didn't spend that much time in there. The roof top terrace gave a spectacular vantage point across Rome. The resturant was located on the roof terrance and served a good contintal breakfast and evening four course meal. The food was excellant throughout our stay. A good little tip is to take one of the address cards from the reception desk and when you want to get a taxi back show them the card, which proved useful as my pronounciation of the hotel name resulted in a few puzzled looks to start with. If you have never been to Rome before, it is worth noting that it is not cheap especially if you eat around the main tourist sites so it is worth trying to go to where the locals eat. All in all this is a great hotel, reasonably priced and in a good location. We would certaily return to Rome and use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: NYTravel23
Reviews.Content: My kids and I stayed at the Mecenate Palace Hotel in December, 2010. it's a lovely place in a great location just 20 minute or so walk from the Spanish Steps. We had three single beds located in an annex next to the hotel. The hotel staff was very nice and the included breakfast was fantastic. Nice selection, fresh, and clean. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: joy14607
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel good breakfast,comfortable bed and warm.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room. Friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jimazing
Reviews.Content: Easy walking distance from the train station and the Colosseum. The staff was very helpful. Breakfast was included in the room rate and was good. The roast pork at dinner was wonderful! Don't waste your time with the internet through the TV. It is expensive and totally frustrating. Wireless Internet was difficult to get in our room at first. After the first day, it worked just fine. Not sure why, but they refunded the price for the first day since it didn't work. If you get to meet Vito, sometimes the bartender, sometimes the waiter in the restaurant, be sure to tell him that Jim said hello. :-) He was very friendly and engaging with us.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: BritinOzPerth
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very convenient position. My room was comfortable but small. The shower, however, was very badly designed. The door opened inwards, and, once inside the shower, to shut the door you had to press into a corner against freezing cold tiles in order to close it. A larger person could not have closed the door. The roof top restaurant was delightful, with wonderful views, and the breakfasts were good. I spent the day before I left sightseeing. On my return I got ready for dinner - only to find that my make-up bag and contents, and hair brush, had disappeared! I searched the room for them but they were gone, obviously stolen. I reported the theft to reception who said they couldn't do anything until the following morning. The next day the assistant manager and the housekeeper came to my room and searched it, but obviously couldn't find the missing items. They didn't seem particularly perturbed. I managed to replace most of the items at a cost of over 80 euros, and asked if the hotel would reimburse me as I knew I couldnn't claim off my own insurance. I was told to write to the hotel on my return home, and perhaps the hotel insurance would refund the cost. I have written to the hotel twice and haven't even had the courtesy of an acknowledgement. I am very upset and disgusted by the whole incident and definitely would not recommend that anyone should stay at the Mecenate Palace. I placed my passport and other valuables in the room safe, but never imagined that my makeup would be stolen!

Reviews.Title: “Great pick”
Reviews.Author: m747p
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights with my 12 year old son. The hotel is very cute, clean, professional service, rooms large (for Europe), nice sized bathroom, breakfast decent for Europe and everything worked and was clean. Beds a bit on the soft side. I would change for more firm ones. CNN & BBC in English. The hotel is walking distance (3 minutes by foot) from Termini station which is a great 30 minute connection from Rome's airport (14 Euro one way, kids under 12 years go free). 8 minute walk to Coliseum and many other attractions are a nice walk from hotel (that's also a great way we like to get to see the city, we walk a lot). The Metro is on the corner, also 3 minutes away. 1 Euro per leg. A near by restaurant we liked a lot is called Cecio Tratoria.

Reviews.Title: “A beatiful location and service for your dollar”
Reviews.Author: SeaBrat
Reviews.Content: We paid just a little extra to overlook the Santa Maria Maggiore. The concierge was great. They called taxis and answered every question or called to find the answer. Breakfast was good enough that we skipped lunch every day. There are two supermercatos (supermarkets). We used these for a small dinner with wine every night. It is very close and the termini train station. Nice neighborhood. We could not ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: seivad79
Reviews.Content: Can not fault this Hotel at all. We payed a little extra in order to stay at the Executive rooms, the price we paid we the same prices I have payed for a normal room normally in Rome. Excellant location, staff were great, Breakfast was nice. ( Can i really go without any negatives?) Hm, okay the TV in the Executive room is around the corner from the bed, some people may like to watch television in bed! Well Done Mecenate Palace Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Very nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: Becky1120
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a new Executive Wing with a separate entrance. The rooms are large and each one has a Jacuzzi. The rooms in the original building are very nice as well. There is a roof top restaurant that is beautiful. The breakfast buffet was wonderful. It is located close to the train station, so it saves a good deal of money on taxis. I couldn't get the lock open on my suitcase, so I called the front desk. Within minutes, someone was up with clippers to break the lock. The service was amazing. We had a very nice experience at this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great service, very clean, quiet”
Reviews.Author: Garydiane
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed 10 days; Lara, Andre, Vito terrific service. Room 10 was very quiet. Terrace Bar is a bonus great views.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Customer Service ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: conniebonnie
Reviews.Content: The location was convenient; the room and public areas were charming and very well maintained; and the Gelateria next door was great. But the best thing about the Mecenate Palace was its PEOPLE. The front desk gentlemen were friendly, efficient, funny, and very helpful. The housekeeping was impeccable. And the VERY BEST was Mr. Andrea Bianchi--the Dining Room Manager, and his staff. In all my years of travelling, I have never been treated so well. The rooftop restaurant is beautiful and clean and charming. The breakfast buffet was the best I've ever had. And the staff WORKED AND RAN CONSTANTLY to make sure everything was fresh, replenished, and exactly to our liking. Thank you all for a wonderful four-day stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheOranges
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. We are not big fans of large, noisey cities, but the oasis on the hotel roof (bar and restaurant) was worth the stay, all by itself. We went up and watched the sunset every evening. The rooms are comfortable and the location is perfect for sightseeing. If you have to stay in Rome, this is a nice place to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Thanks to great staff”
Reviews.Author: ScotiaBill
Reviews.Content: The room (Fourth Floor) in our hotel had a great view which looked straight onto Santa Maria Maggiore and although it was at a busy roundabout we were not disturbed by the traffic. The room was relatively small but was clean and had most of the usual items you look for in a modern hotel, room-safe, nice bathroom with stand up shower, hairdrier, etc. Eating breakfast on the roof terrace is lovely, we were fortunate to have superb weather for the five days we were in Rome. All the staff here as well as througout the hotel were friendly, helpful and where my wife's Italian (All the Italians in Rome appreciate it if you try to speak Italian.) was not sufficient, all the staff had an excellent grasp of English. We would definitely stay here again. As the hotel is centrally located, only 400 metres from the main train and bus terminus, it was easy to get about to all the main tourist attractions. The first day we were in Rome we paid for an open-topped tour bus, take the 48 hour ticket which can be extended by another 24 hours for only another 5 Euros, and stayed on the bus for the full circuit (About two hours) and this gives you a perspective of where all the main tourist attractions are in relation to one another.

Reviews.Title: “Abolutely worth the price”
Reviews.Author: danfrankel
Reviews.Content: Very good standard. Nice rooms. Excellent location, just by S:ta Maria Maggiore, near the subway and train station. Walking distance to Forum Romanum. Breakfast was OK. Eating out in Rome is expensive but there is a small Chinese restaurant on Via Carlo Alberte. Very cheap and the best food we had in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location, friendly staff, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucyandricki
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Italy and so our first hotel experience in Italy and we were pleased. We had a short walk from the Termini Station and it took a couple of minutes to find the hotel. We had a lovely room looking over the Piazza SantaMaria Maggiore. There is a grocery store a short walk across the street anda great restaurant in front of the hotel. We enjoyed our breakfasts on the terrace overlooking the city of Rome. What better way to start the day. We found it an easy walk to the Termini Station where we took advantage of the Public Transit System. We would get up each morning and go sight seeing, then return to the hotel for a break and go back out for the evening, We had a fabulous visit in Rome and this hotel was a big part of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms in the court yard but...”
Reviews.Author: WTBTDT
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, nice large rooms for a family in the courtyard adjacent to the hotel. Only draw back, is that they are below apartments, which can get noisy at night. Other then that excellent space, great staff. Check out the view from the roof top restaurant, exceptional, as was the breakfast. We will stay here again, very close to the train station and busses.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is ok, some guests need better manners”
Reviews.Author: timbouktou
Reviews.Content: When you read some of the reviews here, you really wonder have these people never been out of their flat or hillbilly location , ever?? To their great dissapointment, I must clarify one or two things when you book a hotel: 1:there can be mixups with a booking, be this on your booking sites behalf or the hotels, but it does happen, so live with it. There are worse things, than beeing transfered to a nearby hotel. 2:if you pay for an ordinary room, this is what you get, not a de luxe as you have to pay more for that,. so in short, if you are travelling on a budget,: live with the results of staying in a modest room with no extras ,or get a new job so you can afford the upgrade. 3.As for staff courtesy: If you behave like a 1930s colonialist when you deal with hotel staff, expect their contempt for you in return.
