As for this hotel-What is there to complain about? staff is nice when you are nice, breakfast is served effeciently, the rooms are clean and nice, . Only thing I could fault them on, was that the star spangled banner outside the hotels facade, was flying upside down, but since reading some of the reviews here, I start to understand why they keep that flag in such a manner..

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE ACCOMODATIONS”
Reviews.Author: aberdeen2009
Reviews.Content: After being concerned about the size of hotel rooms in Europe, I did research on the web and found that the Mecenate Palace has an adjacent/annex building (next door to the main building), which contains average size rooms (as a matter of fact, I'll say that it contains large size rooms). My husband, my teenage daughter and I stayed in the same room and did not trip over each other. Besides, we had 3 large suitcases and 3 carry-ons, and had ample room on the floor to store them. Most of the amenities in the room were above average (bed, dresser, closet). The beds were comfortable (double beds and one single). The double beds (which are placed together) are larger than our known King Size bed (in the United States). Besides the normal amenities in the bathroom (which were above average), it contained a bidet and a hair dryer. Do not expect to enjoy cable TV there with English stations except for CNN and BBC news. Breakfast was included in the price of my stay and it was pretty good. It was buffet style (all you can eat). Besides coffee and tea, there was toast, bagels, muffins, salami, ham, different types of cheeses, jellies and jams, butter, fruits, juices, water, etc. However, if one wanted to eat eggs, that would cost approximately 7 euros. The service from the front desk and house-keeping was also prompt. During my 4 day stay there, I called on two occasions with requests, and within 5 minutes, both requests were taken care of. I recommend staying in the annex (Executive Room). The famous Santa Maria Magliore church is within a short walking distance (1 block); also, near the church is a bus stop where many of the tour buses stop (hop-on, hop-off tours), and a few good restaurants near the tours bus stop (1 block). I would definitely stay at that hotel again when I return to Rome for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice . . . but . . .”
Reviews.Author: BalanceSeeker2
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation at a promotional 5% discounted rate. Received an email suggesting this promo rate was not available then hours later received a confirmation for the regular rate. Also . . . in my reservation request . . . I requested a room in the new section of the hotel as suggested by others and found out upon arrival that the room that was confirmed was not in this area of the hotel. The front desk staff was very (very) inflexible and difficult to deal with and as such satisfaction for resolving the issue(s) were not resolved. Based on staff attitude and performance I WOULD NOT suggest using this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in walking distance of most sites in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TexasDynamite
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and great views from the top terrace where breakfast was served and Happy Hour in the afternoons. Very helpful and accommodating to visitors. We were just a few blocks from the train station and across from one of the historical churches, San Maria Maggiore. The views from the terrace at night was worth the stay. Breakfast was sufficient for the day. The rooms were lovely, clean and small but we were not in the rooms very much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a fairly good location”
Reviews.Author: EB0109
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel after a short and fairly dicey walk from the train station. The Mecenate Palace is just on the edge of the dodgy Termini area so when you cross the road to the hotel it's fine but before that I was holding onto my luggage very tightly! Our room overlooked the Santa Maria Maggiore Church which was a lovely view. Breakfast was nice which we ate in the rooftop restaurant (there is also a bar up there but a bit pricey). Overall it is a good location, only 15 minutes walk to the Collisseum and there is a sightseeing bus stop just opposite which we used during the 2 days we were there. Nothing stands out at this hotel but for the price and location we were happy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: EdZafe
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Mecenate Palace in Rome in May/June 2010. At first we were a bit disappointed that we were being taken to an annex a few doors down the street from the hotel lobby, but ultimately were very pleased with the modern room and the quiet courtyard (which I have a hunch may not have been the case with rooms in the hotel proper, tho have no idea). Not having to go thru the hotel lobby to go to/from our room, it almost felt like we had our own private apartment in Rome (and it did share an entrance was used for private apartments) The hotel is quite convenient to the Termini Station (where we arrived via Florence) and to the subway, either back to Termini or Vittorio Emanuele station for the red (?) line that can get you to Trevi, Spanish Steps or the Vatican. My only (and quite minor) issue re: the hotel was the location. While Rome is pretty contained, it just didn't seem like any of the major tourists sites were close enough to just drop-in/pass-by when near the hotel. But again, the location provided no hindrance to seeing everything that Rome has to offer and just used the hotel for sleep or midday rest. You don't go to Italy to spend time in a hotel room! The breakfast buffet was totally fine for what one should expect from a European breakfast (very little protein... lots of breads, fruit, cheese, deli meat pastry) and we always tried to make it to the rooftop terrace for happy hour, when you get a bit of a break on the over-priced drinks (but again, what do you expect!?), but the view is wonderful. Definitely would recommend the hotel's gelato shop, one of the best bargains of our entire Italy trip and a refreshing and delicious end to most of our exhausting days out exploring Rome. My one caution would be to avoid the cafe at the corner, Antico Caffe Santamaria, it was the one place we felt scammed while in Italy (and if you check out their Trip Advisor reviews, you'll see we are/were not alone). We also arranged a private car service with the hotel to get us to the da Vinci/Fiumicino airport. I want to say it cost 50-60 (70?) Euro. We arrived in Italy via Venice and had no idea really how far out the airport was from the center of Rome, but given what was an extensive 30-45 minute ride, it was well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in quite a good location”
Reviews.Author: Lobow
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff very informative and helpful. We stayed in deluxe rooms and they were very nice. The view of the church was spectacular. Pay no attention to the negative reviews on this site, I don't know what some people are used to but the room my husband & I shared was more than adequate as was the room our friends on the 4th floor shared. The prices for drinks in the roof terrace bar were a little steep and they don't like you taking your own booze into your room, but we did it anyway. The rooms were kept beautifully clean each day. Breakfast was good and the evening meal was excellent value for 25euros each, although we only tried it for one night. The bar next to the hotel was very expensive for meals and if you walked a little way there were excellent choices of places to eat. We chose to get about using the tour bus 27 euros each for 48 hours use. You could hop on and off at the different tourists attractions from 9.45 am to 6.30pm. However, be prepared to fight your way on as some of the other Europeans do not believe in queuing and they were quite rude barging you out of the way to get on first. The Piazzo Novana is a nice area to eat and see the street artists and buskers. We paid for guides to take us round the major attractions to avoid the large queues it cost a bit more but it was worth it, all our guides were very informative. If we ever return to Rome we would have no hesitation in staying at the same hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and rooftop restuarant was what we needed”
Reviews.Author: morris-travella
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by friendly staff and shown to our room which was number 421 overlooking the Bastile Santa Maria Mangalore chapel. The room was sufficient for our 7 night stay. The bathroom was good size with double wash bowl and seperate toilet and shower over the bath was good. No bottles of water provided for free but the water was nice to drink from the tap. My wife suffers from irritable bowel syndrome but had no problems with the water. The windows were double glazed but could be opened and they certainly kept out the noise as too the drapes were dark and we slept in a couple of times due to this. The breakfast was ideal and was included in the price. The roof top resturant is also where you have breakfast and the view was magnificent. No smoking under the roof line but outside, yes they smoke even if you are eating at the next table. We got up and moved one day and expressed our dissappointment that this still happens so be warned. The food was all cereals including coco pops which I love, ham, meats and cheese, yummy yogarts, fruits and lots of fatening pastries. Bread for toast and all. If you wanted a cooked breakfast, I think Bacon and Eggs was 5 euro. Breakfast was from 7-10am. 5 Euro and hour for internet but there are internet cafes around for half the price but we preferred the security of the Hotel. The lift is fairly small but not as small as Paris. The roof top restuarant is on the 6th floor and they have nice drinks, cocktails and great food. We ate there a couple of times for it was about 28 euro for 2 course meals I seem to remember that. We found a nice restaurant not too far away that had nice steak and pasta. Plenty around so head for where the tram is and follow your nose. The safe in the room is small and requires more buttons to be pushed then usual and lighting is very dark trying to see the keypad was a bit daunting but if you have a mobile, this helps. The tv is really a PC monitor but it was ok. Strange there was no clock in the room so pack an alarm clock just in case. They say they read Trip advisor to gather intel so maybe one might get put in there!!! Hi Vino.....Make sure you say hi to Vino for he is a great guy and very helpful in showing us directions. Now around the Hotel. If you go Right from the Hotel about 100m there is the train station. If you go left and then cross the predestrian crossing to the right (be careful, they won't stop unless you are in front of their bike or car) then walk left and on the bend there is a supermarket under ground with good prices. I bought 4 Coke zero 600ml botles for 3.40euro. The Hotel mini bar has them for 3euro each. It has all normal supermarket things. There is also a shop lovey (my wife) loved, called UPIM clothes for lovey so she was happy. Buy your tickets online to coluseum or vatican for the queues were gigantic. The hop on hop off bus stops near the hotel next to Maia Mangalore to the left side near the tourist info booth. Be warned, if you sit down to eat or drink, you will be charged double. That is the case everywhere. From the cafe to the left of the Hotel next to the one which has coca cola unbrellas, we got cheese roll, cake, bottle 600ml coke and 600m fruit drink 22 euro. I nearly had a heart attack and thought they were rip offs but others places did the same. If you like Latte's.....forget it they don't know what you are talking about so stick to Cappacino and you'll be fine. All ATM's don't offer multible accounts to choose. We loaded up our Visa and savings and cheque and all money we withdrew, came out of visa. Keep your emtpy water bottles for there are a few fountains around that give you nice cool clean water for free. Do the Isle of Capri tour and take the chair lift from Anna Capri to the top. Breath taking views. Also spend 25euro and do the blue grotto. Same tour but if you are clastaphobic, don't for they take you into a cavern in which you have to nearly lie down in a small row boat to get into the entrance but it is a must thing to do. 7 nights was too much in Rome for us. 3-4 nights would have been ample. Met a lot of people who were off to Venice and florence by train. We will do that next time. Would we stay in Mercenta Palace again, yep and even ask for room 421 again. We enjoyed our stay now its off to Paris. If you want to ask me anymore questions, please email me on ian.morris@nn.com.au. Have a good trip and enjoy Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: Williamstkj
Reviews.Content: Having trawled the internet to find a hotel that met everything we were looking for, I booked 3 double rooms at the Mecenate Palace Hotel for 6 days between 30th May and 4th June 2010. I could not have chosen a better hotel than this. We upgraded to Deluxe Rooms with views overlooking the Basilica Maria Maggiore as the Pope was due to deliver a service on the steps of the Basilica on 3rd June. However, at the very last minute, an hour or so before he was due, the Pope’s visit was cancelled, due to a security scare we believe, and all we saw of him was is car speeding past the Basilica. That was the only down side of our stay at the hotel through no fault of the hotel. The hotel arranged return airport transfers for us which saved us a lot of hassle trying to find a taxi ourselves and possibly being overcharged. We arrived on the Sunday and were welcomed at the hotel and shown to our rooms. My room was at the end of the building and had wide opening windows on two sides of the room, the room was very spacious and clean, had a comfortable bed and everything we needed for our stay. Two of the rooms were to this standard, however, one of the rooms was smaller even though it was a Deluxe Room and did not have a king size bed. Continental breakfast was provided in the roof top restaurant and had a good selection of food to set us up for the day. We ate in the restaurant on the day we arrived and again on the 3rd June for a special Gala Dinner to Celebrate the Corpus Domini (Pope’s visit to the Basilica). The open air bar was situated on the roof of the hotel and provided good views of surrounding skyline, including the Vatican in the distance. Drinks in Rome are very expensive so happy hour from 17:00 to 19:00 was very welcome. We hired a tour guide for two days and would recommend this to anyone wanting to get the best out of their visit to Rome. We had a really great holiday and have plenty of pictures to remember our stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: PB&SK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights and worked out great. Was a bit suspicious when we got a first floor room by the lift overlooking the street, but had good sound-proofing and air-con worked fine so no problem at all. Breakfast is the usual continental - rolls / ham / cheese / toast, though you can pay extra for bacon & egg. Has a great top-floor balcony bar overlooking Rome - enjoyed many a late night drink up there ! Evening meal is a great deal for 28 Euro - four courses and great Italian food. Less than 10 min walk from main railway station - all on the flat as well. About 20 min downhill walk to the Colosseum. Plenty of internet cafes next to the station charging a fraction of what the hotel does. Got the hotel (and flight) as a package from Expedia and got a good B&B rate at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Scammed - Don't go to Mecenate Palace or book through Hotels.com”
Reviews.Author: DEMomDelaware
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel months ago and prepaid through Hotels.com. When we arrived at the hotel we were told there was a problem with our reservation. I showed them the confirmation letter. The man told us they did not have room for us at that hotel and took us down the street to another building. The building was part of a low scale hotel and we had to walk up two flights of stairs (no elevator) through a dark, spookey staircase. We went through a doorway into a court yard where laundry was hanging out windows. The man kept saying, "This is nicer, this is the executive area." There was no security in the building. When we arrived at the hotel after touring, there were undesireable people hanging out at the foot of the staircase. The beds were uncomfortable and pillows were flat. We couldn't find the TV then realized a 14 inch computer screen was the TV. The room safe was a drawer in a dresser in the closet. It stated the hotel was not responsible for items left in the safe. When I requested a porter to help carry our three suitcases down the steep staircase, we were told there was no porter between 6 am and 7 am. We had to get up 4:30 am for the porter to take our bags down the steep staircase. We did not get what we paid for. We paid $300 per night for a four star hotel and was taken to a sleezy, unsecure hotel with no elevator. In addition, the breakfast was subpar and the coffee looked more like syrup. This was beyond a disappointment. It was a SCAM between hotels.com and the Mecenate Palace. When I called Hotels.com and reported the "Bait and switch" I was told that hotels.com policy allows hotels to relocate people to other hotels. There is no guarantee the hotel you book through Hotels.com will give you a room. This was the first and last time I will ever book a hotel through Hotels.com. DON'T GO TO MECENATE PALACE OR BOOK THROUGH HOTELS.COM!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel well located with great rooftop views”
Reviews.Author: Wrightreverend
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to Mecenate Palace. The hotel stands opposite the church of Santa Maria Maggiore. Breakfast is served on the rooftop overlooking the square and the church. There is a Metro stop 10 minutes walk away, and Roma Termini mainline station is very close, easily walkable even with a suitcase. The only downside for us was that the hotel put us in an 'executive suite' which at first sounded like an upgrade but wasn't. The room we were given was bigger but we had to walk down the road and enter a small door, up a flight of steps and into a courtyard. We would have preferred the main hotel, but by the time we had reached our room it was rather too late to turn back and ask. It's quite an expensive option and not in the best spot, but a good choice especially if you are arriving from the airport or taking the train to other parts of Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - hotel could be improved with few touches”
Reviews.Author: mexicoLondon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay, the hotel is 10 min walk from Termini and is a good location to most of the tourist sights but be prepared to walk lots! Our room was on floor 5A, it was a standard double and was big enough and had tea & coffee, toiletries were sparce so defo take your own. Towels and sheets clean. Attention to detail is not one of the italians strong points (told this by a roman!) we had a dirty plaster stuck to the wall of our bathroom & previous guests shampoo/soap left in the shower.....just a shame that we then had to ask twice to get these removed. Our room was noisy, we think we were below the rooftop terrace and could here people constantly clip clopping across the floor & tables being dragged around etc, could also hear the external air conditioning units from outside. View was not good but we didn't pay for one.......this is key in Rome! We had diner at the hotel on our first night and it was 28 euros pp which was good value & food was good, shame it was spoilt by the 12 euros we were charged for a bottle of water......I'm all for paying our way but when the same bottle is 2 euros in the supermarket next door I just don't think this is acceptable. I think that this hotel does its job but I am sure you could find a nicer one for the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: CashsGirl
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience here. They had a crib set up for us on arrival. View was terrible but we had one of the cheap rooms. The room was very pretty but also really small. We didn't care though because we were busy seeing Rome. Everything was good quality and the breakfast was wonderful. I especially enjoyed my free made to order cappuccino every morning! You can pretty much walk anywhere but a hike to the Vatican will take over an hour. No worries, there is a metro station closeby and it's easy to use. The hotel can provide a map. We spent Christmas there and they left a small panettone in our room which was a nice touch :o)

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel and a great base from which to explore”
Reviews.Author: JDRD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderfully located, near to metro, tourist bus stops and all the main inner city sights - 10 min walk to the Colosseum and the Forum - 15 mins to Spanish Steps. - Really good area - rooms were very good, hairdryer, fridge, excellent bathrooms - sheets and towels changed everyday. Safe in room - No charge. Excellent cold breakfast buffet in rooftop (covered) area and outside bar in the evenings - great views over rooftops and down to the church. For those who like to have a carpet picnic in the room there is a supermarket just over the road on Via Goiberti (downstairs that sells everything you'd need!) This hotel was great - staff very helpful. 50 Euros taxi from Leonardo da Vinci airport. I'd stay here everytime without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “The standard double room was a closet”
Reviews.Author: DRital
Reviews.Content: This was the most disappointing room I have ever stayed in, including Motel 6. Do not believe the photos they show. When we saw the room, I asked if they had made a mistake because we booked a double and it was a single. They said no, that was their standard double and nothing else was available. The bed was so small we had to lay on our sides or lie completely flat like a board. It might have been barely 6 ft long. Luckily we are not big people. We could barely move along one side of the bed one person at a time. Two sides were against a wall. The fourth side had the overpriced, outdated amenities, a window and a chair. We had to move the chair to either get to the window or the wardrobe. The TV was a small monitor with very little in English. The AC barely put out any air or cooling. And only that after we found out you had to turn it off and turn the termperature up to get it to work. The bathroom was very nice looking. But the shower blasted water all over the room and flooded out the floor. Althought that may have just been defective equipment. The top floor terrace was it's nicest feature. But forget the happy hour. We had to look all over for someone to grudgingly get us a drink and then he disappeared again. I have to admit the breakfast was very nice, fresh and a good selection. The wait staff there was also very nice. The reception personnel couldn't be bothered with customers. The location was good, convienent to the Termini. I would never go back to that place even at 1/2 the price.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely be returning to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KatenSam
Reviews.Content: Booked into the Virgillio Suite for my partners birthday. I must say this suite was amazing and very good value for money. We arrived early for check in, stored our luggage, and then spent a couple of hours exploring. The area around the hotel is busy especially the traffic but once in the suite we heard no noise from outside. When we got into the suite the first thing we noticed was the standard of everything. The entire place was spotless and we had a private terrace on the roof which gave some amazing views over Rome. The walls were covered in fabric rather than paper. The bathroom was yellow marble complete with Jacuzzi. The staff were very attentive, without being overbearing. The rooftop restaurant was reasonable but we only had breakfast there( buffet style). There were plenty of cereals, fruits, pastries, cheeses and ham. Went there on the Thursday evening for a drink and found it to be virtually empty with only one other couple. We only stayed for one drink before going out to eat so cannot really comment on the food.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely place to stay - Mature Couple”
Reviews.Author: BarnesUk
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a smart appearance and all staff were exceptionally pleasant and helpful.Previous reviews stated the rooms were small, this was not the case, although not large our double room was more than adequate. The room was tastefully decorated to a high standard and the bathroom was neat, clean and to a good standard. Lifts, corridors and reception areas all very presentable, clean and furbished to a good/high standard. You would have to be particularly churlish to find fault with the any element or standard of accommodation. The reception was always well staffed by polite, courteous English speaking staff. They were particularly helpful with any request for assistance. This included any general tourist advice with bus and transport information. They would provide bus numbers, timings and departure points for all major tourist areas. They also provided excellent local restaurent recommedations. The hotel is situated approx 15 mins walk from the bus and train station, I had previously read this area to be slightly on the unsavory side but I can say this was not the case and the station area was no different to any UK inner city station. Once 5 mins away towards hotel standard tourist '.traffic' applied. The continental breakfast was first class with a good selection of cereals, toast, pastries,cheeses and meats etc. The actaul service in the restaurant was more 5 star than 4. I imagine ths setting to be wonderful in the summer as it is on the hotel roof with a view of the major tourist sites. It was about a 25 minute walk to the Colesseum and Roman Forum down the hill and although not strickly n the centre of the tourist attractions it was not too far away and hence had a more than appropriate reduced price. Overall everything about the hotel and service was to a high standard.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a very good location.”
Reviews.Author: sanora56
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a superior room in the Mecenate Palace hotel from the 8th February until 12th February 2010. The hotel is exactly as the photographs show. The rooms are spotless with large bathrooms with shower / bath. Breakfasts are of a good standard with cold meats, cheeses, bread, pastries, fruit and cereals - something for everyone. We dined in the hotel one evening and the set meal was very nice - 4 courses for 18 Euros which in Rome terms offers very good value. A word of of warning regarding the cafe on the corner, it is very expensive. The pastries and ice cream while expensive are very good and it could be argued worth the money. We wee caught out one day by deciding to have lunch to save some time. We ordered two Panninis, a small beer and a fanta orange and were charged 36 Euros, so be aware. During our stay we had some rain and found the hotel's close proximity to the Metro of great benefit; particularly when going to the vatican. This hotel is an ideal base for your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Srixon
Reviews.Content: Terrific location next to Santa Maria Maggiore and few minutes from Termini. Worried about being noisy but offered one of the new rooms in a courtyard which was excellent - quiet,modern,large,clean, tea/coffee jacuzzi bath etc. Roberto on the desk was very helpful in making restaurant bookings for us. Breakfast on the roof terrace was great but busy, resulting in a short wait on the first day. Only reason for not getting excellent rating in everything was promoted offer of coffee and cake for 5 euro between 4 -6pm resulted in a charge of 18 euro instead. Minor stuff - otherwise couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Great view. Great service. Great value.”
Reviews.Author: cmhome
Reviews.Content: Our rooms (3) all looked out on the Basilica Maria Maggiore which really gave us a sense of place. We found the room size quite adequate (for Europe and an older...charming... building.) The bath was well-appointed, well-sized and well-laid out. (The plexi-shield on the shower is inefficient and would be better replaced with a shower curtain.) The top-floor dining room was sunny with a rooftop view and the breakfast buffet (while the same everyday), offered enough variety and substance to suit any appetite. All the staff were consistently friendly and helpful. It was well located for walking to Coliseum, ancient Rome, Spanish Steps, shopping, and with close by Metro access for Vatican, etc. One occasion deserves particular mention. After checking out, we discovered at the airport that one person had left his passport in the room. The front desk at the hotel located the passport and immediately sent it to us by cab...all with a kind and helpful attitude. Our extended family of 6 adults agree that the Mecenate is a great value and we would definitely recommend it. (We have stayed at other hotels in Rome and this is our favorite so far.)

Reviews.Title: “3 Star, moving up to 4; Great location”
Reviews.Author: BettyBenson
Reviews.Content: The late Ober sun cast lovely shadows on the Church and plaza. Great location and very helpful staff. Rooftop dining was two flights up stairs (no lift to top) and there was no view. Outside patio had the views. Room service during meals will be expanded, I was informed. Room was basic and clean. Views of the church through tall windows, no balconies. Terrific restaurants nearby. Cafe just outside door of hotel might be a chain, but had very good food, especially gnocchi. (Gnocchi at hotel were bullets; but I was told only eat gnocchi in Rome on Thursdays!)

Reviews.Title: “What a PA-LACE to stay.”
Reviews.Author: superstorr
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I travelled to Rome for 4 nights, to do the touristy thing and see the sights. The hotel is a 10 min walk to the Coluseum, and most the other sights are walkable in under an hour. We were booked in at the Mecenate Palace Hotel in one of there deluxe double rooms and wow what a view we had. Our room over looked the Sant Maria Maggiore one of Rome's finest churches. Upon our arrival at the hotel the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was well sound proofed which cut out virtually all the traffic noise. The room was very clean and was maintained each day by the maids. Being in a clean and friendly hotel made our stay in Rome all the more enjoyable. P.S, What a great breakfast.!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely 4 star and I'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: JoeybArezzo
Reviews.Content: My friend booked this hotel through priceline and bid on it sight unseen. It was a bargain for a 4 star and was way beyond our expectations. Breakfast was included and was diverse and good. We were uprgaded to a suite, with ample sitting room with fridge and bar and tv, bedroom with two single beds and tv, and a beautiful bath with jacuzzi. It was located within walking distance of Termini station, a metro stop and also close enough to walk to the Colliseum and Roman Forum. The view from the roof of the hotel was amazing. They asked if we minded staying in their annex which is just 2 doors down and right next door to a gelateria. I think it was more quiet and possibly more modern than the main hotel and we just loved it. I have another trip to Rome coming up in the spring and will certainly book there. The staff speak impeccable English and are as professional as you could find anywhere. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. I live in Italy and I know how this hotel compares to other European hotels. It is remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: KTO711
Reviews.Content: My husband and I finished our two week honeymoon in Rome with three nights at the Mecante Palace. We were surprised by its location right from the start - we had thought it was more central, but it is def. further away from the main sites and attractions in Rome. It isn't too far, but we were not in the thick of things nor were we expecting a $20 taxi ride to get to the Pantheon area. Our room was very tiny and hot. The hotel had "turned off" the ac unit because there had been a few cooler days in late October. There really was no air running at all out of the circulation system and we had to request a fan (which they provided). The breakfast was a little dissapointing as well - it was included in the rate, but needs some improvement. The fruit was very clearly from a can and the meat was coldcuts on a platter. A platter of eggs or something like that at no additional rate would be a nice touch. Overall, the gentleman at the front desk were helpful when we asked for suggestions. There was one in particular however, who was pretty haughty. The drinks at the hotel bar were very overpriced as well. We were busy seeing the sites of Rome for the most part, so did not hang out at the hotel too long, but overall, it was just okay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - 3 stars, maybe...not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: FLBearMan
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed a the Mecenate Palace hotel for three nights. Overall, we were disappointed in the property. The lobby is very opulent. Upon entry of the hotel you think, "WOW this is a very upscale hotel." Once you get to your room the story is very different. The rooms are very small (which we expectetd, it's Eurpoe!), but the room smelled musky, the beds were very hard and uncomfortable and the pillows were as flat as a pancake. The worst part of all, WE WERE HOT! We could not cool down. We complained to the front desk that we felt the air conditioning was not working, but nothing really got done to remedy the problem. Like us, we had friends who stayed at the hotel and they prepaid. They arrived after us. At check in our friends were told that the hotel was booked. They did not have a room for them. They tried putting our friends up at another hotel near by, but the quality was even worse. After much complaining some how a room was found for our friends at the Mecenate. Just a bad experience all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel..... Beautiful Rooftop Terrace... but no iron”
Reviews.Author: mendoza83
Reviews.Content: First time visitor to Rome, and I booked this hotel based on the reviews I read on trip advisor and it did not disappoint. Friendly staff, very friendly bell hops ( thanks Majendra) , very classy lobby, and nice clean rooms. THE LOCATION WAS GREAT. 15-20 minute walk to Coloseum and Roman Forum and 10 minute walk to train (Termini station). Restaurants and small shops in immediate area. Rooftop Terrace for breakfast and dinner/drinks was very nice and had a great view of the city. Only negative is that they do not have irons in the rooms and if you want to have something pressed it will cost you 3- 7 euros per item of clothing. I suggest you bring your own iron. Other than that we loved the hotel and were treated great and hotel added to our enjoyment of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “an almost wonderful experience...”
Reviews.Author: BKflaneuse
Reviews.Content: ok. i would really love to give the Mecenate Palace a great review... but how can it be possible that my boyfriend and I experienced all of the good things raved about in reviews here AND all of the bad things that have been documented?!! after a long flight from NYC and a creepy ride on the Leonardo Express we easily found the hotel... but were told upon arrival that our reservation could not be found!!! oh, wait, they found it but they mistakenly had us booked for November. uh-huh. my boyfriend and I were expecting this scam and raised a holy ruckus... to no avail. "sorry ma'am we have no rooms available. we will have to send you to another hotel until tomorrow." we were furious!! but tired, and in need of a shower... so we accompanied the bellhop to the Palladium Palace hotel down the street... that was an experience I am saving for a special review of that hotel. [it actually wasn't THAT bad but we anticipated the worst] anyway, the next day we returned to the Mecenate and were placed in a "superior suite" which didn't seem special, or superior. but it was very clean and what we expected... we received complimentary free drinks at the bar and we visited the breakfast bar every morning. the food wasn't spectacular but helped us to offset the expensive costs of dining in Roma. the neighborhood surrounding the hotel is seedy going towards the train station but i [a woman in mid 30s from NYC] didn't find it any more sketchy than cities in the US or other cities in Europe. in fact there were a few nights when i roamed around the city without my boyfriend and walked back to the hotel without incident. one thing i will mention is that the hotel is kind of far from the tourist strip and there aren't many excellent restaurants or shopping very close, but there are several decent places to eat nearby, including the gelato place next door. if you are looking for a lively neighborhood within steps I would not recommend this hotel because taxis are hard to come by and the subway stops at 8 or so making it difficult to make the stumble home after drinks and a big meal. i recommend this hotel, begrudgingly, because although we were sent to another hotel, it wasn't bad, and once we returned to Mecenate the staff and the experience were excellent. certainly not a luxury hotel, but a pleasant and comfortable experience. i have decided to start leaving reviews here on TripAdvisor after using the reviews here for years to make travel choices. Thanks everybody!! you have made my travels much easier!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: halatlanta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located, close to the termini station. It is a small hotels with all the big hotel amenitiies. The front desk was always very helpful and ready to recommend places to eat or ways to get around the city. The breakfast on the roof top terrace was a great way to start the morning, wonderful view of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look anywhere else in Rome to stay, it can't be any better than this”
Reviews.Author: Russell15
Reviews.Content: The hotel has recently been refurbished and there was some minor painting being carried out while we were there.We stayed for 3 nights choosing to dine in their rooftop restaurant on the first evening.The menu choices appeared a little basic but the quality of the food was excellent and exceeded my expectations. I recommend having a drink in the rooftop bar which opens at 5pm, the staff are very friendly and helpful if you talk to them but are not pushy if you prefer to be left alone.Reception staff were excellent dealing with a faulty tap in our room immediately and helpful with directions and booking restaurants for us.Tea making facility in our rooms made such a difference as we could sit at our window overlooking the square from our well equiped and clean bedroom. Don't use the bar immediately on the left outside the main entrance, the cakes are tempting but extemely expensive at 7 Euros each,there are cheaper bars.Recommend you book a table at a restaurant called Cecio through hotel reception, food is excellent and good value,family owned and very friendly. The rooms are soundproof although tou can just about hear the bells from the church opposite but not to the extent that they disturbed us. The air conditioning and fridge were the quietist I have ever experienced in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, decent location but ... nothing special”
Reviews.Author: interpolation
Reviews.Content: Again, I found the reviews of this hotel very positive and decided to book. The hotel makes a fairly good impression as the facade and lobby area are well renovated; the staff were pleasant and helpful and assisted where possible. The advertised wi-fi wasn't included but luckily for us we ended up doing a fair bit of research before reaching Rome so we did not need to pay for the internet more than one time. The roof top terrace, where a nice (if not always fresh) breakfast is served was quite lovely, overlooking the Piazza Santa Maria Maggiore. The Colloseum is also visible from the terrace. Pluses include proximity to Termini Station (though its far enough to avoid the sketchy types, generally), Via Cavour (leading to the Colloseum and Imperial Forum) and serveral neat restaurants including La Base and and a Sicilican pastry shop on Via Torino. At the foot of the hotel is a great gelateria called Orso Bianco, heavily recommended as the flavours were authentic and tasty. Our room was on the first floor overlooking Carlo Alberto Street; it was the tinest thing I've ever stayed in. Though the ceilings were quite high, the room barely fit a small double bed, a desk, dresser drawer and one night stand; there wasn't enough room for two pieces of luggage. With a bit of Tetris like astuteness, we managed to fit our luggage by the window between the bed and undernear the desk in order to have access to our bed. The bed itself was very uncomfortable. On the positive side, the bathroom was rather large, though the shower was tempermental and sometimes wouldn't provide anything but boiling or freezing water. Front desk staff were helpful and accommodating but the cleaning staff, perhaps by management orders, removed our water bottles from the fridge and left a curt note that this is forbidden. If I'm paying for the room, I should be entitled to keep my water in there in order to keep it cool. This was bizzare and unappreciated; we got a convoluded answer and managed by cleaning up our own room to avoid another shuffle of the contents of the fridge... was I in a dorm? Oh, no, a four star. The question of the Termini ghetto also worried me before booking; I was persuaded by some of the comments here to not worry. Generally, this is true - Carlo Alberto, the square in front of the hotel and via Cavour were fine, but the remainder of the streets to the south-east of the hotel are best avoided at night. On our way to a trattoria near Vittorio Emmanuel on Sunday night, we encountered a rather large and unpleasant group of people. Lots of people down and of luck also tended to hang around Termini, especially on the bus platforms. I would definately caution anyone intent on taking advantage of night life or getting in late to watch themselves moreso than regularly in the area near the hotel. Overally, I thought the hotel was decent in terms of cleaniliness and some of the services, but given the cost and what was provided in terms of room size and by virtue of location, I wouldn't recommend it or stay here again. Lesson learned!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: thinkgroup
Reviews.Content: We spent 3days and 2 nights at the Mecenate. We had a room in the "Executive Wing" which once you are inside may be but involved entering through a dirty door surrounded by scaffolding then a flight of about 30 stairs to get to a locked door into the Wing. Our room was very nice, spacious, modernised though old fashioned bathroom, very comfy beds. Unfortunately our window was covered in plastic with scaffolding behind it so impossible to open window. Reception desk very helpful though forgetful, forgot to book our table for dinner etc. The restaurant whilst having a lovely view and being open air is not accessible if you cannot manage around 40 stairs. The dinner on both nights was rather dissappointing as they had sold out of such a lot and the service was very sparce and slow. On the final night we had booked for 9am and arrived on time and had still not been seated by 9.45 which was getting late for our 12 year old, they had sold out of most of the main courses and many of the deserts so a shame. The reception organised us a splendid private driver to tour the sights. This cost us around 40euros an hour which we thought was very good. Despite the negative points we thought this was a lovely hotel. The position opposite the church is perfect and there is an outdoor restaurant 2 minutes walk away and a lovely ice cream shop nextdoor. Also a couple of market stalls opposite and a bank cash machine there too. Well situated for touring though not much to walk around in the evenings

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: RJHNorthYorks
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the hotel. Booked a family room which was really spacious with a large bathroom. Staff really helpful- providing maps and good information. Also spoke excellent English. Breakfast continental with a good choice of fruit ( including fresh and tinned), selection of cheeses and meats, cereal, yoghurts, breads and pastries. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: panda58
Reviews.Content: location is ok when you travel by train. distance to centre is quite far.hotel looks nice from outside.rooms are very small or tiny and thus overpriced.hotel overbooks regularly which is unacceptable.is located next to busy square, but soundproofing is very good.breakafst area on roof top is nice, but food mediocre.it is not bad, but reviews were too optimistic.would not stay again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Dom1969
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to Rome In July and stayed at this hotel. We were in Room 423 with an amazing view of the piazza and Santa Maria Maggiore. The room was clean with a good size en suite bathroom. Complimentary buffet breakfast on the terrace included fresh pastries, meats, cheeses, fruits, and the usual bevs, all excellent quality. The view from the roof terrace was fantastic. The terrace/breakfast area is well maintained by attentive hostess. The reception has friendly, casual staff eager to help make your stay wonderful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, don't worry about the infamous 'Termini ghetto'”
Reviews.Author: Nick365365
Reviews.Content: I've put that in the title because it was my main concern before coming to Rome. It's a beautiful city, but man does it have some issues with graffiti. Every single unprotected surface is covered with the stuff, so thanks, delinquents. Anyway, onto the hotel. No graffiti on the walls (so they must clean it off regularly!), great location opposite one of the city's most beautiful churches. Plenty of good, cheap restaurants nearby on the piazza. Colosseum's a 15 minute walk. Piazza Navona's 10 minutes from there. Vatican's a bit further but it's right on the metro. We walked it and, with stops etc, it probably took about 45 mins. In 40 degree heat. Our room was great - overlooking the church, fairly big, nicely furnished. It's definitely worth its 4 stars. Shower needed updating but hey, who cares right? We had a bit of a struggle getting tea and milk in, which is why I've only given 3 stars for service, but it's so close to a 4. Really close. Everything else was great about the service (friendly, efficient, good info and knowledge). The breakfast bar's fantastic. Great views across the Roman rooftops and a good way to get an idea of the heat of the day before heading out. Good breakfast selection, pastries not exactly fresh but plenty of choice in that department. I'm being overly critical, but you can see from my 4 star rating how happy I was with my choice. Great, central location. Yes, there are bad bits around Termini, but the Mecenate's well out of them. Great value, nice sized room, good and friendly service. The ideal base for a trip to the eternal city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for your visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: jtkdebruin
Reviews.Content: We staid at this hotel for 4 nights and really enjoyed our stay!! The rooms are good and comfortable. What really makes this hotel special is the roof terrace where you have a great view over the city! Also I can recommend to have diner there because it was pretty good!

Reviews.Title: “Who knows -- they overbooked”
Reviews.Author: CassandraHNewYorkNY
Reviews.Content: This hotel was overbooked when we got there, despite having a reservation and having already paid for three nights. They put us up in a supposedly comparable hotel down the street that was in no way equal. It was rated three stars to Mecenate's four stars on trip advisor and the room was dark with little view, surrounded by street sellers. Though the bill, which we paid in advance, said the right day the "wrong" day was somehow in their computer. --Surprising, since the same computer system billed our credit card and sent us our online itinerary for the correct day. What makes more sense is that they overbooked and then sent the excess guests to cheaper hotels that they have at a special reduced rate. Bait and switch? As I write this from the three star hotel that they sent us to (on them) it certainly seems that way. On them is a joke, it's definitely on us since they're not refunding the money we paid for pricier accomodations. Will never come back. Beware about booking at this hotel and ending up in another one.

Reviews.Title: “It was good...it wasn't so good”
Reviews.Author: MauiBear
Reviews.Content: At first I was hesitant because this hotel was, on the map, pretty close to the Termini and I'd heard that neighborhood wasn't great. Yes, this wasn't the Via Condotti or Via Venito BUT, as hotels in Europe are still so expensive, it really turned out to be fine. A short 4 block walk to the Termini put us right alongside EVERY bus in Rome, including the open top buses. So we went everywhere on a bus pass, effortlessly. The neighborhood was fine just not fancy and there wasn't much shopping nearby. BUT the highlight was being across the street from the Maria Maggiore Church. One of the four original churches this is a must see but yet a lot of people miss it. The staff at this hotel was helpful but not overly so. When we checked in, it felt like..."OK here are the 5 places you need to visit while you're here. Your room is number xxx. See you." They answered questions and helped with reservations for restaurants...don't get me wrong. It was just a little cool...not cold.... The room was fine but the bathroom was a bit seedy. Not dirty...just worn a bit. The best part of the hotel was the rooftop bar. At the end of a VERY long day, it was a treat to sit upstairs, gaze out over the Roman rooftops and sip wine. Very lovely spot.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rose2250
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Mecenate Palace in May of this year .On our arrival, which was late evening, were welcomed by Roberto at check - in and were given an up- grade to a suite for two nights as I had a significant birthday celebration!!!!! We were then given a double superior room for the remainder of our stay, which was lovely. Fresh towels and sheets daily, tea and coffee making facilities, safe, AC.The room large with adequate storage space, bath and shower facilities. Cleanliness evident throughout the hotel. Breakfast was lovely, good variety, coffee good( both of us indulge) We found all the staff helpful, and were assisted with booking of trips,taxi. We ate at various places in the area unfortunately never ate at the hotel so can't comment. We did much of our sight-seeing on foot, did use the metro a few times and had no problems. The area was fine easy access to everything. Overall our stay at Mecenate Palace was teriffic, the staff lovely, roof-top terrace NOT to be missed, view fab!!!

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room ever”
Reviews.Author: CHSBS
Reviews.Content: Based upon the positIve reviews on Trip Advisor, I booked two nights for my wife and I at the Mecenate Palace Hotel on Via Carlo Alberto in Rome. The room was the smallest I have ever seen. It was about the width of two double beds and in length it was one or two feet longer than a double bed. The one double bed in the room was placed against the wall. The bed had a sagging mattress which rolled you toward the middle of the bed. The bathroom had a stall shower for which you could not open the door inward because if you did, you could not get in . It could be opened outward only about half way, maybe two feet wide, because the shower door then hit the edge of the toilet. I don't know how a large person would have been able to get in to the shower. The hotel indicates that it has an elevator and it does, however the elevator only goes to the 5th floor and the dining room is 25 stairs beyond where the elevator ends. This was a real problem as my wife has a walking disability. Because it was a Sunday night and there were no open near by restaurants, we ate at the hotel. The food was over priced and was less than mediocre. The hotel is also located in a run down area. They charge 5 Euros for internet access and this was the best part of the stay. I used it to book another hotel for the second night we were scheduled to stay at the Mecentate Palace Hotel. Because we had booked on the internet and pre-paid, we were not able to get a refund for the night we did not stay. When the travel website on which we had booked the hotel later contacted the hotel on my behalf to ask if they would give us a refund, the hotel said they would not. All in all, the worst hotel experience I have ever had and I travel quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Good for first-timers”
Reviews.Author: JollieA
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 7 nights. Booked a single room, but they gave me a double room. The room was still so small, I couldn't believe it was for 2 people. The bathroom was nice size with a big tub. The closet was big enough for me, but probably not for 2. Ask for a free upgrade to a larger room when you check in, like I did. It's worth a try. The bed was very comfortable, and the sheets were super clean each day. The room was very quiet with the windows shut. The bedside nightstand was too dim to read in bed. Bring your own light if you want to read in bed. Breakfast was OK except for the coffee. It must be instant coffee. It tasted really bad. If you're a coffee lover like me, forget their coffee and go to Illy's next door for a cup of cappuccino (only 1 euro). There's a PC (no printer) in the lobby. They charge you for the internet connection, but the rate was reasonable. I only checked my emails each night, and the total for a week came out to be only 3 euro. It's a very good hotel for the most part, and I recommend this hotel to first-time visitors to Rome because it's within the walking distance from Termini and the hop-on/off buses stop right across the street from the hotel. If you wanted to get back to the hotel by taxi after all-day sightseeing, all you have to say to the taxi driver is "Santa Maria Maggiore". No need to explain the location of the hotel. This hotel is very convenient for first-timers. The downside is that the hotel is not right in the heart of the city, so you have to take some form of public transportation between the touristic sites and the hotel. After a few days, it starts to feel like a waste of time going back and forth each day. And there is no good place to eat in the neighborhood, so you have to have dinner elsewhere before coming back to the hotel each night. It would have been nice if there were lots of restaurant choices within the walking distance. I am glad I stayed at this hotel this time, but when I go back to Rome for the second time, I will stay near Pantheon so I can walk to everywhere and save time/money getting to/from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel and Staff exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: hmbgal
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Rome with our two children who are 5 and 3.5 years and stayed at the Mecenate Palace. I wasn't sure what to expect based on a few reviews but it really was so much better. We had stayed in very small hotels in Rome, pre-kids, with small rooms. The lobby was spacious and our room was perfect for the 4 of us. No, we weren't running laps but it's relative to Rome. The kids played on the bed and floor and the bathroom could fit all of us if necessary. When we pulled the curtains, the room was dark, which is always a bonus. There's noise but it's Rome! We were close enough to Termini to walk to it but far enough to not feel like we were amongst an element. The hotel staff were all friendly and recommended a restaurant called Angelo's Pizza which was perfect. We were near a grocery store as well as a beautiful church (Santa Maria Maggiore). Every day we hopped on the Metro and went some where different. I'm sure there are other hotels which are bigger and maybe better located but we were really happy with it. And it was a 4 star hotel which means it really was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “really enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: SEC67
Reviews.Content: very conveniently located a few minutes walk from the railway station, right by the lovely church of Santa Maria Maggiore and a leisurely stroll to the other major sites/sights, assuming you, like me, find part of the joy of a new city is in discovering it on foot. Staff were charming, the buffet breakfast was very good and the view from the roof garden was wonderful. Of course the rooms might seem small for some of our American friends but the hotel has been tastefully converted from an old palace and the twin I shared with my mother was more than adequate - and I liked having a kettle in the room to make a cup of tea at the end of day's sight/site seeing. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mrs Robbo
Reviews.Content: We were expecting the rooms to be a little more luxurious, but this was a very comfortable, clean hotel. The views from the rooftop were lovely. The bed linen & towels were changed daily and we were provided with lovely white, fluffy towelling bath robes!!! Breakfasts were excellent with a very good choice of rolls, pastries, ham, cheeses, conserves, fresh fruit and cereal. Plent of hot tea & coffee. The location was great for sight seeing, with the 'Hop on - Hop Off' buses running from just outside the hotel. DO NOT get your tickets in the hotel as you will pay approx £10 each more than if you buy them from the bus reps. Rome is very expensive for eating out, with 2 small cappucino's costing £10 in some places!!! More if you want to drink them outside!! Can recommend Ristorante.Le 2 Colonne, which is just to the left of the Piazza Santa Maria Maggiore. Good food quite reasonably priced. BEWARE of the Gladiators!!!! They will approach you with friendly chat, ask if you want a photo, then charge you anything between £5.00 - £20.00 for this. get a price first if you want a photo.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Fatbritabroad
Reviews.Content: booked for a 4 day honeymoon and was an absolute dream from start to finish. The hotel knew it was our honeymoon (thank you expedia) and upgraded us to an executive suite so cant comment on a normal room- absolutely huge bed and room with air con, terrace area shared with 2 other rooms and an built in radio on the bathroom!! jacuzzi bath and beautiful bathroom. the rest of the hotel is also very very pretty inside. room was absolutely silent which was amazing considering we were on a busy main road although again we were in a room in the back of the hotel. good continental breakfast is served on a gfantastic roof terrace with views over the church. great ice cream shop just downstairs (plus a very expensive but very nice one next door!) location is excellent a 10 minute walk or less to the Colleseum, maybe 10 more to trevi, the only thing we used the transport for was the vatican and you are 5 minutes from termini staff are fabulous we were served a drink in the little bar when we arrived as our room wasnt quite ready and reception couldnt have been more helpful with a free map to all the major sights. really cannot recommend this hotel enough. amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location to all attractions.”
Reviews.Author: jerseylondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok! I wasn't that crazy but it was reasonable for the price and service I received. The staff are friendly. I have asked them to book a taxi from Fiumicino Airport to the hotel for 50 euros. It will probably cost me 70-80 euro if I took a taxi from the airport, they were really helpful. The breakfast is elegant, however I expect more for a 4 star hotel you have to pay for eggs and sausages separately. They do have ham or chorizo instead. But I do like to be full in the morning especially if you know you have to walk all day to see the Collesium and Vatican City. The room and bathroom are very spacious! The place is well located to major attractions like Collesium which is 15-20 minutes walk and Trevi Fountain, don't miss this in the night. The beautiful church, St. Maria Maggiore is just in front of your hotel you would like to see that before you go. Also, my advice to all travellers is to take Ciao Sightseeing bus where the main office is just opposite the church. It will take you to all major attractions and they run up to 7pm. Also, the hotel is located to many restaurants around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellnet Location”
Reviews.Author: Pennsylvania1
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at the Mercenate Palace in the past 10 years. The hotel is four blocks south of the Rome Termini station, it takes 5 minutes to walk to the station. We had a large Superior room on the 5th floor (the same one as our last visit there) which faced the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore. The Superior rooms are large. I booked the room on-line directly, The rate was lowest I have paid in the last 10 years. We could have stayed for 5 nights for the price I paid for 4 nights. There is a grocery store in the basement of the stores right across the street. The hotel has cut back on amenities compared to our last visit there in 2005. There were no candies on the pillows on the first night and they didn't turn down the beds on our last two nights there. There also seemed to be a few less items set out at breakfast than four years ago. We had a bottle of Diet Coke and a plastic bag with mini-carrots in the minibar fridge. The maid left a pre-printed note on the first day that guests were absolutely forbidden to place their food or beverages in the minbar. When I mentioned this to the front desk clerk at first he didn't know what I was talking about but then said they had problems with confusion as to what was in the minibar to begin with and the guests' stuff. He said they could empty the minibar of the hotel items but they never did this. The way around this was to take our stuff out of the minibar in the morning and put it back in after the room was attended to. Other than that I would stay here on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant base for exploring”
Reviews.Author: blakefamily
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two night whistlestop trip to Rome. Hotel Mecenate palace is located about a 5 minute walk from the termini station and opposite Santa Maria Maggiore. The collosseum is about a 15 minute walk away and the metro is based at the station. We had a twin room in the apartment building which was extremely spacious, clean and warm. The breakfast was continental but plenty of it and more than enough to set you up for the day. There are plenty of pastry/ sanwich bars, restaurants and supermarket located on this piazza and the area feels safe. The reception staff are extremely polite and helpful and I would recomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: tmichaelhicks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from the 28th to the 31st of January 2009. The hotel was very hospitable; the front desk staff couldn’t do enough for you whether it was a simple location on the free map or an advice of where to eat. The bar man was very helpful and a very nice person to talk to. He knew how to make you feel comfortable with a drink. The breakfast was ok and very well presented; you can eat as much as you like. I can recommend the bacon and eggs but you have to pay extra for that. The coffee was very rich not strong if you are British, stick with tea; also go early for breakfast as between 9:30 and 10 you might have to wait 5 minutes before you get a table. The room 402 was very comfortable with everything you need. We always came back to find the room clean and tidy with all bathroom consumables replenished. You can even listen to the radio in the bathroom. We used the taxi service from the airport this I wouldn’t recommend as the car was scruffy, the back suspension was banging about. We mentioned this to the hotel and they contacted the hire company they said they were sorry and gave us a discount on the return trip, the same car turned up. Amazing. So not advisable, especially at the price. When I go back to Rome I will use this hotel again Just a shame about the car.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Peggy55Canada
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. Great location as it's on the hop on, hop off tour bus routes which we used as bus service to get to and from the various Rome attractions. Our room was exactly as pictured on their website...service was professional and courteous. We paid extra and had a view of the Palace which I'd highly recommend. Our room came with continental breakfast and lunch. Breakfast was pretty good! With careful planning, lunch could be your supper! We found the lunch menu pretty good and the portions a good size. Very clean well maintained hotel and within walking distance of many historical sites (but it would be a long walk). I'd definitely stay here on a return trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jwaskey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed as the Mecenate Palace for five nights (Dec. 30-Jan 3, 2009). We were thrilled with the room. It was elegant. When at first we thought there was some unpainted paneling in the bathroom we looked closer to see it was actually marble. The location across the plaza from the Santa Maria Maggiore (Major) Church was excellent. It gave us easy access via the right side to Via Torino to Via Nazionale or via the left side of the church to Via Cavour and many resturants and trattatorias. It is also close to the train station. The hotel concierge(s) was wonderful. Gave great directions on a map they provided. Set us up with a box breatkfast for the morings we toured the Vatican and Pompeii. Arranged for a trip to Pompeii and again provided a box breakfast delivered to our room at 6 a.m. The roof top restuarant breakfast was very good with good views of Rome and from our room as well. Overall a very nice hotel. We'd stay there again. Dr. Jack and Martha Waskey

Reviews.Title: “loved the palace!”
Reviews.Author: augustpalmer
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline for a very good price a couple months prior to our arrival. Upon check in we were told that the hotel was overbooked and they had 'upgraded' us to an apartment. They took us down the street a couple doors, to a residential building, up a couple flights of stairs into a well-appointed, nicely decorated one-bedroom apartment. We loved it! The bathroom was fantastic with Jacuzzi tub, large bedroom, comfortable bed, lots of closet space and a roomy front room with a fridge. This apartment may not have suited some guests as well as us, but we also thought they may have 'upgraded' us because we would not have any issue with the stairs. The front desk was professional, and friendly; gave us umbrellas when it was raining, and good advice throughout our stay. The breakfast was fine. Can't really comment on the rooms in the hotel, as we did not see them. We liked it so much we asked to stay another night, but unfortunately the hotel was completely sold out. Location was good - very close to the train station, yet just outside the seedy area... metro very close, and walking distance to the coliseum. We received a good price - this was the first time using Priceline, we were very impressed. We would use the service and stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Never had a Chance to Check In as Hotel Canceled our Confirmed Res.”
Reviews.Author: ksimpson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had just returned from an outstanding Mediterrainean cruise on Carnival Cruise Line on September 15, 2006. We had a thrice confirmed reservation at the Golden Tulip Mercenate Palace for two nights to sight see in Rome. Upon our arrival at the hotel, the desk staff was quite cordial as they looked for our reservation. After a considerable length of time, they advised us they did not have our reservation. I told them it had been confirmed by our travel agent and we showed them our written confirmation and number. It didn't matter to them. They also advised us they had no open rooms. They also called a few other hotels and there were no rooms available in nearby hotels. As an experienced international business traveler who had managed our corporate travel program for two years, I can assure you every hotel holds one or two rooms in reserve for "special travelers or circumstances." It didn't matter. Their mood changed completely toward us. After more than two hours of demanding a reason why our reservation was cancelled, they contacted their company office. They told us their office told them that since our credit card had an expiration date between the time our travel agent made our reservation and the time we were to stay in their hotel, when the card expiration date arrived, they cancelled the reservation. This was done with without notifying our travel agent or us, even though they had our full home and business contact information. Golden Tulip had even confirmed our reservation again before we left for Rome even though it no longer existed. Fortunately, a call to American Express resulted in us getting a room at a small boutique hotel on the opposite side of St. Peter's Square from where we had stayed two weeks earlier before embarking on our cruise. My wife and I learned four lessons: (1) Never stay at a Golden Tulip Hotel because, based upon our experience and opinion, a written confirmed reservation means nothing to them, and they won't attempt to correct their mistake. I wrote a complaint to their home office upon our return to the States and never heard back from them. (2) Make sure your credit card doesn't expire between the time you make a reservation and the date you travel. We had renewed our card with the same ID information automatically. There was no problem with any other part of our trip requiring prior reservations with the same card. (3) Advise your card issuer you will be traveling internationally and you do not want to have any problems with ANY ATMs. We did have some rejections of our card at overseas ATMS, while it worked fine at others. (4) Carry any American Express card. Their travel staff is always willing to assist you if you run into problems while traveling. They saved our great vacation from a bad ending. The hotel they placed us in at the last minute was outstanding, less costly than the Tulip Mecenate Palace, and closer to places we wanted to see. We will never stay in a Golden Tulip property.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but Rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: hubbjay
Reviews.Content: Hi Have just returned from Rome booked our hotel through priceline. The Mecenate Palace Hotel is ok I wasn't overcome with a wow factor when we arrived, in fact when they showed us to our room we thought they were joking have seen bigger broom cupboards. The bed was so small and squashed up against the wall so I felt very closed in. My husband ad I are not big people but even so it was a squeeze. We tried to get a bigger room but thay had nothing till the next day we paid an extra 30 Euro's for the upgrade but to be honest it was hardly worht it. The staff were friendly and helpful no complaints there. One word of warning on our first day there we went out for a pizza for lunch my husband ordered a beer & I a glass of wine they ended up bringing us a bottle because apparently some Restaurant's do not serve it by the glass so check before ordering! Secondly on another day out we returned to the hotel and next door is a cafe we thought we will stop and have a coffee and cake. Two coffee's & two small cakes came to 28 EURO'S we thought they must have got our bill wrong but no it was correct so you have been warned. Enough of the moaning now Rome is beautiful the ladies are chic and the men are handsome the architecture is amazing. Metro cost 1 Euro to anywhere and the sightseeing bus cost us 23 Euro's each but we had it for 3 days it includes a map and ear phones so whilst you are being driven around this beautiful city you have commentry on the way.

Reviews.Title: “Money exchange scam”
Reviews.Author: pintail8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located in Rome, a good location near the train station. The breakfast was the worst we experienced in Italy. The staff was not helpful at all.At the time of check out I was presented a bill in euros and the credit card receipt was in USD at a conversion of 1.41 USD/Euro. The rate on that day was 1.35USD/Euro. I asked for a receipt in Euros and was refused and told it was automatic. The increased cost to me was around 30 USD. clearly a scam on the hotel's part. As the cab to the airport was waiting I did not have time to deal with the management on this. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very bad front desk, very bad advice”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoDahlias
Reviews.Content: We are a middle aged couple who asked our travel agent for a higher priced hotel (not deluxe) for four nights in Rome for our first time trip. The rooms were small, well appointed and more than a little dirty, but worst of all was the help given by the front desk. Asked for a map, they gave us a free tourist sheet and then in so many words told us to "get lost." When pressed for the bus number to a particular site bus stop location, they gave us completely wrong information! They made their impatience and distain evident to us in no uncertain terms. They told us breakfast was NOT included even though our voucher said that it was. For the price of this tired, run-down property in a not so great location, one should be able to do much better. PS. We met another couple at the same hotel who had almost the identical experience; we'll let them write their own review.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT CITY”
Reviews.Author: CLEANY
Reviews.Content: Just got back,Rome is a great city to explore. Flew Rynair then on the terravision coach to the train station then a 5 minute walk.Arrived at the MECENATE PALACE with our friends only to be told our rooms were unavailable until the next day! Theyarranged a taxi witch took us to the Mediterrano a art deco hotel that does a lovely breakfast. The next day moved back, the rooms were very nice and clean as was the bathroom.Breakfast was on the roof terrace not much of a spread but they did have tea and coffee in the rooms. the location is very good for the attractions.The MARIA MAGGIORE CHURCH across the road is a must superb. We did all the sites walking and came across some lovely bars and cafes

Reviews.Title: “Gambled and made the perfect choice!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tasco1023
Reviews.Content: After my husband and I decided to take spend two nights in Rome before our 13 day cruise throughout Italy, I spent literally a few months on and off researching the perfect hotel to stay in for one day in front of the cruise and one day after. I asked friends, checked the internet, read reviews for so many places, etc and then said, "I'm so confused..I will just go through Priceline and ask for a four star hotel in central Rome. How bad can it be????" Anyway, I plugged in the details with a very reasonable bid and was granted the Mecentate Palace HOtel. I was thrilled because this was one of the ones that I had marked as a favorite (with about 20 others) so I thought it was a great move. From there I read all there was about it, checked it's location, etc. and was ready. I have to tell you that this hotel was perfect in everyway. The location in the center of Rome was near restaurants, shops, and numerous gelato stores. The hotel was quaint, really continental and the service and staff was outstanding. The room had a wonderful oversized queen bed and our view was of the basilica across the street which was lit beautifully at night. Food on the rooftop terrace was very good, even though the menu did not have many choices. Questions asked to the front desk agents, who also serve as the concierge, were answered with much concern for you r understanding and enjoyment. The rooftop breakfast was very good again, with a wonderful view of the city. Would I stay there again? You bet!!! It's defintiely worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDiva70
Reviews.Content: My mother and I won a trip to Rome from The 1928 Jewelry Company. We had been told by many people that had visited Europe that the hotels weren't like the ones at home. The company was making our hotel reservations and we worked together on picking the hotel... The Mecenate Palace was a great decision. It felt just like home. The front desk staff spoke perfect English ( communication was a concern for me). They were kind, helpful and professional. Carlos, Roberto, Pasquale and Alberto were terrific (i hope i have those names right) ... but everyone on the staff was polite and professional. The hotel offers transportation to and from the airport (110 euros rt) Very convenient. The rooms were clean with crisp white linens and towels.. bring your own washcloth if that's what you are accustomed to. The bathroom was nice and spacious. We had a double bedded room... that means there are 2 twin beds pushed together... keep that in mind if you don't plan on sharing the same bed with your travel partner. The hotel offers breakfast ... it was a great mix of items. Light but filling. We ate dinner in the hotel's rooftop restaurant... a little costly for chicken w/green salad and steak w/spinach... 44 euros... 78 USD when I checked my AMEX. But the food was good and we were on vacation. There's a great gelato shop a few doors down and a nice restaurant on the corner. The Santa Maria Maggiore is across the street and absolutely beaufiful. The train/bus station is a short walk. There are shops conveniently located within the hotels view if you need common items... snacks, water, personal items, calling cards, etc. I enjoyed opening my window and looking out on the street as the day got started. The hotel just had a nice feel to it. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great honeymoon here”
Reviews.Author: WeybridgeScottie
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for 3 nights for our Honeymoon and we had a great time. We booked the stay through Expedia so we didn't have any of the trouble that some of the other people have had with different rates etc. Our room was in the newer annexe where you have to come out of the hotel and go down the street a little. It was super clean and very quiet away from the road although we had initially hoped to stay in the main part of the hotel as it looked as though it had more character I think the annex beds sound alot more comfortable and the rooms are alot quieter. The breakfast in the roof top terrace was a big highlight the views are great. We didn't eat any meals in the restaurant as there are so many great places to choose from in Rome.
