We found the location to be good not far to walk to the major sights and less than a 10 min walk from the train station. The pick up and drop of sightseeing bus stops just beside the hotel if you want to use it and there is a tourist information booth just beside the hotel. The staff at breakfast were friendly enough.We really enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service”
Reviews.Author: HamCheese
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Great location for train station (10 minutes walk), metro stops (5 mins) & sights (colosseum, forum within 20 mins). Tasty ice cream bar next door, and many restaurants in the vicinity. - Helpful, friendly staff: no problems in asking them to contact our next hotel for a reservation confirmation. Excellent English. - We had a clean, spacious room, including whirlpool bath & PAYG internet. - Rooftop terrace breakfast very enjoyable (although you need to stand and peer over the balcony to truly appreciate the view). Supplement for cooked breakfast. Cons: - Our room could have done with a bit more soundproofing. Not bad, but corridor noise very audible. - We were given a room in a seperate block 30 secs walk down the street from the hotel. No real problem (there was an attendant located in our block in case we needed assistance), but it meant we had no view. It could have been irritating if it was raining as we went to breakfast. Overall, a really enjoyable experience: thoroughly recommended, especially for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service - book EXECUTIVE FLOOR”
Reviews.Author: borntoexplore
Reviews.Content: Was very worried after booking this hotel through priceline since the front desk seemed to have outrageous additional charges for 2 small kids ( $165.00/ day extra) . After several phone calls, complaints and different quotes from different staff memebers at teh front desk I did end up with $ 50.00 extra instead of the $165. Furthermore, the hotel website did promote a LOWER rate than the already paid $ 300.00/ night for 2 adults through priceline. I do mention this b/c I did meet other fellow american travellers facing the same issues upon check out - being requested to pay for americans unusually high extra fees for accomodating children. So I would advise to stress the total cost factor before travelling to Italy - after all it is ITALY and everything is negotiable . We then had a GREAT stay at the EXECUTIVE FLOORS of the hotel, next to the original hotel building. Modern, newly renovated airconditioned rooms w/ double bed and sofa sleeper. Stayed 4 nights in total, after teh second night a couple of 2 young girls next door started to party all night long with 6-8 other teenagers in the room - the hotel staff could not stop them. Again: it is ITALY... They did move us back to the main building and upgraded to JUNIOR SUITE w/ private roof garden - beautiful view, 2 rooms, OLD roman style - and OLD roman bedding. Although we certainly did appreciate the upgrade I can understand now the negative coments of some travellers reg the uncomfortable bedding - no big issue for us, since we were grateful for the beauty of teh suite and the roof garden and the wonderful roof garden breakfast ,but would certainly recommand EXEC FLOORS over the previous building. Would stay again but NOT in a reg room ...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YN_LO
Reviews.Content: loved the hotel, really nice and clean room. The free breakfast at the roof terrace was the perfect to start the day!

Reviews.Title: “Do your homeworl and you could be in for a treat!”
Reviews.Author: Maclevans
Reviews.Content: From my review of all tripadviser comments together with my recent experience at the Mecenate Palace, I have the following points for anyone considering this hotel: + There is no formal price list for this hotel. They get bookings off travel agents at the highest price, and discount online auction sites at the lowest. If you use the best-known discount auction site like I did, you should get a room for around 120 British Pounds a night. This is very cheap for a city offering very expensive accomodation at the 4-star level and above. + Some rooms are air conditioned (mine was). BUT judging from reviews, others arent. If you are travelling in summer, I would ask for A/C in advance of arrival. + The staff were friendly - particularly if you make it clear you are not American. Regardless, at 120 pounds, who cares if they are not?! + Location is fine. Centrally located and a short walk to clean streets/ tourist sites. - There definitely seems to be a theme where cheaper purchases get sidelined if tours/more expensive offers come in. Beware of this by confirming your booking in advance. Overall, I would come here again if I could get the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, once we got to stay there!”
Reviews.Author: sallymarch
Reviews.Content: We (two couples) arrived around midday, having flown into Rome with Ryan Air and transferred using Terravision transport to Termini station (around a ten minute walk), all of which worked well. It was disappointing, therefore, when we arrived at the hotel, to be told that owing to their mistake they had no room for us. Allegedly, their booking agent had booked us in for three days from the 17th (the day of our departure) rather than the 14th. They were full, they said. However, they would arrange for us to stay in a four star hotel around the corner, at their expense. This arranged, the porter took us and our baggage to the alternative hotel. This alternative had pleasant rooms but virtually no other facilities. The breakfast room was windowless and there was a small lounge too. However, there was no bar and the roof terrace was closed. We re-grouped at a local bar to decide on our itinery for the day and whilst sitting there we saw the same porter take at least two other groups of people to the 'overflow' hotel! It seems someone had made a lot of mistakes......or had they? When we managed to get booked in the following day (no apology however!), we noted that there was a large tour group from the U.S. booked in. I suspect that their booking was received after ours and seemed a more attractive proposition, so we were bumped! For us, this was a really bad beginning to our holiday. We chose this hotel because of the location, the rooftop bar, the rooms and the good reviews. We didn't want to stay somewhere else. Anyway, when we did move in to the right hotel, the service was fine, the breakfast pleasant although not particularly varied in content and roof bar splendid early evening. Watch out for the price of cocktails though..... Nine euros each! We found Rome to be very pricey compared to other European cities, not helped by the current exchange rate of £ against Euro. Our great bargain was the Roma Card, 20 Euros for unlimited public transport for three days plus free entrance to two museums/sites. Dinner nearby at the Two Columns restaurant was nice, reasonable, and not too far to stagger after a hard day's sightseeing. Whilst we enjoyed the stay at the Mecenate, we felt not a little put out by our initial treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Do not expect good food or friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: cpope760
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were clean and the bathrooms were large and very nice. The down side to this hotel was the attitude of the staff and the roof top restaurant. We decided to save time and trouble and arranged a driver from the hotel to pick us up at the airport. The driver was one hour late and when he saw our bags, made a face and let out a groan. He had a beat up car and was rude. Take a taxi instead. I just expected more for the price of this hotel and was a bit shocked at the attitude of the driver. Also, if you stay at this hotel do not eat at the restaurant. Have a drink because the view is wonderful but do not eat. It is expensive and the food was horrible as was the service. Our waiter was very rude and acted like he hated being there. When I told the staff of our experience at the restaurant all three of them just stared at me with a blank face. I heard an other guest complain as well about the food saying it was the worst meal he has ever had. The locatiion is pretty good. We walked to to the attractions in Rome and the train station is very near. I would not stay here again based on the attitude of the staff. This was a dream trip for us and part of the experiece is the hotel and staff. We loved Rome and the excuse of the "Big City" attitude for an excuse to tolerate rudness is not acceptable to me. For that reason I would not stay here again or recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “A time capsule”
Reviews.Author: Rosyjoon
Reviews.Content: I had read great reviews on this hotel. However, when we got there, we were very disappointed. The hotel had not been renovated in YEARS!! The blanket in the room had perhaps not been changed in YEARS! The breakfast was terrible. We perhaps could have gotten a better hotel for less. The location was just okay, and we could hear the street noise. hotel was way over-rated and over-priced. Please spend a little more if you have to, but stay at a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Texasracylady
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, freindly staff. Sits right across the street from Santa Maria Maggiore Basilica. One block from the metro station and 2 blocks from the Termini train station. Great location. We use the metro everyday to get us around. There is a wonderful gelato store that gives large scoops 2 doors down. Not the one on the corner. I miss it already. This hotel has a very nice breakfast if it is included in your package. They make your eggs and bacon fresh in the morning. Make sure that you ask if you get the American breakfast that comes with eggs because they didn't volunteer the information we had to ask and found out 2 days later that it was in our package. There is a Pizza restaurant across the street about one block down. DON"T EAT THERE. The food was as terrible as the service. Enjoy the lovely terrace and bar on the top floor. Drinks very pricey so watch out. Enjoyed our stay and will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great access and nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Nana81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is divided in two buildings - we first stayed in the newer one (probably only finished a couple of months before we came there) which was beautifully furnished / very modern, but we had some ants and asked the hotel staff to move us to the old building. Luckily they still had vacant rooms there and we loved it. Dark red carpet, heavy green curtains, the bath with marble. The atmosphere was dapper and I loved the breakfast on the roof terrace with a beautiful view on Rome. Easy access from the train terminal (by foot around 10 minutes) and in walking distance of the colosseum (if you dont want to walk: metro and buses stop are just around the corner). Nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: alazydaisy
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room for four nights through Priceline. When we arrived, we were told that they didn't have a big enough room because we had a baby and they would arrange for us to stay at a hotel down the block for one night. We told them that we didn't need a bigger room because the baby slept in the same bed as us and didn't use a cot. Still they insisted they couldn't give us the room because it was too small and Italian law required that they give us a bigger room since there were three people. I don't know if this is really Italian law or they had just overbooked the hotel. In any event we had to schlep down the block to stay at another hotel for one night, which was a hassle even though a bellman helped us because we had a lot of luggage and a baby in tow. Another reason I suspect the hotel routinely overbooks is that while we were dining at the cafe next door one day, we saw the bellman carrying away the luggage of two other travelers who seemed to be going to the same hotel we were put in for one night. Ironically enough, when we finally checked in the next day, the room was very small. The bed took up 90% of the space. I can't imagine there being a smaller room for two people so I'm still suspicious about their reasons for putting us in another hotel for the first night. On the positive side, the room was quiet and dark enough for us to sleep during the day. The staff were not overly helpful and seemed irritated when we asked them questions. The location is convenient though, with ATMs, internet shops, multiple restaurants, and gelaterias within easy walking distance. You can walk to the Colosseum in 20-25 minutes. The train station is only three blocks away and you can do lots of informal shopping from various sidewalk vendors nearby.

Reviews.Title: “It's a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Portugal_Couple
Reviews.Content: Excellent Staff. Nice Rooms (small, but nice). Good room clean up. Breakfast Ok (enough, but could be better) Good location concerning Sta Maria Magiore and Termini, Walking distance from Coliseum (15-20min), Forum (15-20min), Fontana de Trevi (25-30min.), Pz Spagna (25-30min.) We would prefer a location closer to Fontana di Trevi, Pz Spagna, Via Nazionale, Via del Corso, Pz Barberini...

Reviews.Title: “The hotel has a 4 star mold issue in room 301...besides that it was good”
Reviews.Author: ANDYH428
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. It is across the street from the Santa Maria Maggiore and close by many great restaurants,gelaterias and walking distance to the Termini train station. We were welcomed and quickly escorted to our room. We were booked in room 301. When we went to use the shower we got a little surprise...mold. It was on the shower faucet and the sides of the shower were full of soap scum and mildew. We called downstairs and they moved us to a new room in about 20 minutes. The internet is 7 euros for 12 hours and 10 euros for 24 hours. Not bad (Even though I think wifi should be free of charge in 4 star hotels). It rained allot when we were in town and the hotel let us use one of the many umbrellas that they have in the lobby. The mini bar had reasonable prices.I travel allot and NEVER use the mini bars because of the prices, but this one had coca cola for 3 euros (most restaurants charge 3-5 euros) and snacks for about 2 to 4 euros. Plus wines,beers and waters for a reasonable price. Everything under 6 euros. The rooms are decent size but definitely need an upgrade. The style is very 70s and looks worn out. We had a good view though of the Maggiore from our window.

Reviews.Title: “Great price in the most expensive city in the world!”
Reviews.Author: nickwhite26
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried about this hotel for two reasons. Firstly because it has mixed reviews on TA and secondly, because it was inexpensive and we thought therefore there must be a catch Well were very happy! 18 of us stayed there for 3 nights and not one of the party had any complaints about Mecenate Palace. The rooms were clean, the bathrooms large (and clean), the staff very helpful and polite It is around 1km from the central station, so its within walking distance. The hotel is within walking distance to all the major sites. 1 minute from Santa Maria Piazza, 25 mins walk to the Colusseum, 1hr from Vantican City 20 mins from Spanish Steps (and the designer shops) and 25 mins from the Trevi Fountain It costs around 30 Euros in taxi back to the airport - which is good value I'd give this hotel 95/100 for value, location, cleanliness and the staff

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: Rhine-and-Roses
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mecenate Palace for MLK weekend of 2008. I cannot say enough how much we enjoyed our stay here. From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty, even though we clearly had managed to book this hotel far below the normal price. The room we were given was beautiful- really one of the prettiest, most elegant rooms I"ve stayed in, although it was small. The walls were covered in fabric, the ceiling had beautiful woodwork, ceiling medallions, and a gorgeous chandelier. The draperies, headboard, and upholstery were all custom, opulent, and gave the room the feel of Versailles, without being over the top. But the best was yet to come. When I opened the window, which was small, I found a BIG view of the Maria Maggiore church. I couldn't believe my eyes! From that same window, we were treated to a bird's eye view of a Saints procession on Sunday. The soundproofing was excellent in the room- I did not hear the procession until I opened the window. The bathroom was dark marble, with double sinks, and a separate bath/tub/toilet/bidet area. Everything was incredibly clean, and hot water came quickly and did not run out. There were toiletries, although my ONLY complaint is the teeny tiny package of 3 tissues. (I'd prefer a full box, thank you!) The room had a safe, mini bar, and a coffee/tea service. There was a tiny flat screen TV, with lots of channels, including English, German, French, as well as Italian. The common areas of the hotel were as pretty as our room- lots of crystal chandeliers and beautiful paintings/ murals, and molding. The breakfast was included in the cost of the room and was in a rooftop, enclosed garden. The service was friendly. (Our waitress spoke a bit of English, fluent French, so we worked in French.) The food included rolls, pastries, yogurt, cheese, cold cuts (charcuterie), cereal, canned and fresh fruit, and more. For an additional 5-10 euro, you could also order a hot breakfast with eggs and ham. The rooftop restaurant is apparently opened part of the year, but not when we were there. We ate one evening in the tiny lounge downstairs. The food was good, but the "menu" was extremely limited, and it was really something more of a heavy snack than a light meal. I had turkey and potatoes for 12 euro, while my daughter had a bowl of salad (greens and a few vegetables) for 8 euro. I think the drinks were around 2.50. The neighborhood has a few cafes/bars/bistro. We could not find a real restaurant handy, but I confess we were tired and ended up happily in the hotel lounge. The hotel was an easy walk from the train station -about 4 blocks. The traffic was so heavy that I think it is faster to walk if you do not have a lot of luggage. The desk at the hotel booked us on Ciao Roma tours, which was a hop-on/off tour. It was fine, but I did notice there are several companies, so you might want to check and see if the other companies are more convenient for you. The Mecenate Palace desk staff were very efficient and helpful. They did offer to pick us up at the airport for 55 euro, but we had already booked the Leonardo Express train for 22 euro each RT. They also booked restaurants and other tours. Everyone's English was respectable. There was WiFI\i access throughout the hotel, and a computer with internet and printer available for 3 euro per 1/2 hour by the lobby. The room had comfortable beds, a small (tiny!!) easy chair, a desk with chair, and a small table, as well as two night stands. The closets were fitted with drawers, plenty of hangers, a couple of extra pillows and blankets. There was no iron in the room. If you enjoy a romantic, lush look in a comfortable hotel, I highly recommend this hotel. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent small hotel apart from poor breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: Reports
Reviews.Content: We were recommended to this hotel by satisfied friends. We managed to negotiate a deal whereby we would be given an upgrade to a 'suite' if we stayed five nights. The deal included breakfast. We were given a small but very attractively appointed room with a wonderful view. The room was very comfortable, bath robes and slippers, two wash basins in the bathroom etc., but was very slightly dated. We were very happy and comfortable at this hotel, which we found well placed for walking to many of the sights, and the staff were helpful. The one thing that let it down, was that for a 4* hotel the breakfast was very poor, with even the eggs being charged for. There was some fruit but very little fresh fruit, and a poor selection of breads, meats etc., We feel this let down an otherwise charming small modest hotel. We would recommend the restaurant Agata and Romeo which is only about 200 metres (if that) from the hotel. This is a lovely restaurant which does a degustation. You will need to book though, as it is one of the best restaurants in Rome. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidaymaker
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome, staying in the Mecenate Palace, lovely hotel, handy for the main railway station, and the hop on open top tourist bus, was just over the road. We had tea and coffee in the bedroom, which is very rare. Lovely breakfast, in the 5th floor roof garden restaurant, which overlooked the sites of Rome.The gentlemen on reception very good, they even rung round a couple of bars, to see if any were showing the Arsenal match.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: logcolb
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms at the Mercenate Placae in September 2007. The rooms were nicely furnished and comfortable, perhaps a little on the small side. The bathroom were excellent. My only complaint about the room is that the bed is made up of two twin beds pushed together, not uncommon in Europe, however, they also made up the bed as two twin beds rather than as one larger bed. I was not aware that they would make it up as one bed until our last day. We found the staff to be very friendly and comfortable. The hotel has a nice lobby lounge (with free computer and internet access), and a very nice rooftop restaurant used for breakfast. We had dinner at the rooftop restaurant on evening but the food was just average. The included breakfast was fine, but no hot food was included. The view from the rooftop was great. Have a drink on the roof and eat elsewhere. While the hotel was very nice, comfortable, clean, and the staff friendly, I think there are more charming neighborhoods to stay in in Rome. Some of the areas around the train station is very low class touristy. The hotel is about four blocks from the train station, which can be handy. When we arrived at the train station there was a line several hundred people long to get a cab. The hotel is well situated between 3 metro stops, so you can easily walk 2 blocks and get the metro to get around. This is a very nice hotel, however, if you want more a more charming setting you may want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “mecenate palace a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: instruction01
Reviews.Content: i have to disagree with mr.frommer and other reviewers who rave about this hotel - l. had a deluxe double room - but the room was so small the queen bed took up most of the space my bed almost touched the window (good view of the church) bathroom was good modern plumbing and spacious. after four nights i requested a larger room which they gave me for 50 euros more for a total of 200 euros small livingroom but larger bedroom but in terms of space put the two rooms together for a medium sized room but better than the other room. breakfast was only continental included in the rate nice staff that took care of the breakfast. hotel does not serve dinner which i didn't know when checking in. got sick at one of the local restaurants - neighborhood restaurants not good for me with a sensitive stomach need to eat at really fine restaurant - hotel told me to walk a mile to the roman forum or via veneto two miles away for good restaurants. i after looking on my own found two 5 star hotels that serve dinner perfect for me - my hotel never mentioned these two hotels that serve dinner i find this really mean did the hotel think i would check out?? an average o.k. hotel their rates are reasonable my first room was 150 euros and the suit 200 but i was visiting rome off season in winter. for me i would never return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Rome Vacation”
Reviews.Author: TourTime71
Reviews.Content: We arrived to hotel by shuttle provided by Mecenate. The driver was waiting for us and easily got us to the hotel. When we arrived we found the staff to be helpful and courteous (all speaking excellent English). Our bags were immediately delivered as well as fruit and wine. Our rooms overlooked the Piazza and we had a beautiful view on the 4th floor of the Santa Maria Maggiorre Cathedral. We enjoyed the top floor bar with spectacular views, the lovely restuarant with nice Continental Breakfast and ground floor bar. There was a nice outdoor restaurant next door as well as a good gelato store too! The location is within walking distance of St. Peter in Chains, the Coliseum and the Roman Forum - perfect location! The rooms were very nice and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Virgilio Suite (Room 557)”
Reviews.Author: JChua
Reviews.Content: Since we are only staying one night in Rome, after a 4 nights stay in the Amalfi Coast, we had wanted a hotel near the Termini station. Having found this hotel from Frommers and after reading tripadvisor's ratings, finally selected the most expensive room in the hotel, the Virgilio suite. Upon arrival at the Termini, we had a rather stressful time locating the hotel since the Termini is such a massive building. Remember to look for the Termini's southern exit, and walk 4 blocks towards the Santa Maria Maggiore Church. Turn left upon seeing the Upim Dept store (at the corner) and cross the road to find the pink and grey coloured hotel. The suite is located on the roof top with a sitting hall, a bedroom and a huge terrace with sunbeds, table and chairs. The antique looking furnitures, fire place, sofa beds, two LG flat screen TV with English channels, free tea and coffee making facilities were good value for 350 euros, breakfasts and VAT included. However, we realised later that every Tom, Dick or Harry could have easily entered our suite through the huge terrace via a publicly accessed un-locked door! This is a serious breach of security, we thought. Though nothing bad had happened to us, but in Rome, we would really have second thoughts staying at the same suite again... Breakfasts served on the roof top terrace was very adequate and good in variety. But the quality of the food is merely of average quality. And from 28 October onwards, there is a one hour adjustment to the clock in Italy/Europe but we only found that out on the morning of 28 October. Had we been told about that upon check in the day earlier, we would be better prepared. Staff were generally courteous but not overly helpful nor enthusiastic, maybe its because we were staying for one night only? That said again, the good thing about staying here is the proximity to the Termini station (for easy and cheap transfer to Rome's Fiumicino airport), Epim supermarket right across the street corner and a taxi rank at the Santa Maria Maggiore church. Do allow at least 2.5 hours for departures at Fiumicino airport. The airlines'' check in counter can be quite long depending on season and the time of the day. But the airport itself is not a very big one, with only Terminals A, B and C - easily walkable from one terminal to another.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: amax07
Reviews.Content: Had read the reviews here before booking. Just delighted with the hotel. Great value for money. Thoroughly recommend it. Spent four nights 13-17 Oct. Arrived late Sat - hotel obviously full over weekend. Got Room 101 next to lift. Asked next morning if they could do better and got moved without question to a larger twinbedded room (effectively a king-sized bed) with bigger bathroom - very comfortable - linen and towels changed each day. Staff were polite, courteous and helpful. Starting the day with breakfast on the lovely roof terrace was delightful. Warm water for tea one morning was quickly replaced with boiling water without any fuss. Used the hotel's fixed price taxi service to airport -got caught in morning rush-hour traffic queues so glad no meter was running-driver eventually used back streets to get us to check-in on time. The hotel was a lovely oasis of calm after a day doing the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jus2007
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Stayed for three nights and would definitely recommend. Clean, quiet, comfortable rooms. Helpful staff. Lovely roof terrace. Good location for all main sights around the city.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cat063
Reviews.Content: Booked two roooms but on arriving at the hotel were told they only had one room. We were given a suite for the first night which meant one of us had to sleep on a sofa bed and we all had to share one bathroom. The suite had an electrical socket which did not work so the kettle had to be used in the bathroom. The bath plug was broken. The following day we were moved to two rooms which were very small but adequate. Breakfast was very disappointing. We had to pay extra for anything cooked. The tea and coffee were luke warm and when we requested more hot tea/coffee it never came. The breakfast manager was surly and the staff struggled to serve and clear tables efficiently. There were many complaints about having to sit at uncleared tables.

Reviews.Title: “Booking Cancelled !”
Reviews.Author: greg2302
Reviews.Content: We didn't actually get to stay in this hotel, when we arrived they said there had been a problem with my credit card and the booking had been cancelled - surprising considering hotels.com said the booking was guaranteed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: gillyboos
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were extremly helpful. The rooms were lovely, not huge, but we had a baby with us so had a lot of kit with us. Excellent location in terms of sightseeing and the station. Great all round hotel, well priced.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: deeann7
Reviews.Content: Arrived weary and room was 1 hour shy of being ready (it was only noon) so they were very nice about keeping our luggage while we walked across the street to tour the basilica, then ate an enjoyable lunch at the corner outside cafe. We were extremely pleased with our Room #415 which overlooked the piazza with a grand view of St. M. Maggliore - breathtaking - the room being very clean, comfy kingsize bed, very nice bathroom with all the amenities you could want + great shower! Kept the large window open to enjoy the sights but was concerned about the traffic noise; however, the triple paned window (?) kept out all the noise and we enjoyed 3 nights of great sleep w/quiet A/C. Breakfast on the terrace was very enjoyable - choices of juice, cereals, pastries, rolls and fresh fruit. Front desk staff always very courteous and helpful. Great location with metro just a short walk away and walkable to all the main Rome attractions. We always felt safe walking back to the hotel at night, whether from the downtown area or from the metro. We would definitely stay here again and am glad we chose this very fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: sambucca45
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at this hotel and would definitely return if I ever visit Rome again. Excellent, clean room. Friendly staff. Adequate free breakfast. Free newspapers available. Free upgrade to a deluxe room because we stayed more than 5 nights. Best feature is it's location. 5-10 minutes from trains, subway and buses.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeteandRon
Reviews.Content: The Mecenate Palace is really quite a classy hotel and we were well pleased with our 3 night stay there. We had booked a triple room and were allocated a room in the Executive Suite. This is located in an annex to the main hotel - it is actually up a flight of steps from the pavement. At the top of the steps you go through a small reception hall where there is an open inner courtyard. Most of the rooms in the Executive suite open into this courtyard. Room was very nice indeed. Double bed into left and the extra bed was a bed settee in the room straight ahead as you entered. Bathroom was luxurious with the hand basin surrounded by a marble top and there was a nice spa bath. Air conditioning was not working at first so was reset at our request by reception. After this, it was severe to the extent the room was cold! The beds had quite a thick blanket on them which puzzled us at first and we took them off to sleep during the first night. We were actually cold during the night and the following nights kept them on - we needed them! A feature of the hotel is the roof-top terrace. This comprises two parts, the breakfast room and the more open bar area. Views are lovely. Breakfast was okay and the hotel do serve a limited range of simple bistro type dishes on the rooftop terrace in the evening. Adequate enough if you are not too hungry. We ate one night in the street café on the corner beside the hotel entrance. Ok but not the best and very under-staffed with only a single over worked waiter serving. The next night we walked a couple of blocks towards Termini station where we ate in a street restaurant which was much superior and if anything may have been slightly cheaper. Impressive looking hotel and rooftop terrace is lovely

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wedding Reception at the Mecenate Palace!”
Reviews.Author: TheNewMrsA
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to start this, as I have so many wonderful things to say about this hotel and its staff. I got married on August 24th 2007 and stayed in this hotel for the duration of my stay in Rome. With a lot of help from Alberto, I organised a wonderful wedding reception for us and 30 guests (thanks Vitto and all the guys!!). The food was excellent, the wine flowed and the roof terrace provided us with a welcome haven from the hot streets below. Most of my guests also stayed at this hotel (ages ranged from 1 to 65) and everyone had the most amazing time. We all felt that it was a good base to travel around rome - with a tour bus stopping directly opposite the hotel. The view of the Basiliica from my hotel window made me feel as if I was in a film. The rooms were excellent (with tea and coffee facilities, which isn't always the case in Rome hotels - SO important if you drink as much tea/coffee as my new husband!) Even guests who had stayed in other Rome hotels (Fancy ones at that!) raved and swore that they would stay again when next in Rome. I can honestly say that not one Italian was rude to me - they may not crack a smile every time they see you though. I have not got one complaint - only that my trip wasn't long enough!

Reviews.Title: “Something a bit STRANGE”
Reviews.Author: chocolate_hoops
Reviews.Content: Okay. So in the end we didn't stay in this hotel. I planned to visit Rome for 5 days with 2 of my friends. We're all 19, and we're all quite sensible, but we were messed around by this hotel and it ruint our trip pretty much. Baring in mind we went just before/on the bank holiday weekend at the end of August when it was BOILING hot (don't go in August if you want to walk around loads, so exhausting). We first of all took the airport shuttle bus, and they took us to the wrong hotel at first, but that wasn't a problem because the driver just asked for the address and we gave it to him. When we finally got there, we were hot and tired (no air conditioning in the airport shuttle bus). We waited for quite a bit before actually speaking to someone. When we did he said they had trouble with our booking. They had sent me a confirmation email. And then he told us our room had been given away. I was FURIOUS. He didn't say sorry. Note: the people in Rome can be ridiculously rude and unhelpful. So he then explained why. Even though I had a confirmation email, he said they had tried to authorise my credit card the NIGHT BEFORE (what the hell?) and said it wouldn't be authorised (my card is fine everywhere else). I asked why I wasn't contacted. He said he had no contact details, despite the contact details being RIGHT THERE on the confirmation email. The main problem was that he then didn't help us out at all. No apology, no help. So we were stuck hanging around for a bit and it was really quite stressful in the seering heat. Some men tried to stop and help us, but as expected we had to ignore them, as these people are not to be trusted. Fortunately enough there was an internet cafe almost next to this hotel, and the guys in there were SO helpful, one even offered to let us use his SatNav so we could find where this hotel was. It's safe to say we tipped the people in there. But in the end we went to the San Remo hotel, who could only put us up for 3 nights, and it was so hard to get another hotel that particular weekend, that we just cut our trip short and booked a flight 2 days earlier than we were originally going to go =[.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Roma”
Reviews.Author: daisymoochi
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the early hours of the morning due to BA delays at Gatwick so we were not there for the hotel car which was due to meet us. We took a taxi and clung on for our lives. It was interesting, the drivers drive as if they were in a F1 Ferrari ! On arrival we were met by a courteous receptionist who gave us a map and general advice. Our luggage was taken to our room which was in the annexe on the Executive Floor. We had booked a triple room, there were twin beds plus a fold up bed, no problems, room was clean, bedding was crisp, clean and fresh. Decor was modern. Bathroom was exceptional with spa bath, two shower heads, toilet, bidet and vanity basin, complete with lots of towels and toiletries. Also two bathrobes. After a good few hours sleep we went to the main building for breakfast on the roof terrace, I had particularly booked this hotel because of the terrace and was not disappointed, it was lovely both in the morning for breakfast and at night as a roof top bar. Lots of choice at breakfast, yoghurts, fruit, breads, cereals, ham cheeses, various drinks. No complaints. There is another bar near reception which is open for light lunches and afternoon tea, we only saw this open on our last day as we were out the rest of the time. The hotel decor is beautiful. Staff were friendly and helpful especially Claudio, always smiling. We had a tv in the room but channels were limited, we were out so much we did not need it anyway. We also had tea/coffee facilites. We used the internet in reception for a small fee which was charged to the room, there are lots of internet cafes around but are tacky, hot and small and you have to show your passport/ID before use. Rome itself was lovely, very hot, we saw all the sights we wished to see and I was happy that I had pre-booked most of them online before leaving UK as it meant we did not have to queue in the heat. Lots of photos opportunties. No problems in the hotel area,although there are some people begging, lots of nice bars and restaurants, 5 mins from the Termini station. Walk to Colloseum from hotel about 15 mins. We got the hop on/off bus to St Peters and walked back from there passing all the other well known attractions on the way. Main thing is to take care crossing the roads, be prepared for the speed of the taxi drivers and hold on tight. If you like Macdonalds (which I do not) then you will find plenty of them in Rome. If we return we would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Debby1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights from June 30th through July 2nd. We found the hotel to be excellent. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and forcoming with information. It was very clean and the breakfast was wonderful. The view in the morning was a wonderful way to start your morning. We had their service pick us up at the air port. The driver was standing waiting for us with our name clearly written. We were wisked away and arrived at our hotel within about 20 minutes. We felt like this was a wonderful value since the $$ is a mess compared to the euro right now. The hotel is also located near a wonderful church you might miss. There are good resturants and it is very close to the train station. Be careful about using a taxi to the train station. It is only about three blocks away, but the taxi driver charged us per bag and it was about a $30 trip. We took the train from Rome to Venice and it worked out wonderfully. They had helped us work this out before we arrived via email. We loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Heiner5
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel thru tripadvisor and booked it thru venere for a short 2 night trip at 180 EURO per night for the double room. The hotel is nicely located a 5 minutes walk from Termini station where the airport express (from Leonardo da Vinci Airport) arrives and is the only station in Rome where to board both Metro lines A and B which brings you to all the important sites in this city. The frindly staff at the check in gave us a map and info for guided tours of rome (there is hop-on-hop-off bus stop just 2 minutes away for a doubledecker bus tour, recommended!) and we had a room facing the street. The room is probably italian standard if it comes to size so dont expect a large room. The bed is really just a double, not Queen or King size but it was OK for us. The bath is clean and bright and towels were there in abundance. After a shower the floor is very wet though since there is no shower curtain just a glass covering maybe a third of the tub. There is a minibar and a fridge and a coffeemaker with free coffee. The nights were quite but you could hear the noise made by the elevator which was adjoining our room. Breakfast is a little more than the usual italian job since you get toast, baguette, cheese, marmalade, mortadella, some kind of "ham", cereals and if you are there early enough you will find some fresh fruit. For an extra 4 Euro they even prepare an egg for you. The breakfast is served on a lovely terrace on the roof of the hotel and in the afternoon this terrace is a bar. We had a small local beer (at 6 EURO) some icecream from the hotel ice cafe and 2 glasses of tap water which they charged us 2 EUROS each for! The view may be nice and the staff friendly but the prices up there were just killing me. No wonder no-one but us was up there, a few people came to ask for a bucket of ice: they probably drank their glass of tap water in their rooms for free...;). The restaurants around there were typical tourist restos, nothing really special. We walked some 20 minutes to a "Slow-Food" resto called Tram Tram which has really excellent italian kitchen as reasonable prices (dont expect a 6 EURO pizza though). Will I go there again: not sure, location is excellent but I would probably try another hotel for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Beony
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is ok. The rooms are extremely small, but clean and well appointed. The location is close to the Termini and the area is safe but dirty and there aren't many things to do around the hotel. Do not eat around the Terminin area unless you want bad Italian food....we actually had canned mushrooms on our pasta....what are you kiddin? The terrace where breakfast is served is very pretty and the breakfast is very good. The staff was very friendly and helpful. No internet except in the lobby where they charge for it.....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: dilzio
Reviews.Content: The Mecenate Palace is a great value - a bit off the traditional tourist path but recently renovated, easy to get to and from, and with Italian charm to boot! We stayed in the newly renovated annex. The area was always quite and clean and we also had access to a small shared garden. Everything worked as expected and we had no problems with check in or check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Beautiful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: GraceN
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I just returned from a 12-day trip to Italy. Let me first say that this was our first trip to Italy, and the reviews here helped us so much in our trip planning- everything went off without a hitch! I booked this hotel based on the positive reviews I read here, and I was not dissapointed. We visited the "Big-three" of Italy: Rome-Florence-Venice. We arrived in FCO on May 6, and stayed for 3 nights at The Mecenate Palace. We left on May 9 for the rest of the trip, but returned and stayed for an additional night on May 16 for the night before our flight back home from FCO. Location: The location of the hotel was convenient and fairly close to Termini, about 4 blocks. Before I arrived I was slightly concerned about the location, because I read that the Termini area was a bad area. But it turned out to be okay. I guess I'm use to being in worse areas in New York City, you just have to get used to dodging beggars, pay attention to your surroundings and keep your hands on your purses, wallets, and your luggage. We were happy with the location because the hotel was close enough to Termini to be convenient for buses/trains/metro, and far away enough from Termini to be safe and comfortable. There were two cafes close by, there was a bank with ATM directly behind the hotel on Via Merculana, and there was a good-sized supermarket on Via Gioberti, about 2-3 blocks from the hotel. We walked to the Colosseum/Forum on our first day there from the hotel. (It is a long walk though, if you are not used to walking a lot). The rest of the time we either took the #64 bus from Termini to the sites, or took the Metro. If you don't feel like taking public transportations, the hop-on/hop-off bus is also available in front of the beautiful Santa Maria Maggiore church, which was on the left side of the hotel. Rooms: The rooms were nicely furnished with damask window drapes, marble bathroom and polished wood furnishings. The in room safe worked fine. Teas and coffee was complimentary in room, and we had a mini bar (but we never use the mini bar in hotel rooms anyway).Our room was a smallish size for the first 3 nights, but I guess normal for a city hotel room. We were okay with it but I can see some people might think it's too small. It was enough room for our luggage and we still had room to move around. The bathroom was marble and a decent size for European standards. I am a bath and beauty products nuts and I usually have a lot of bottles with me when I travel. The counter in the bathroom was spacious enough for all my stuff so I was happy about that. I was also pleasantly surprised that the hair dryer was actually strong enough to dry my long hair. There was a bathtub with shower, and also a handheld showerhead. There was a glass shower door, although the door only covers about 1/3 the length of the bathtub so the floors did get a little wet when we showered. When we returned to stay at the hotel for 1 night before our flight back, we were given an upgrade. This time the room was larger and they gave us bathrobes and slippers. The rooms were spotlessly clean. The sheets felt thick and I think had a pretty good thread-count (500 maybe?) The bed and pillows were comfortable, but the mattress was definitely firm. I happen to like firm mattresses, and I slept like a baby the whole stay. Staff: The staff were definitely well-trained and helpful. The front desk staff were polite and efficient. When they learned that it was our first time in Rome, they gave us a map and directions to the sites even before I asked. The bellmen and staff serving the breakfast were also courteous and they even smiled! Breakfast: The food was okay. They had a small selection of pastries, cold-cuts, breads, canned mixed-fruits, yogurts, cheeses. It was good the first day, but after 3 days I was a little bored. The coffee was very good though, it was dark, strong and well balanced, but not overbrewed and over-bitter like Starbucks coffee. You could order cappucino or espresso at an additional cost. Breakfast was served on the roof-top terrace which had a nice view. Overall, I was satisfied with this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: emma261
Reviews.Content: i have just come back from rome and had a fabulous time,i suprised my husband for his 30th and wanted a medium priced hotel. i booked direct through the hotels website as they have great offers, mine was that i got a free light meal. the location is fabulous as the hotel is directly opposite the Basilica of St. Mary Major, which is magnificent. it is also a ten to fifteen minute walk from temini station. My room was average in size and clean. the breakfast room was on the roof in a conservatory which opened onto a terrace, from here you can see the colloseum and the vatican, breaky consisted of breads, cheeses, meats, cereals, cakes, croissants, tea, coffee, juices, jams, honey, etc etc, which was sufficient, all rooms were air conditioned and the rooms kept out the noise of the road below. all in all a great hotel superb location and when i return i will be using the hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “An O.K. Hotel”
Reviews.Author: QueenMimi
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 2 nights. The main reason we chose this hotel was because it was well ranked in Tripadvisor and we got a good rate for a Rome hotel. The neighborhood did not prove to be a problem to us. We felt safe whether we walking about during the day or late in the evening. It was very convenient to the train station. We walked there, bringing along our luggage. The staff, especially housekeeping, was very helpful. The rooms were not as luxurious as some that I have stayed at in Rome, but they were certainly adequate and very clean. The bed and bedding was very comfortable. The only negative is that we felt that the breakfast was lacking. This is is comparison to breakfasts that we have had at other hotels in Rome. I heard some men who were guests, saying that they didn't think much of the breakfast. Would we stay here again? Maybe, if we got a great deal again. But, I would probably try to find some where else.

Reviews.Title: “Sound proof...”
Reviews.Author: Tia_B
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Mecenate Palace for four nights. It was quite pleasant but rather a lower end of a 4* hotel rather than a full 4*. Very close to the Coloseum and the Forum, so in this respect it was great. However, the hotel is on a hill (Esquiline hill), so it could be a tiring climb when returning after a full day out walking. Also every single street in Rome is cobbled which makes it really hard on your feet, so don't even think of wearing your stilettos girls! The cobbles also multiply the traffic noise, so the double-glazed windows at the hotel came very handy. The standard room is on a small size: you can walk around the bed and there is some space for a table with a TV and couple of chairs. Bathroom is small but adequate. The shower above the bath had an overhead tub which was useless, but the hand-held attachment was very good, although the water temperature varied at times. The room was clean and the bed quite comfortable. There is a terrace with lovely views of St Maria Maggiore, and top of the Coloseum, however you can't enjoy the view if you're sitting down because of the wall. They have a bar that serves drinks from 5PM. If I were to come to Rome again I would probably stay closer to the Trevi fountains or near Piazzia Campo Di Fiore, it's just a little bit easier to reach most of sights from that end of Rome. Have a lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PELISSANNE
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights from the 23 to 26 April. Having been on several websites including the hotel's I decided to book the Residence rather than the hotel itself. This is located a couple of doors down from the hotel and up a flight of marble steps. I made this choice for several reasons- firstly the rooms are larger and the bathrooms are equipped with a jacuzzi. Although I requested a room at the back we were given one that looked onto the street. But Ireally can't complain about this seeing that we checked in at 9am and gotthe room immediately. I particularly appreciated the fact that the blanket was encased in a sheet, there were feather pillows, the bed was very comfortable, and the sheets were changed every day. In contrast to the hotel it is furnished in a contemporary style. The bathrobes provided an added touch of luxury. In fact the only thing that could be improved on is the breakfast. Tinned fruit and synthetic tasting orange juice wasn't very appealing. All in all I think it was good value for money for Rome(170 Euros per night with breakfast)

Reviews.Title: “decent enough hotel”
Reviews.Author: ardley
Reviews.Content: stayed here on 22nd april for 4 nights.found the rooms very small and little bit dated.the breakfast was nice and had a great view from the rooftop.do feel the the price for a room here is a bit expensive and could do better for the price.it also borders on a area which has been described in many books as undesirable,and to a certain degree i can understand why. having said that it is easy walking distance to the colosseum and all the other major attractions.tube is only 2 mins walk away but not that great for getting about apart from to the vatican. rome itself is wonderful and would return but not to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Iain1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week long break in Rome. I had read all the reviews on this website and I have to say that we were more than happy with our choice. The Mecenate Palace rooms were really nice, small compared to what you get in the US but perfectly adequate. We stayed in the main part of the hotel and had a room looking into the court yard so it was quiet. I personally thought that the bed we had was really comfy and had no problems sleeping at all. Breakfast in the mornings was good (Continental Breakfast), really liked their coffee and made for a good start to the day. Good view from the Terrace which was not open for breakfast when we were there as it was cold in the mornings. A lot has been said about the location but I have to say that I was happy, not too far to the Metro station (Vittorio Emanuele) at the bottom of the road and close to the Colosseum. We didn’t feel uncomfortable walking around at night. As the hotel does not cover evening meals we managed to find a couple of nice restaurants not too far from the hotel. The first was called UNICOM (Restaurante Pizzeria), which is just past the basilica, turn left out of the hotel and follow the pathway around keeping the Basilica Santa Maria on your right as you walk round past the ROMA shop take the next left (Via Santa Maria Maggiore) and walk down the hill and it's the one with the piano in the window, they have a pianist on most nights which was a nice change from the piped music. The second one to try was called Trattoria Tinimo (or something like that). Directions are the same as UNICOM once here you will see a Galato shop across the road (Via Cavour) if you walk to the right of the Galato shop (not down Via Cavour) on the right hand side of that road on the up slope you should see some yellow down lights and this is the Tratoria. Lots of choice but had a lot of Sea food (not that I like Sea food) but there were other choices as well. In all got to see everything that we wanted to in Rome without having to rush anywhere. The open top tour bus was a good way to get an idea of all the main points on interest. I would use this hotel again if the coin in the fountain works. P.S. Don't forget to go into the Basilica it was really impressive and right on the doorstep. P.P.S If you intend to take an Audo tour - Vatican & Colosseum don't forget to take some ID. Ciao.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with very hard beds!”
Reviews.Author: DianeIllinois
Reviews.Content: My husband recently spent a week at the Mecenate Palace Hotel in Rome. It was a lovely and clean hotel in a wonderful area of Rome. It was a few blocks from the main train station, plus it was in easy walking distance to many of the sites in Rome. Included with the room was a breakfast every morning that offered yogurt, cereals, fruit, juice, cheese, meat, various kinds of bread, etc. Everrything about the hotel was great except for the beds. Our bed was the hardest and most uncomfortable bed I've ever slept in--well, I didn't actually sleep much during the whole trip. The pillows were also very thin and hard. I slept only a few hours during the whole trip because of the bed. Also, even though the description of the hotel says they have air-conditioning, they don't turn it on until it's "summer". The temperatures in Rome were quite mild and our room was very warm, but we were unable to turn on the air. We had a window that opened up to the street--we could open it to cool off our room, but because of the street noise, we couldn't keep it open while we slept. I honestly think I would have rated this hotel as excellent had the beds offered just a bit of comfort--everything about the hotel was wonderful except for the beds.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Pam-Ruislip
Reviews.Content: We are a group of friends who have a city break together once a year. We leave husbands, boyfriends and children behind for a break away with 'the girls' although this is not necessarily an accurate description of our age range! This year was Rome and it was fabulous. We arrived late Friday morning and it was lunchtime by the time we arrived at the hotel. As other reviewers have noted, there is no restaurant in the hotel but we found no problems with finding good value places to eat. We took a tour on the Open Top bus (number 110) from Termini that afternoon to get some idea of location and it certainly gave us a good taste of our Roman holiday. On Saturday we had decided to go to the Vatican but when we got there, trying to meet up with our guide from Angel Tours proved difficult as there was a special event happening in St Peters Square and it was thronged and various entrances had been blocked off by the police. One tip - it's worth checking with the hotel if they know of anything happening at the Vatican/St Peters. We had checked the Vatican website but this event wasn't mentioned. Still we eventually set off and did the usual lengthy wait to get into the Vatican museum but it's worth the wait - it really is spectacular. Our favourite was the Map Room - completely jaw-dropping. The Catholics amongst us enjoyed the Sistine Chapel as it had special meaning but the crowds don't make it much of a spiritual event. We had no trouble spending much of the day at the Vatican and St Peters. Sunday we explored the Colosseum, Forum, Palatine Hill, Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. Yes, we all tossed our coins - the fountain is quite a sight. Monday was the day for the Pantheon, Church San Giovanni in Laterano and some last minute shopping before flying home. We enjoyed a lovely meal in Ristorante Santi in the Via Mannin (about five minutes walk from the hotel) - a family run restaurant and really good value. We loved the hotel - it was in a great location across the road from the Church of Santa Maria Maggiore which is well worth a look. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We loved the happy hour in the bar as this set us up for our evening meal in the great restaurants in Rome. We used the Metro and the local buses - buy a day travel card for 4 Euros - great value and saves on queue time. We were all truly sorry to go home and we hope that our coin dropping in the Trevi will guarantee a return trip to this wonderful city. Pam and the Surrey ladies

Reviews.Title: “More than happy to return here in the future!”
Reviews.Author: YorkieLass
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome with family and friends (7 of us in total) to celebrate a birthday! Flew in to Campinio on the Saturday evening and returned home on the Monday evening. As previous reviews have mentioned, the Terravision bus service between Campinio Airport & the Termini Station in Rome makes everything very easy, although I must admit the organisation at the Termini stands for the return journey left a lot to be desired! The walk from the Termini station to the Hotel was only about 15 minutes - we did it with suitcases in the dark when we arrived, which was a little bit disconcerting, when you have no idea where you are - strange city and all that! We checked in and then met up to find somewhere for a meal! The guy on reception was great and recommended a lovely restaurant - now can't remember the name of it, but it was full of very depressed Welsh Rugby fans! He was more than willing to phone ahead and book for us, but we decided to just take our chances - luckily they had space for us all - just!! Food was good and service was friendly! Euros seem to go a long way in Rome - I was impressed! Breakfast in the hotel was just fine - good coffee and a decent enough continental selection - lots of pastries and donuts to keep my better half more than happy!! Fruit salad was out of a tin, which was a shame, but that's not the end of the world! Plenty of yoghurts to choose from and tinned Prunes, Pineapple, Peaches & Pears (all separate), along with various cereals.and butter/preserves/cheeses & cold meat. The Breakfast room/terrace was very nice, although Romes roof top views do very little for me personally - I know - I am a heathen! When you check in the hotel provide you with an excellent free map of Rome, which we found invaluable during our stay! There is another Metro station (Vittorio Emanuelle) even closer to the hotel than the Termini Station - only a couple of minutes walk - turn right when leaving the hotel reception! The area around the hotel is just fine (it didn't seem dodgy to us) - plenty of restaurants/bars/cafes and the Santa Maria Maggiore Church is just across the piazza from the hotel - some of our group had rooms facing the Church - lovely! We decided to walk on the first day - Colosseum and Palatine Hill/Roman Forum (they are very close to the hotel so we started there), followed by Trajan's Column, Torre Argentina (Roman Temple ruins with apparently over 200 cats living there and cared for by lots of cat ladies!), Piazza Navona & the Trevi Fountain - which is just a wonderful sight! We had lunch at a lovely restaurant just across from the Temple ruins at Torre Argentina - it was great - again I can't remember the name - I'm not doing very well at this am I?!) Once we'd seen the Trevi Fountain, my feet gave up the will to live - so while half our group crawled back to the hotel, the others went to the Spanish Steps! Met up again for a wonderful meal at another restaurant located just off the Piazza Santa Maria Maggiore - stones throw from hotel (think it's called the Piazza Ristorante, but I could be wrong!). Food was gorgeous and again very reasonably priced with a happy, friendly and efficient waiter! Next morning, the hotel kindly stored our bags for us free of charge, while we went to the Vatican - by metro this time! The metro is great - 4 Euros gives you an all day pass - can't go wrong with that! One of our group caught a really bad cold and was really not well that morning (the previous days walking had taken its toll!), so for an extra 60 Euros, the hotel happily let him sleep in his room until late in the afternoon, when we dragged him out for a late lunch before we left for the airport! Lunch was conveniently at the cafe just next to the hotel - again great food and not expensive to sit in - we ate in their outdoor restaurant area - 22 degrees Celsius - lovely!) - 8 main courses (one of us was extra hungry!!) & 2 litre bottles of still water came to 82 Euros! I think, by the sound of things, it's expensive to sit in and simply have an ice-cream/coffee etc., but for a meal, it really is not bad at all and again the service was friendly and efficient! A quick tip for the Colosseum/Roman Forum and also the Vatican - keep your eyes peeled for people walking around offering English Speaking tours (can't remember the cost for the Colosseum/Roman Forum, but it was 40 Euros for the Vatican) - they are quite cheap and you skip the queue - worth it just for that!! I'm sure there must be tours for other languages, but obviously I wouldn't have spotted them - being linguistically challenged as I am! The company we used had their offices on Via Germanico - right next to the Vatican wall - again, being useless I can't remember their name, but they were great and made both the Colosseum/Roman Forum and the Vatican extremely enjoyable experiences - I think the 2-3 hr wait outside the Vatican would have polished me off for sure!! The tours themselves were very informative - 2 of our 3 tours (Roman Forum & the Vatican) were done by students who obviously had a lot of enthusiasm for their subject, although the Colosseum tour was a bit of a let down - the lady doing that one seemed to be simply repeating a script parrot fashion. Anyway - all in all - the hotel provided us with a very pleasant base for our whirlwind visit to Rome - our room wasn't huge, but it was very comfortable with an ensuite bathroom with bath tub/shower over, which was extremely appreciated at the end of that first day!! The bed was extremely comfy (I slept like a log!) and there was a safe in the room, along with mini bar and snacks - the prices were not that bad either! Internet access was very good - computer in reception was 3 Euros for half an hour - spot on for keeping in touch with home! There were telephones in the bedrooms and toiletries supplied in the bathrooms. Staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel's location is really not a problem - I felt safe walking back in the evenings and would be more than happy to stay there again if we ever head back to Rome in the future! If the hotel happen to read their reviews - 3 little requests: ** a couple of biscuits on the Tea/coffee tray would be nice ** the availability of some fresh milk for the tea/coffee in the bedrooms (only needs to be on request by guests), since the long life stuff was pretty dire! We did ask at reception, but none was apparently available, which I find very hard to believe (there was plenty at breakfast for the cereals!) - we were simply given more mini cartons - I think they missed the point of the original request! ** a long shot I know, but If it's possible - BBC news (World service?) on the TVs would be great. They had CNN, so I'm sure they might be able to manage BBC too!? These things certainly didn't spoil our stay at the hotel and I would have no problems staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: Zours
Reviews.Content: First of all, sorry for my english (I speak french) but I think I can help more people in english! Tripadvisor helped me before my trip so I want to help you with sompe advices too. Very nice city trip of two days with my wife in Roma! (2 days are sufficient but necessary!) I choiced this hotel for its place in the center of Roma, close to the Termini where we arrived very late by coach from Ciampino International Airport. 14€ return tickets for an adult. Very simple to arrive in the center and no problem to find the coach (for the coach : see the Terravision Company perhaps on the Internet. With Ryanair, the link is on their website.) If your flight arrive to Fiumiccino International Airport, no problem, you'll find easily the train terminal. (direct way to the Termini) The hotel was excellent. Great bedroom, bathroom and the personnel at the reception speaks french or english and can help you for reservations, informations,... The breakfast wasn't excellent. It's the biggest negative point of this hotel. Don't ask for a coffee or a hot chocolate... it's like boiled water!!! The staff speaks very loud inside the restaurant and all the time! One good thing : the restaurant (for breakfast only!) is on the top of the hotel. What a view! And it's possible to eat outside in summer! As I said, no restaurant for dinner! You have to reserve one at the reception. I can tell you 2 good restaurants in the neighbourhood: Trattoria Monti's (very close; a little restaurant with fresh food of the market!) or Tema, an italian restaurant at 5 minutes walk. The first one was full (find it on the Internet and reserve it!) so we tried the second one. Good! The waiter was very kind. Different touristic menus (22 - 28 -35€ written in french or english!). Pay attention : in Italy the bread isn't free (5€ just for bread without butter!!!)... don't accept it (of course, if you like dry bread...) For the tour of Roma: - You can take the "trambus" (see it on Internet) to make your tour - For the Vatican, take the subway early! You have to visit the Musei Vaticani... wondefull!!! Don't go to the museum by the St Peter's Cathedral, the official entrance is at the opposite side outside the Vatican walls. The queue is VERY big to enter but don't worry, you won't wait a lot, fast entry (many gates inside)! You want a free guided tour? Just wait and look after an english (or french) guided tour and follow it! There are a lot of guided tours for tourists groups all the time! No need of audioguide otherwise you'll stay 5 hours inside! The St Peter's Cathedral is easy to find after the museum and is closed later! - Subway : 1€ for a single way. Attention! In the Termini you have both lines (A and B) but not at the same point! To go to the Vatican, you have to take the red line (A). The entrance is on your left when you put Termini behind you. You'll find a ticket machine inside. If you come back to the hotel, don't exit in Termini but in Victor Emmanuelle station just at the end of the hotel's street! - For the Colosseum, the queue is enormous! Take a combo ticket for the Palatin/Colosseum in the Palatin entrance (no queue!) and so, no queue for you at the Colosseum!!! GREAT! You'll win 30-60 minutes!!! Take an audioguide (1 for 2 is enough!) just after the entrance on your right. - St Angelo Castle was fine. Great view at the top of all the city! The tour we've made in two days? Day 1 : Musei Vaticani - St Peter Cathedral - Piazza Navona (lunch) - Pantheon - Fontana di Trevi - Piazza di Spagna - Piazza del popolo (superb!) and subway there to go back to the hotel Day 2 : Foro Romano (free! If you don't have a touristic guide, take an audioguide at the entrance of Palatin close to Titus Arch) - Palatin (take the combo for Colosseum!) - Colosseum - Piazza Venezia (unknown soldier) - St Angelo Castle - free time for shopping... Take good shoes and a muscular cream!!! Enjoy your trip! Don't forget to throw a coin in the Fontana di Trevi to come back one day in Roma!!!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Made It Very Special”
Reviews.Author: east15
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for my partner and I. The location was ideal and the view from the roof terrace is truly unique! As I work for a tourism company in London dealing with hotel accomodation my expectations are quite high and I have to admit quite fussy! But there were no problems at all. All the staff members were very polite and always helpful to us. Our room was a standard but the space was just fine and the bathroom was very smart! Breakfast was just fine, and having it on the roof terrace or in the eating area which looks out into the Rome skyline was always nice to start off our days. We would happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Mecante Palace nice”
Reviews.Author: ryntyntyn
Reviews.Content: The hotel consists of two buildings. We were in the annex, which was ok, however, the entrance was a few doors down the street,and up about 30 marble steps, that could be quite daunting at the end of the day.The beds were wonderfully comfortable, clean sheets and towels daily, and an expanded breakfast buffett .The staff were accomodating and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: IanLoweBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Look no further. If you want a lovely hotel in a fabulous location then stay hear. If flying from the UK and landing at Ciampino get the terravision airport bus to Via Marsala (road adjacent to Termini train station) then walk in a straight line, down Via Cavour until you reach a large square and the quite spectacular Maria Maggiore Church. Turn left and walk towards the department store cross the road, then cross the road to your right and you will be outside the Mecenate, (there is a cafe on the corner- ice cream superb) The Mecenate has lovely rooms and lovely spacious bathrooms. The breakfast is excellent and the service is first class. I cant understand why people say the rooms are too small..you only stay in there too sleep!!!!!! The colleseum is a fifteen min walk away, and the sights although they seem far on the map, are not far at all. We had two full days and did, Collesum, Trevi, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Roman Ruins all in one tiring day and the next day we dedicated to the Vatican City which again is in walking distance (about 35-40 min walk) We recomment eating in Roberto's and its sister restaurant directly opposite (both on Via Cavour) ENJOY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Courteous staff a 4++++ hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelUmbria
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to many attractions, staff is friendly and knowledgeable. They tolerate Americans very well!!! Rooms are tastefully decorated and spotless. Beds are most comfortable. Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andy1206
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - close to Termini. Great breakfast. However, no AC in December even if outside temp is 60.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Getaway”
Reviews.Author: europetripper
Reviews.Content: When I chose this hotel, I was uncertain about the location. I had read that the area near the train station was not particularly nice. This hotel is a short walk from the Termini Station and only a half-block from Piazza Santa Maria Maggiore. It is a delightful hotel with a lovely lobby, a great staff and a beautiful roof-top breakfast room. My husband and 12 year-old daughter, another couple and their 13 year-old daughter, my sister and I walked to many of Rome's famous sites from the hotel. Even late in the evening, we felt comfortable walking back to the hotel. The rooms are beautifully furnished and the bathrooms are large with both showers and tubs. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BobWSurrey
Reviews.Content: Dont be put off by the images that are available online. The rooms are as in the photos but they look better in real life! Mini bar and shampoo etc available. Even given slippers to use! We had a great time in Rome and this Hotel was well above what I expected. The breakfast (which was included in the price ) was excellent. The only downside is that the hotel is not right in the centre of town. It is close to Colluseum and the main Termini rail station. Getting about is not a problem but if you want to be right in the centre of town try to pick a hotel near Espangne Metro station. I would recommend and go back if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “6 Wonderful Days in Rome & at the Mecenate Palace!”
Reviews.Author: campi
Reviews.Content: We chose the Mecenate Palace Hotel because of the excellent ratings it received from other Trip Advisor reviewers & also because of it's location. We were not disappointed. Our first 3 nights we had a double deluxe room that faced the Santa Maria Maggiore Basilica. What a great location with an excellent view right in the heart of Rome. Our first day out we located the Super Mercato SMA Rocca across the street that others spoke about & purchased deli meats & cheese, pizza slices, bread & beer & other drinks. (Price examples: Limoncello 5.5 euros, Large Baileys 10.5 euros, 6 bottles water 1.59 euros). We half emptied the mini fridge & our leftovers fit nicely. Exiting the hotel & turning right just 2 shops down is a great gelato shop called L'Orso Bianco. One scoop gelatos were 1.5 euros each & they were delicious. We moved into the Virgilio Suite when our daughter & son in law arrived. The balcony is enormous & the tub has a jacuzzi. The suite is beautifully furnished, but honestly 4 people is a bit cramped. This time out we splurged & hired a driver guide that had been highly recommended in the Trip Advisor forum section, Stefano Costantini of Rome Cabs. We hired him for all our transfers from the airport to the hotel, the hotel to our cruise ship, the Golden Princess in Civitavecchia and daily tours. He took us to Ostia Antica, to the Etruscan Countryside, Ceri mountaintop, to the catacombs in Appian Way, to the Capellini Museum for a marvelous view looking down into the Forum, to St Peter's Square for the Pope's blessing, to St Paul's Beyond the Walls and everywhere & anywhere. Wonderful Stefano & the excellent staff at the Mecenate Palace Hotel helped insure that we had a marvelous 5 night & 6 day stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it ! -New Jersey”
Reviews.Author: NJtravelmore
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 25th wedding anniversary. It was wonderful. The hotel is very clean, the roof top breakfast was good, but the location was best. Just a few blocks from the train station meant we could avoid the taxis. Get your bearings first we went the long way the first time. Both lines of the metro can be caught at the train station. We were able to walk everywhere from the hotel. The sights are much closer than they look on the maps, and the shops line the streets so, getting lost wasn,t so bad. Wear walking shoes and carry your guide book , you never know what will be around the corner. We traveled in the off-season so we had no problem picking up tours at our convienience. We would stay here again. Our room was street side and a bit noisy with the windows open, quiet enough with them closed. Rome traffic never seems to stop. We were grateful we were not at a hotel on one of the major roads.

Reviews.Title: “No Air Conditioning in November”
Reviews.Author: Fe3O4
Reviews.Content: My wife & 16-yr old son stayed in room 407 and my in-laws stayed in room 402 from November 17th until November 25th, 2006. We booked this room based on Trip Advisor, & Frommer's reviews and the location. This was all of our first trip to Rome except my wife that came for a meeting a few months prior. Our room was a triple and I would say that it was a little larger than a cruise ship cabin. My in-laws room was a double & I would say that it was about the same size as a cruise ship cabin. The bathrooms are nice, not cruise ship bathrooms. The rooms were very quiet. Our room faced an inner courtyard and there was no traffic noise whatsoever. It wasn't even bad with the window open. My in-law's room faced the main street and he said that with the windows closed it was very quiet. Breakfast was included with our room. It is located on the top terrace and is buffet-style. Selection is canned fruits, cereals, a couple of meat selections, pastries and breads. It is OK but it kind of got tiresome after a few days. The selection does not change. Don't forget, you can order cappucino with breakfast. The temps would be in the high 60's during the day and low 50's to high 40's at night. We & the inlaws were always warm in the room. We had to open the windows to cool off. I don't know if americans are hot or something, but a lot of Romans looked like they were expecting snow storms.
