We were always taking our jackets off and walking around in shirt sleeves trying to cool off. Apparently the hotel turns off the air conditioning system in the fall & winter. Thank God you can open the windows at this hotel. The front desk personnel are not overly friendly, but they will help if you ask for assistance. Don't ask them to get transportation to or from the hotel. Make these arrangements yourself. My father-in-law & I had to go back to the airport to get our luggage (this is because US Airways SUCK!) and the front desk person said that he would arrange a van to bring us back to the hotel for E75. Well later in our trip we found a sign for an airport shuttle and called them a got a van to carry 5 people and luggage for E50. I think the front desk guy made a few extra bucks I read the reviews before we left about how the cafe on the corner is a rip-off. I would like to dispute that. That's the way all cafes & bars are in Rome. They charge for "table service". If you go to the bar and order a cappucino and drink it standing up at the bar it is E0.90. If you sit down at a table it's like E5.00. If you notice, you will see locals come in and order drinks and drink them at the bar and then leave. We stopped at a pastry shop and ordered desserts and cappucinos and sat down at a table and then when we paid the bill it was more than we just paid for our dinners. We learned that lesson. The location is not too bad. You can walk to the Colosseum and the ruins from here. The Termini station is a short walk and this is the worst part. If you plan to use the Metro for transportation a better alternative is to come out of the hotel and turn right and walk to the Vittorio Metro stop. It's actually shorter walk than Termini & you don't walk around drug deals, drunks & prostitutes. And believe me, you will walk by all of these things, especially at night going to & from Termini. The hotel is across the street from one of the major tourist sites. The basilica Santa Maria Maggiore. This is one of the vatican churches. Some of the hop-on hop-off buses stop here so you can buy a tour pass right there. One of the main hop-on hop-off buses, the 110 Trambus, does not stop there. The closest stop is Termini. If you read about pickpockets in Rome we can attest that it is true. My wife was robbed on the Metro. They cut a 6-inch gash in her purse and stole her wallet. She didn't even know until about 30 minutes later. This was on Wednesday, the day of the papal audience, on the Metro heading to the vatican. The Metro was jam-packed and ripe for pickpockets. We got cocky & paid the price, follow the suggestions about carrying valuables. Bottom line; would we stay there again? I believe so. I would try to find other accomodations first though, but I could stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: gloria27
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this four star hotel for 5 nights at the end of october and thought it was the perfect base for exploring the city. It is a 5 minute walk from Termini station with a taxi rank and buses including the open top tour available right outside the hotel in the piazza. We found the neighbourhood to be safe and it is only 10 minute walk to the colosseum. We booked through the hotels website which had the offer of a room upgrade when staying for 5 nights to a room overlooking the basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore which was a lovely view. The 4th floor room had a large comfortable bed, efficient airconditioning and bathroom with bath and shower. We found the staff to be courteous and the views over Rome from the roof terrace where you have breakfast (a well stocked buffet) are lovely. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Winterswan
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel in late September, 2006. We loved our room with a view overlooking the courtyard. The bathroom nicely done in marble. Even toothbrushes and paste supplied in addition to the lotions and shampoo. Although we did not use the drinks in the room bar, we used it for our water. The breakfasts on the terrace were wonderful with the views of Rome a wonderful addition. The breakfast buffet food very much to our liking. We found the staff very helpful and friendly. There was always someone at the desk who spoke fluent English and they were very outgoing every bit the gentlemen. We had no problems during our week stay and would stay here again in the future. This hotel was recommended to me by a co-worker and I would pass along a recommendation for this hotel anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: kittymama76
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from Priceline, which I would never recommend unless you know a city very well. Priceline tricks you by using creative descriptions for their star-ratings and their areas. For example, this hotel is in the Termini area, not in Centro Storico as stated on Priceline. Considering that I was frustrated at being forced into this hotel at an unfair price, I was pleased with the room. We were told we were staying in the "new" part of the hotel, which is a courtyard a few meters down from the main entrance. This area was very nice, quiet, and the room was luxurious with a jacuzzi tub and fluffy robes. I would not stay again, only because the location is not ideal (except for traveling to and from Termini.) One other tip... breakfast is not included... eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The Mecenate Palace - Fit for 6 queens!”
Reviews.Author: TammmieLand
Reviews.Content: Our party of 6 stayed at the Mecenate Palace, Via Carlo Alberto 3, September 11 – 18th, 2006. We arrived at our hotel jet lagged, hungry and traumatized by Roman driving. I thought how strange it was that I was going to get a passport, finally leave South Louisiana, only to die on a Roman highway strapped to the top of a smart car. We arrived at approximately 11:30 a.m. Two of our rooms were ready and the third would be ready shortly. Check in was efficient and without any problems. We were given rooms in the residence which is steps away from the Main Hotel and up two flights of stairs. This wasn’t a problem for our party although I don’t think there was a lift in that building. Actually, since there was a gelato shop betwixt the hotel and the residence, the stairs probably kept us from gaining weight. The rooms were spacious and beautifully decorated in a modern style. There was a wall unit with dresser drawers, and a closet with ample storage space. There was a safe in the room. Okay, for some reason we, my partner and I, couldn’t operate the safe. No one else in our party of six had this problem so it’s safe to assume that WE were the problem. However, every time, and I think we called 4 times, that we called to have the safe re-set, someone was sent, promptly and without any commentary (which probably was due). They were very professional and understanding. Of course we tipped them generously. Air Conditioning. Big perk for me. The rooms had climate control which you could adjust by 2 degrees either way. For anything greater, you simply had to call the front desk and they would make the adjustments.s The front desk, depending on who was working was either Great or great. The only difference is/was one personality whom we affectionally referred to as "The Emperor". Although the service was still stellar he was very different in his approach to guest services. His attitude was more "you are here for MY pleasure". Very amusing on hindsight. We had a King which was two twin beds pushed together. I knew this going in but somehow I thought they joined the beds so that you wouldn’t fall through the middle. At any rate, the beds aren’t joined so any “crossing of the zone” ended in a Lucy and Ricky sort of comedy routine. The Bathroom was tiled in a beautiful maroon tile. Spacious, toilet and Bidet (I sooo don’t get this), Huge Jacuzzi tub with two, count them, two shower heads. Heated towel racks, great products (luved the bath salts), and a hair dryer (which you had to hold down a button to keep on – a little strange but it worked). The scale in the bathroom weighs in stones and kgs. I think I’m a quarry! Every day the room was cleaned, the sheets changed (I didn’t think anybody did this every day) and any amenities replaced. Our housekeeper was a darling who did a fantastic job. Breakfast was served on the rooftop terrace of the Main hotel. The panoramic views were astonishing. The food was plentiful and good. Cheeses and meats and pastries, yogurts, cereals and the like. Fresh fruits, coffee, juices. Hot food was available for purchase off of the menu. The hotel is located about 3 blocks from the Termini and about 4 blocks down to the Vittorio metro stop. The neighborhood closer to the hotel is great. . However the closer you get to the Termini the more quirkier it got. One additional perk is that there is a supermarket right across the street and downstairs. Great for perusing and purchasing inexpensive pastas and wines and such. It was a great hotel -If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me. Thanks TammieLand

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nokia1792
Reviews.Content: The Mecenate Palace, what can we say, we were ripped off by Easyjet hotels Averaging about £160 per night for a Double room (2 people), we booked it in Jan 2006. It is centrally located and within easy walking/bus distance of all the well known tourist attractions. It is also a five minute walk from the termini station, making it ideal for airport transfers. The staff were friendly & polite and the rooms & corridors were clean, radio station three plays english speaking songs. Continental breakfast on the roof terrace was ok, mainly for the view of the piazza Maria Maggiore and the rest of the city on a good day. Rooms are small for the price you pay for them, and very dark even with shutters open, we had a great view of the back of the hotel, which was not the nicest i've seen before. TV only english speaking has CNN or Eurosport - which both of them did not interest me nor my wife Direction to hotal: - come out of station, Mc Donald's will be in front of you take your first road to your right of it "Via Gioberti" go down to the bottom of it and you come to a department store "Upim" at the corner go directly across the sqe but to the left you will see a new coffee shop with tables/chairs outside it that is the corner of the Hotel "Via Carlo Alberto" road, you will see flags half way down the front of the building walk acorss the crossing and between the tables/chairs of the coffee shop and next to this you will be at the hotel, if by chance like we did you come out of station and take the "Via Cavour" come to the bottom of this road until you reach the large Palace you will know it as it has aorund 100 steps leading up to this palace, take that road going upwards, therefore the Maggiore palace will be on your right side, go to the back of it and you will see the new coffee shop at the corner. Oh please stay away from the corner coffee shop at the hotel, it's very pricey.... 500ml bottle of coke €5.00 each and a medium ice cream cone was the same. for ligh snack food, ice creams, soft drinks go to the coffee shop across the road from the corner, just inside the department store "UIPM" all half the price and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: Hailes family
Reviews.Content: Our family (Mum, Dad and two teenage boys) had a five night stay at the Mecenate Palace at the end of August 2006. Overall we felt that the hotel had lived up to the reputation it has acquired from previous reviews on this website. We had a slightly rocky start to the visit - on arrival the reception said that a guest had broken a leg and so had to remain in the hotel beyond their booking, and they asked us to share a single room for two nights after which they could offer us the second room that we had booked. Genuine, or overbooking ? You decide. Typical British, we reluctantly agreed to accept using one room, but in fairness to the hotel they gave us a huge room in the Residence (50m along the street from the main hotel) which had been set up with a double and two single beds, and dropped the price for the two nights we shared. For the following three nights we had a second room also in the Residence. The rooms in the Residence are very well furnished - I guess they exceed the three star specification of the main hotel. Based upon website photos I'd say the furnishings are more modern in styling than the main hotel as well, but with bath robes, toiletries, haridryer, tea & coffee making facilities, TV with satellite channels, air conditioning and safe, there wasn't much missing. Breakfasts were as described elsewhere on this website - no shortages on quantity, hot food if you want to pay the extra. The rooftop venue was nice, the view of St Maria Maggiore impressive, the other rooftops less so. Reception & restaurant staff were all helpful and most spoke English well. One minor adverse comment - although there's a control for air conditioning in the bedroom, for some reason the hotel seems to have overidden it so that only reception can make changes. In our opinion the temperatures were much cooler than the displayed temperature (perhaps it was just the force of the air flow) but we had several attempts to get reception to adjust it and ended up asking for it to be turned off in one of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: SpinMamma
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at this excellent hotel. It was within walking distance of Rome Termini but in a much nicer area - literally overlooking the Piazza di Santa Maria Maggiore. It took about 25 minutes for our family of 4 to walk to the Colosseum and about the same to walk back from the Trevi Fountain. A metro station is located down the block and there are many bus lines that service the Termini train station nearby. We requested a quiet location and were given 2 rooms at the end of a hallway with a door that could close off the entrance to our 2 rooms. The rooms were adequate sized (medium by American standards, roomy by European standards). Bathrooms were well-equipped though not enough of a shower enclosure to keep the bathroom completely dry. The breakfast area is lovely and the breakfast offerings were very good -- meats, cheese, yogurt, cereal, pastries, and eggs available for a charge. On our first night, my husband and I had a drink at the rooftop bar over looking the lights of Rome - what could be better! We found the staff to be attentive and helpful. Requests for additional pillows or a spare room key when we locked ourselves out were taken care of immediately. The men at the desk were courteous and patient when answering questions. It was a four star hotel at a great price. We would recommend it to anyone planning a visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view”
Reviews.Author: Garinca
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 days in Mecenate Hotel. The hotel is very nice -located near Termini station. We booked this hotel since it has very good reviews on several websites. Room was very nice and clean (We booked standard Dbl,room), but the plumbing is old, so actually you have to wait several minutes for hot water. If you are single girls travellers I recommend hotels in Via Nazionale- also close to Termini but safer at night. Breakfast good- served on great roof terace. If you are smokers you can smoke on the terrace.Hotel stuff is average, did not seems to care a lot. If you are arriving by train this is a very good location-Termini is only 400 m from the hotel so you can walk-no need for a taxi.Use buses instead of Metro since it is very dirty and only has two lines. We used metro (red line) only to get to Vatican. To Borghese- take Bus 910 from Termini-get of in Via Pinciana-bus stop is only 50m from the enterance to Borghese. To the center (Trevi, P.di Spagna)-take bus no.71 from Santa M.Maggiore to P.San Silvestro.If you stay in Rome for more then 2 days - buy a ticket for several days- much cheeper and you do not have to look for Tobbaconist shops where you can buy it- since only several buses had the automat for tickets.Validate your tickets! Vatican and Borghese gallery tickets must be booked in advance!(www.galleriaborghese.it, www.vatican.va).On Vatican sire you can also book a guided tour so you wont need to wait on the enterance- costs 21 eur ticket included.Termini station is very confusing- so on your way to Fiumicino be prepared- be early. Have a nice time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: daveash
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel between Aug 22 - Aug 25th. The hotel was one of the best me or my girlfriend have stayed in and is 4* unlike trip advisor stating its a 3*, hence it was very clean and tidy. The receptionists were very happy to help with directions or to book a taxi. A buffet breakfast could be enjoyed on the roof terrace which provided good views of the surrounding area, and a rooftop bar which was very nice in the evenning. The hotel was well located to walk around the city to places like spanish steps, piazza navona or coliseum. However if you dont like walking then you may wish to get a taxi next to the church santa maria magiore which is right next to the hotel. Or take a tour of the city on the open top bus which also runs from next to the church and you can easily hop on and off of it. I would happily return to this hotel and recommend it to anyone travelling to rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel at a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MarkNYCity
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in early July and were very happy with our experience. We booked through an internet travel agency, and the Mecenate Palace appeared online to be a good value for a 4-star hotel. It was. The room was spotlessly clean, well maintained and well furnished, with an adequately sized bedroom and a beautiful, large, well appointed marble bathroom. The location was within a convenient walking distance from the Termini train station, and directly across the plaza from the ancient Santa Maria Maggiore church. It was within reasonable walking distance from the Forum and Colosseum. The buffet breakfast (much more than a routine continental breakfast) that was served on the very attractive rooftop patio was a real plus. The front desk staff was efficient, though not particularly friendly. Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt Recommend Enough - SUPER”
Reviews.Author: alanceltic
Reviews.Content: Where do you start when looking for a hotel in Rome with so much choice??? Save yourself a lot of time by booking here, I stayed here with 20+ family members for my wedding and after extensive research took a chance and booked this hotel and it exceeded all of our expectations. Firstly the hotel is very modern and comfortable which I found to be very difficult to find in Rome unless you pay crazy money.I stayed in a suite because we had 2 kids with us and it was very nice, we did have a look at the superior rooms and they were also very nice, well furnished and roomy enough.The location is pretty good, this was one of my main concerns when booking but I can say that it is as central to the sights as any other hotel the metro is on your doorstep although we used taxis everywhere (never paid more than 6-7 euro around the city). The staff we found to be very efficient, this is a wierd one because at the start I found them to be quite cold and unwelcoming (bordering rude) but I think this is just the Italian attitude, anytime we asked for anything they were very efficient, we even had the neck to ask for breakfast one day at 12.30 (it was a late night previously) because the kids were starving and the guy on reception opened the bar and phoned one of the staff to bring down something for us. Well the girl im sure wasnt too happy but she put on a smiley face and sorted us out with everything and was still pleasant, needless to say we were hughely impressed as we didnt expect them to do anything and only asked for cereal for the kids. We had our reception in another hotel and we regretted having left this super hotel as we were let down badly, we were even more disappointed when we seen the roof terrace because it would have been perfect. This hotel is great value for what you get, rooms are faultless - spacious modern and kept spotless. Breakfast is not the full english but where is in Rome, as continentals go its as good as any (roof terrace is a hugh bonus). Staff are extremely efficient, dont confuse the cold welcome as rude or ignorant thats just the way they are - efficient. Would highly recommend and will be back in Rome at some stage to enjoy this great hotel....its rating on tripadvisor in my opinion doesnt do justice to the hotel as I feel it should be in top 10-15.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded All Expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Quite often a vacation yields many surprises. It is always delightful when those are pleasant surprises! The rooms were well appointed, clean, and comfortable, even on a few warm Rome days in the high 80's and low 90's (F). The staff was wonderful, very accomodating and helpful, and assisted us in many ways throughout our stay. The daily breakfast was always tasty. We were also lucky to experience (unplanned) a surprise treat - a papal visit to Santa Maria Maggiore, a beautiful church located directly across the street. The hotel put on a wonderful event on the roof including drinks, hors douvres, and a delicious dinner. The location may not be perfect for walking sightseeing, but given the wide geographical locations of the many key sites of Roma, that's pretty much a non-issue, with convenient access to public transportation, taxis, or via a tour. There are a few wonderful trattorias and pizzerias nearby (and, of course a nice gelato spot!) We can happily recommend the hotel quite highly!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it. Couldn't have asked for more.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Mecenate Palace for three nights while on vacation with my mom in May after reading the reviews from this website. We loved this hotel. It is in a great location, and even though we arrived late at night, the staff was very accomodating checking us in, and helping us with our bags. The room was very nice, and even though our window faced out onto the street, the glass was so thick, we couldn't hear a thing outside. The bathrooms were spotless and modern and the air conditioning was great. It was such a relief to come back into a nice cool room after a long day of summer sightseeing. The jewel of this hotel is its upstairs terrace. We ate breakfast up there every morning and the staff will bring you your own pot of coffee or tea to your table when you ask. We just loved that!! The food was good and there was lots of options. We even ate up there in the outside section twice for dinner. The service was great, and the staff was so sweet and helpful. And you can't beat the view. On a nice summer night it is like a dream. The thing that really sold me on this hotel was the staff. I had an emergency and had to go to the hospital, and the man at the front desk was so helpful in getting us a taxi, and writing out everything I needed in both english and italian. Then when we got back, he helped us find a place to fill the perscription right away even though it was almost midnight. I was so thankful for all his help considering the circumstances. I would definately stay here again. As a 22 year old that has done a lot of travelling through europe, I was very pleased with my experience at the Mecenante Palace, and I know my mom was too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended our Italian honeymoon with a four night stay at the Mecenate Palace. We made reservations on-line, and we reconfirmed those reservations before leaving as recommended by others on Tripadvisor. When we arrived, the manager was snobbish, but perhaps this is the norm? Despite the frosty reception, we were led to a spacious room on the fifth floor with a fantastic view of Santa Maria Maggiore. The room was nicely decorated and the bathroom was very modern and elegant. We especially enjoyed the bathrobes and the radio system which was accessible in the bathroom and bedroom. The other employees were all very helpful, and breakfast was better than average. Our biggest gripe: the outdoor terrace. While the terrace bar was supposedly open until midnight, each night we went upstairs to find it dark and deserted. Accordingly, on our last night there, we went upstairs armed with a bottle of prosecco, but as fate would have it, the terrace bar was open and they would not allow us to enjoy the prosecco on the terrace. Understandable, but frustrating, nonetheless. All in all, it was a wonderful place to stay at a very affordable price. Finally, I join the previous reviewers warning regarding the cafe on the corner -- my husband and I were not savvy enough to ask for an itemized bill and believe that they overcharged us for a late night dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Stunning Views!”
Reviews.Author: dusk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mecenate Palace over the May Bank Holiday. The location (which I was worried about) was excellent you really can walk every where with no hassles. We stayed for 4 nights so we where upgraged to a deluxe room with a view of the Santa Maria Maggiore (if booked through hotel website) which was wonderful. The room was clean with nice dressing gowns and kettle – very useful – though the fridge wasn't very cold. The room was OK but I expected more from a four star hotel and for the price we paid 770 euros. Breakfast was also only OK standard buffet, but no hot food, although you could purchase eggs etc at extra cost it's saving grace was the lovely roof terrace where it is served. The staff where excellent with good english! We really enjoyed our stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service...Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nashua27
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from staying at the Golden Tulip Mecenate Palace. We rented 20 rooms for my wedding. Hopefully this review will give you a broader perspective than most. A brief history: I have treveled extensively around the world (over 40 countries) and understand the differences in services and hotel stays can vary greatly from country to country. This was my 6th trip to Italy and love the country. The hotel itself is beautiful and in an excellent spot. The roof deck at night is perfect. The problem is the staff. Some are unsupervised thieves and the service in general was horrible. Actions that would certainly get you fired/arrested in a US hotel is washed over as if nothing happened in this hotel. CONS 3 of the reservation were screwed up, 2 were ultimately resolved 1 couple had to go find other arraignements. -2 Bags were STOLEN FROM LOCKED ROOMS, one was recovered from the hotel desk, the other never found. No reason was given. They made no attempt to help. Treated us as if we were a problem even asking about it. The assistant manager said to me "I was robbed in NYC I don't complain to you about it" -Several reports of staff entering the room at odd hours with no apparent purpose. -7 of the rooms AC's didn't work, never fixed nor resolved -5 of the TV's didn't work, never fixed nor resoived -Elevator down for a day, which was a significant problem since my 70 year old mother ,who recently had a knee replaced, was staying in a 'handicapped accessible' room on the 4th floor. Again only gave us attitude when asked when it would be up and running. I was told to take the stairs. -Odered 50 person bus for day of wedding, a 20 person bus showed up, we had to call 7 taxi's to take remainder of guests to the wedding. No refund. -3 toilets broke, 2 never fixed, were given buckets to flush. -The rooms were generally extremely small but manageable. -The same roof deck bar tab was charged to 4 different rooms -My brothers credit card, which he only used at this hotel, was used to purchase stereo equipment in Italy. Not his purchases. PROS -Great location, good restaurants and easy walk to sites. -Great roof deck/breakfast area. Perfect for large groups -Rooms were nicely decorated, marble baths In conclusion, the hotel is beauiful and in a great spot hopefully you won't be one of the unlucky one's who gets ripped off. Good luck,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: new-winger
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our stay in Rome a memorable one it was better than we expected. Our room was in the residence very modern and clean the bathroom was lovely Jacussi and all the goodies bathrobes etc. Location is ideal for all the historic sites all walking distance the furthest being the Vatican we took the metro on way and walked back taking in an array of sites. One warning however! the resaurant nothing to do with but adjoining the hotel on the corner to the right of the hotel entrance will rip you off if you let them dont trust the little old men waiters get an itemised bil l!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel cancelled our booking”
Reviews.Author: colandjan
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel from what we saw of our one night - but had to move for the following 3 nights because the hotel had cancelled our booking. We had got a good deal through Opodo, paid a deposit some months earlier and had a confirmed booking but when we arrived, because my credit card had changed in the meantime, they had cancelled the booking without trying to contact us. They had room for the first night only and we had to move to an inferior hotel for the same price the next day. I suspect they could let the room at a higher rate. At check out after the first night they wouldn't allow the deposit I had paid and confirmed directly with them. I refused to sign the credit card slip but they debited it anyway and I had a wrangle with the booking agent and credit card company to get my deposit back.

Reviews.Title: “Our Palace in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Mecenate is centrally located in a pleasant neighborhood near Roma Termini. The hotel itself is attractive and well-run. The breakfast buffet, both food and ambience, very enjoyable. We would certainly stay there again. B& P - New York City

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but major scheduling problems”
Reviews.Author: rgamfin
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that I acknowledge that people make mistakes.. but scheduling shouldn't be that difficult. My wife and I booked our room online (at the Golden Tulip website) about 3 months in advance. We double checked 2 weeks before our trip to make sure our room was still held and everything was fine. So, 2 days before our trip, we get an email "URGENT" that explained they had made a scheduling error and our room was not available for the first night. We tried to be understanding of this mistake but the hotel they booked us in was VERY south of Rome and almost impossible to get to. To make a long story short, our first night is Rome was very difficult because of this scheduling issue and temporary hotel location. The temporary hotel they had us stay in even showed us that they had scheduled us for the wrong day (ANOTHER ERROR on their part). Luckily they had a room for us regardless of this mistake. After this awful experience in the south of Rome, we finally got the Mecenate Palace and the service was very good. He upgraded our room to a deluxe and we had a wonderful view. They also sent us complimentary fruits to apologize for their mistake. So, if these scheduling issues had not occured I could honestly give this hotel the highest marks. Everything was very nice.. the food.. the service.. the room.. the location. We wished we were able to stay here the first night of our stay because it would have made all the difference!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: jennifrp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at the Mecenate Palance recently and a wonderful time. The hotel is about a 5-10 min. walk from Termini Station so it very convenient. From Termini you have access to the Metro which will get you almost anywhere you want to go in Rome. The Santa Maria Maggiore is right near the hotel and is beauitful, I highly recommend going inside, its quite a jewel. The hotel staff was always friendly and check in was no problem. They all speak fluent English at the front desk. Our room was very nice, a good size. They two twin beds are pushed together to make a king-- some people complain about this but its fairly common in Europe. The bathroom had a nice big bathtub which was much needed after hours of walking around Rome. We had drinks and dinner in the small bar area one night. They food was good and the waiter was very friendly in trying to communicate in English. Breakfast was great, they had lots to choose from and the views from the top of the hotel are amazing. We'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kazbo17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights in Rome and chose the Mecenate Palace based on your reviews. It was excellent choice for location, comfort and service. The staff were keen to know that we were being taken care of. We upgraded room to a deluxe room overlooking Santa Maria Maggiore and the square - what a fantastic view. Rooms were extremely comfortable and luxuriously decorated with lovely marble bathrooms and robes/slippers (dont know if that is in all rooms). Very efficient double glazing - Rome is a very noisy city. Tea/coffee in the rooms which was most welcome. On arriving a Ciampino we got bus shuttle to Terminii then a 5-10 min easy walk. Terminii area a bit seedy but quite fascinating too. Hotel very close to Metro which we only used to travel to Vatican - we walked to everything else. My top tips are VERY comfy shoes, a good map and guide book as nothing is signposted - nor is anything labelled in any church/gallery/museum. Breakfast terrace lovely inside and out - breakfast more than ample - good choice - croissant/bread/cheese/ham/cereal/fruit/yoghurt. Happy hour every night 6-7!!!

Reviews.Title: “A fab stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel using recommendations from trip advisor. We were looking for a hotel central to the historic centre and able to look after a party of 14 including one friend in a wheelchair. The hotel were very helpful throughout the stay. The rooms are clean and ideal for a short stay. The breakfast room has great views of the city. The reception desk were able to advice and book restaurants for us each night which was very helpful with such a large group. We were in Rome to celebrate my father's 70th birthday and we all agreed it would be great to return and even stay at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week with my partner and we had a lovely time. The location is very good, being near Termini station it was easy to walk to on arrival. We managed to get to everywhere on foot easily enough (the Vatican was furthest at about 45 min, the collosseum/forum about 15 min). The room (in the main building) was not massive but plenty large enough. The bathroom is lovely - all marble and with a very good bath/shower. There is a safe in each room, which is very useful. All sheets and towels were replaced daily, and the room cleaned daily. The only real downside was that the room could get a bit stuffy if you didn't open the window. Nevertheless it was on the whole a fantastic place to stay. Two things impressed me particularly. The breakfast was in a lovely location and the food is delicious. Also the service was excellent when we needed it most - I unfortunately got quite ill when I was there and needed to see a doctor. They arranged a doctor to come round very quickly and even accompanied my partner to a pharmacy to pick up my prescription (and do all the talking, as our Italian wasn't great). Their service at that time was a great comfort to us both. Finally, I should mention that the food at the bar was very nice, although the range on the menu was a bit restrictive. However the bar staff, like all the other staff in the hotel, were very friendly. For service, location and price I couldn't have been more satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: mctraveller66
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel! we were greeted politely and checked in efficiently. A porter showed us to our room and explained everything to us. The rooms were spotless, very well appointed, with all of the extras you expect in a 4* hotel. The bathrooms had marble walls, full sixe bathtub, over-bath shower and lots of nice quality towels. The bedding and towels were changed every day. The rooms were a little on the small side, but as we were out from about 10am until 10pm - this hardly mattered! the bed was very comfortable. Our room was on 5th floor overloking the internal courtyard - and it was extremely quiet. Each room had indiviually controllable heating/aircon which was noisless but efficient. We made use of the safe in the room, and there is also a minibar 'fridge and kettle. Breakfast is taken on the roof terrace - and once again the staff were always smiling and very obliging. The food was the regular contitnental european fayre but plentiful and very well presented. The Colloseum/Forum is about 20 mins walk away, and there is an underground station about 4 mins walk away. We had a highly memorable trip to Rome, and this was due in no small part to the excellent standard of this hotel. BOOK IT NOW! you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claire099
Reviews.Content: this hotel was in a brilliant location - walking distance to all the top attractions, and was clean and friendly. Breakfast on roof terrace was brilliant and although the rooms werent the most spacious they were adequate for a weekend trip. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in January for 2 nights and overall we was very happy with our stay, the only downside was that on arrival they had cancelled our reservation booking and we was not informed of this before arriving. The reason for the cancellation was because a month before we travelled we lost our credit card and had to have another issued, so the card number we had given when booking became invalid, when they tried to authorize it, it wouldnt allow them to do so but instead of contacting us they cancelled our booking. Fortunatly the hotel wasnt fully booked and they gave us a nice room over looking the square. Although the rooms are quite small they are very clean and well equipped the bathroom is quite spacious. Breakfast is taken on the roof terrace and is the usual contintial breakfast you recieve in hotels. There is a lovely little cafe next door to the hotel that does fantastic cakes and coffee and down the road we found a brilliant downstairs restraunt that did excellent food. After walking around the area we was very pleased with the location as it was at the bottom of a busy road but the hotel seemed peaceful. The termini station keeps you on your toes as this was the area that you felt your belongings was being watched although if we felt we had a dodgy character following us we just stopped looked at them and let them pass. Overall if you want a good 4* hotel then i would recommend this hotel. The only other advice i would give is to see all the sights then go on a tour bus from the termini station and use the red 110 tour bus this is your best and cheapest way of doing it although there are people trying to get you to go on others and will try and talk you out of going on the red ones. DO NOT go with them unless you like being ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, efficient and friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: glockett
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying at this hotel. Lovely room: artistic decor and well equipped. High standard of cleanliness. Staff all very efficient and friendly. Bar staff amusing and very welcoming. Great value drinks during happy hour(s). Excellent continental breakfast. Light snacks availiable during evening. Walked everywhere from hotel. Vatican 45mins, everywhere else within easy walking distance. Very good restaurants also within easy walking distance. Definitely recommend this hotel; great value and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Take your chances”
Reviews.Author: timmypuscat
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via their website and they seems to be very good in answering any question that we had. There was six of us all girls and we requsted two triple rooms The negative side:- 1) They asked us if we wanted a Taxi to pick us up which we said yes. When we arrived there was no taxi we rang them up and asked where it was they said that we will have to wait 20 minutes. We ended up arranging our own and it worked out alot cheaper. 2) we arrived at the hotel, the doorman did not help us with our bags, we noticed that he was quite selective on who he did and did not help. 3) The first guy behind the reception desk was not only rude to us but not at all helpful instead he said that the rooms were not booked, after a few motion he said that there was room in teh annex we had specifiaclly said that we wanted the rooms in the hotel, but we had got to a stage where we just want to sleep. Again he was very much selective on who he was nice to and not nice to. 4) Appartly they had emailed to say that they had problems with our rooms ( we had booked this two months in advance) but this was we found out was 2o'clock in the morning on the day that we were leaving,so not only was it out of office hours but we wouldnt have thought of checking the email at that late notice. 4) they gave us one triple room and the other room was a double with a five year old bed in it....we are all 28 so a five year old bed was not sufficient! 5) 7 o'clock on a friday morning we were awoken by banging and drilling that was happending directly above our room ...to say the least we were not impressed. by this time a letter was written to the manager. plus points of the hotel 1) After we wrote a letter of complaint the matter was dealt with and the manager arrange for one room to be in the hotel away from the noice. It wa just annoying that we had to write something in order for the matter to be dealt with 2) We didnt see teh first guy that was behind the reception again has he was off duty so we delt with another guy we was very helpful. 3) Being in both room i would say if possible go for the annex there is nothin wrong with the actuall hotel rooms but teh annex is much more mordern and the shower alot better. and it is literally a minute walk from the hotel. But personally i woud not come back to this hotel, I dont beleive that It should rely on luck on how you will be treated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel on travelocity for 110€ a night. It is worth every penny! within an hour of booking the hotel, the front desk emailed me confirming my reservation, and assured me that the bill had been taken care of (by travelocity) and asked if we wanted to have their driver pick us up at the airport (50€ . . .standard for airport shuttles all over the city. you could take the transit system for about 15€, but after a 12 hr flight etc . . its worth it to get to your hotel, and not have to naviagte a foreign transport system with all our bags). Even though our plane was 1 hr late, the driver was waiting at baggage claim to pick us up with sign and all. The hotel itself is very clean, very neat and the staff is VERY friendly; it seems that they want you have a good time while at their hotel. Internet in the hotel is 3€ for 30 min (reasonable for the city) The complementary breakfast is great and served almost all morning with an extremely helpful and enthusiastic staff. The hotel no more than 15-20 min. walking distance of just about everything for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JOLLYBOYS
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome with my wife from 14th to 18th Jan 06. and stayed at the Mecenate Palace Hotel. We were greated by friendly staff most of whom could speak English well. The bedroom which over looked the Santa Maria Maggiore Church was very clean with a large double bed. The bathroom was also spacious and contained dressing gowns. The bedding was changed on a daily basis. The breakfast was limited for choice and could be described as adequate. However the location made up for this as we were approx. 400 metres from the main railway and bus station. Most of the main tourist attractions were within walking distance although buses stopped outside the hotel. I would certainly recommend the hotel for anyone wanting good value for money at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: viaggiando
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia for 110 € a night and a found it to be extremely good value for Rome. Hotels in Rome are normally very expensive, and for the same price you may easily find lousy places. Mecenate Palace instead has all the comforts of a luxury hotel (marble bathroom equipped with radio and telephone, amenities, coffee/tea maker, free newspapers, etc), it is richly decorated, and breakfast is served on a beautiful rooftop terrace. It is not located in the most romantic area of the town, but it is very practical if you need to take the train, it is very well served by public transport, and you may actually walk to most monuments.

Reviews.Title: “Last night in Rome -not a good hotel ending”
Reviews.Author: funmar
Reviews.Content: This was our last night of a ten day stay in Italy and this hotel was not a pleasant experince. We were lead to an annexed building down the street which had a stair case with a unlocked open double door a the bottom (no elevator)and two security doors at the top. One door was for the residences and the other one for the few hotel rooms. There was a desk behind the security door but no one sits there until after 11:00 p.m. and until 6:00 a.m. On at least one occasion, the people in front of me let me in without using my pass. Anyway, when I asked for a room in the other building and about security, the clerks made fun of me saying it was a good neighborhood and was i lonely,and so on. Like i was a crazy lady with two kids. (I am not)As to the room itself, it faced a court yard and in the center was a cleaning unit. On a positive note, the flowers were nice in November and it was quiet. However, it was a crowded triple and although the bathroom was nice with a whirlpool tub, it was the first time in Italy I saw a bug in the bathroom. Walking to breakfast -outside and in the rain was not great. Breakfast was ok, but the table cloth was dirty and filled with crumbs. I am not really fussy, but this is not a good place to stay and so avoid it, there are much better palces in Rome to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mecenate Palace from 11-23 thru 11-28-05. I booked this hotel on Priceline at about $125 per evening (USA) and I chose this area for 2 main reasons: The close proximity to Termini and the Metro Line (Vittorio Emmanuel Stop). We flew to Rome and took the train to Termini, we then walked to the hotel (about 10 minutes). The Metro stop is about 2 and one-half city blocks, there are also a lot of city buses available. We spent 6 days in Rome and never had to use a taxi. The area is good around the hotel and there is a full grocery store with an excellent wine dept. within 2 blocks. The hotel breakfast is fine and the service is first class. This hotel even had a happy hour from 6:30 to 8:00 pm each evening with half priced drinks. Then out to the area for excellent meals. All price ranges were available. Be sure to eat at Monti's down the street (you must make reservations, about $85 for 2)- behind the hotel in alley is Marconi's (a beer hall with very good - reasonably priced food). Room a little small - very clean - huge marble bathroom. The staff was helpful and speaking English was not a problem. Watch for the pickpockets on the metro, even at this time of year. I would stay here again and even a street view room was quiet. The hotel has a view of the Basilica of SANTA MARIA Maggiore where we attended mass on Sunday - In Latin with a wonderful male choir.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, recommended.”
Reviews.Author: shadyoldlady
Reviews.Content: My wife can usually fault most hotels but the mercenate was superb. Great room on 5th floor, good service, fab breakfast & views of the santa maria maggiore basilica. small bar was cosy and offering a well timed happy hour half price drinks. reasonably priced, decent locale (much maligned), excellent restaurants around, and very close to termini & walked to colloseum, spanish steps without much pain - less than 30 mins to each - although a bit up and down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Close to main railway station and well located for site seeing. Highly recommend this hotel, the rooms although not large are clean and comfortable. The breakfast on the roof top is a real treat and great way to start your day. The staff were friendly and helpful, all you would expect from a city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “At the Mecenate Palace the customer is always wrong.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This 4-star hotel ended a wonderful trip to Italy on a sour note. We had booked 4 nights, beginning Nov. 25 through the 29th--3 of them through Hotels.com and the other a direct reservation. Due to an Italian Railway strike on the 25th, and an illness of my traveling companion, we decided to stay in Florence an extra night. When I called the Mecanate Palace at 11:00 a.m. to explain that we would not be arriving until the 26th, I was informed any cancellation had to be given 20 hours in advance (hotel policy); and thus I would have to pay for the night of the 25th. I agreed and confirmed our arrival on the 26th for a stay through the 29th. Yet when we arrived at the hotel at 3p.m. the next day (check-in time) we were informed that there wasn't a room for us with twin beds, because it was Hotels.com policy to cancel the reservation if we didn't arrive. So we had to (1) pay for a night we were not there, and (2) stay in a substandard room. The next night they moved us to a room with twin beds, but the bathroom leaked, and they didn't even separate the twin beds--we had to rearrange the furniture ourselves. Throughout our stay the hotel desk staff was surly, uncooperative and unctious. We were not so much as offered an apology. I was told they had to have a credit card number to hold the reservation--but they DID have my credit card number for the night of the 28th! And they did not ask for a credit card number when I called to inform them we would be arriving a day later. They claimed they upgraded our rooms when they moved us--well, I'd like to see what a so called "standard" room looks like. And when I left, they refused to give me a receipt for the stay! Whatever we said--in our best and most civil voices--we were made to be in the wrong. I just wanted the nice room I was paying for from the beginning. So unless you wield political and financial power or are energized by arguments with desk clerks and assistant managers, do NOT stay at this hotel. It's 4 star only in the sense that the desk staff act like army generals!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: markjoe
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice property with excellent service, a very good breakfast, many room amenities - such as tea making, large bathroom, nicely decorated, etc. However, I had requested a room in the back on the quiet side when I made reservations 5-6 months before arriving and even though there are many rooms I was given one on the noisy street.

Reviews.Title: “Rome in November”
Reviews.Author: CORK2007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and comfortable. The rooms are on the small side but they are adequate. The breakfast is only ok as he range of foods on offer is limited. The hotel is 15 mins from the Forum and Colesseum but is a long walk from the Spanish Steps/Trevi. You can get the metro to these if you want as the Termini station is only 5 mins walk from Hotel. The area around the hotel is fine as its well lit and there always plenty of peopel around. Overall the hotel is good but if you could find a hotel closer to the centre for similar money then with hindsight I would go with the latter.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pilgrim51
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Rome and having used Tripadvisor to pick our hotel we were not disappointed. Its probably on the limit from the main attactions but it only took about 20 minutes to walk to the Forum and Colosseum area and it was fine to walk back as well. Although the area is a little bit rough we had no problems and to be honest it was no worse that some of the more up market areas - the begging was far worse nearer to St Peters. Our room ( for three) was not huge but plenty big enough and very comfortable, breakfast was fine with great views from the roof terrace. The room was always very clean and had plenty of fluffy white towels and of course the slippers! I would avoid the coach trips pushed by the hotel - we went on one and it was pretty hopeless although we had to admire the guide's ability to swap between 5 languages. The tour was supposed to be in English and the guide was obviously very knowledgeable but having 5 different languages to deal with meant that he did not give us much information. We opted out after a while. The staff at reception spoke excellent English and were always helpful. We prebooked our taxi from and to the airport- I have no idea how the price compares with one booked by the hotel- but it was an excellent service and I recommend them - check out ----. The hotel is very near the train station so no problem if you wanted to use public transport. We used the metro and bus to get to St Peters and the Spanish steps. Very cheap but very crowded. For both St Peters and Spanish steps you need to walk to Republica. There are plenty of places nearby to eat in the evening. Its well worth looking in Santa Maria Maggiore.

Reviews.Title: “Superb choice, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: JamesC
Reviews.Content: Hello, Just stayed at this hotel for three days in October. We were upgraded to a superior room looking out at the Santa Maria church - lucky for us. This had advantage of balcony - not that we used it other than for a photo opportunity. Room was excellent - a bit heavy on the chintz bedspread! But really high quality furnishings. Bed was a bit hard, but overall, I have no complaints about the hotel. TV in room with mainly foreign channels - BBC world & odd English programme on foreign MTV channel. If you sad like me & like TV, it is worth considering taking a portable DVD player for those moments when you are not eating / sight seeing. Lovely breakfast on roof terrace - fantastic viewing area. Weather was lovely! About 75 to 80 degrees farenheit at hottest point. But cooler at night - long sleeves weather. Not sure if this is representative though. We took an umbrella each, but did not need it. I do understand what people meant by the area now - the termini area is a bit rough. But the hotel is well out of this. It is very convenient if you are getting dropped off by Terravision. Do not worry about the location it is ideal for sights & seemed safe enough, except for the lunatics on mopeds - they do not know what a stop sign means. You take your life in your hands everytime you cross the road in Rome! The hotel is near a tube if you are feeling lazy. We caught the tube to the Vatican as it seemed a bit far & with all the walking you do when you get there. I would recomment very comfortable shoes!! I cannot emphasis this highly enough. The Santa Maria church is lovely & right infront of the hotel. Good choice of restaurants in nearby vicinity - mainly pizza & pasta (but then you are in Italy!). Sights of Rome were awesome. Loved them all. We were told to get to the Vatican museum early, which we did (9am) & queue was still heaving. I have never seen a queue like it (around 1/2 mile & five+ people deep) - no joke. So we went into St. Peters for 1 hour or so & after this, the queue to Vatican museum had vanished! Beware people offering to get you in with no queue for 40 or so euros, as the queue disappears later (it is only 12 euros to get in). Personally I found the colleseum disappointing inside & expensive considering (10 euros each), but I heard other people loved it & said it was the highlight - so maybe you should ignore me. Have a look in a guidebook at a picture of what is inside - if this appeals to you go in, if not save your money - I thought it was much more impressive on the outside. We had no incidents of theft during our visit, but personal security is of upmost importance in Rome, as I have heard loads of bad reports about this sort of thing. In summary, great hotel - it deserves to be in trip advisor top twenty hotels in Rome & I think is an ideal choice for a stay. Hotel is a four star & I would not argue with this. Superb location & fantastic sight seeing. Hope this helps. Ps. Incidentally we were looking for a supermarket & had trouble finding one - they don't seem very common in Rome for some unknown reason - perhaps we were oblivious to them! Anyway, there is one on the opposite side of the road next to the department store (down some stairs) - obvious really.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, a must for any visit to the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I married in Italy in 2004 and following our stay in Sorrento and prior to our trip to Florence, the second leg of our honeymoon was spent in the Eternal City. Paramount to the enjoyment of our honeymoon was good quality accomodation and the Mecenate Palace did not disappoint. We found the excellent staff to be pleasant and attentive and our superior suite ,which boasted breath taking views of the Santa Maria Maggiore was beautiful and spotless. The roof terrace was a tremendous setting for breakfast and offered a delightful array of breakfast dishes and an excellent view, again of the aforementioned bassilica. The hotel bar which had superb chianti was relaxing and the actual location of the hotel was convenient to many of the essentials I.e. The Roma termini, the pick up point for the open top bus tour and many of the 'tourist traps' I.e. Collesseum, which in turn lead to the Piazza Venezia, Fontana di Trevi, Pantheon et al. We enjoyed our hotel and Rome so much that we have since been back only returning from our weekend break on 23/10/04.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - will go back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. I was a bit concerned when on arrival we were led back out into the street into another building a couple of doors down, especially in view of what one reviewer had written about this. Needn't have worried and I guess it all comes down to personal taste. It led to a quiet courtyard. The room itself had modern furnishings but in my view very tasteful and the room was a very good size, clean AND the air conditioning worked! It was also quiet. As others have commented, the breakfasts were fine rather than luxury and with great views from the terrace area. Given the excellent, service, room and location (especially for the station) we will certainly put this hotel at the top of our list for a return visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - 15/20 mins walk to everything...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Romantic 5 day trip to Rome - very nice hotel. Would say rooms more compact than small but fitted us perfectly. Clean, friendly with an amazing roof top view for light snack/coffee in the evening times to rest those feet. Tourist bus starts from less than 1min around the corner. Only reservation is that this hotel is on the Esqueline Hill, and yes, you have to walk up that hill to reach your hotel at the end of an evening. However all this requires only 15 mins walk give or take your pace. Still a nice stroll home @ night. You are not in the 'centre' of Rome per se, so you do have to make journey to get to anything. Make sure you give a day to visit the Roman Forum - it's amazing with a monstrous amount of history attached - don't rush it!! A guide is helpful however and there are a few mentioned on this site which is where we got ours. The group we used were very helpful and would use again. That said, we walked most of the time, which was fantastic. If you want something romantic - eat at any of the Restaurants at the Pantheon! Wow! Also buy the Tourist bus ticket - it lasts 24 hours and you can use that to get to the most useful spots each day if necessary! Would definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, helpful staff, small but comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: mecpizza
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with very helpful staff. My aunt need an inhaler for her asthma (the one she brought with her broke) and they helped her locate a place where she could get one. The rooms were very comfortable, not a whole lot of space but nice bathroom. The location was decent but it was further from alot of the main attractions than I would have liked. I would definitely recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: brownspot100
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights and had a wonderful time. THe staff was helpful and nice. We had them send a car for us at the airport and even tho' we arrived before check in time, they had our rooms ready for us. The rooms were small, but lovely! The beds were more comforable than ours at home! THere is an electric teapot for water and coffee and a small fridge with those little bottles, but room for our stuff too. The room had quiet AC and was soundproofed so our parent's room on the street side was noiseless. The rooftop breakfast was ample with a variety to choose from and the wait staff was very friendly and seemed happy to see us each additonal morning we were there. We had dinner there one night and the food was adequate. THe neighborhood is not trendy, but I felt as safe as can be expected. There is a supermarket right across the street on the corner near the church, that is 2 story and has lots of great cheeses and whatever. The neighborhood restaurants were just OK, we did not do enough investigating about where to eat. Free newspapers in a variety of languages, lnternet connection is pricey, but available. The desk will book tours for you-- we did the Greenline night tour and it was nice. Taxi stand is to the left of the church, metro and train station are an easy walk. We highly recommend this hotel to you.

Reviews.Title: “A Wondeful Place to Stay in an Awesome City!”
Reviews.Author: stratasphere
Reviews.Content: Both Golden Tulip hotels in Rome are really great but I especially like this one two doors down from Santa Maria Maggiore's front piazza. It is walking distance from the train station and very comfortable, friendly and helpful. Piero, one of the front desk staff members, is exceptional. During both two-day stays there this past few weeks, we found him to be consistently courteous and very attentive. The housekeeping staff was equally professional. There is a roof-top breakfast room which becomes a bar area at 5:00 p.m. each evening. It is now the only place I'll stay in Rome! TramTram Trattoria in the SanLorenzo section of the city is a terrific restaurant with a wonderful owner who waits on tables and carefully inspects each plate to insure that you are totally pleased with what you have ordered. The value for the money is well worth the trip to that area of the city, outside the walls. Paris restaurant in Trastevere was also quite a find but not as inexpensive as TramTram.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, close to both Termini & centre”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the mercenate for 3 nights in August & can thoroughly recommend it to anyone. The rooms were very clean & despite the size there was plenty of storage for all our clothes/shoes etc. The consierge was most friendly & polite & the bar area's (downstairs & roof terrace) were a handy retreat. I thought this hotel had a definate touch of class, aswell as being in a good location. I was slightly concerned about the breakfast after reading some of the reviews but I thought it was great (fresh fruit, bread, cheese, ham, fruit juice, cereal etc) Overall I would definately recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: August 2005 - I can recommend the Mecenate Palace for your stay in Rome. We had a triple room that consisted of a queen size bed and a comfortable fold out bed. The room size was above average for European hotels and there was a window out to a very pleasant, private patio garden. The bathroom was quite large with a tile floor and a nice shower / bath / jacuzi tub. Everything was very clean and the hotel service at the desk, with the maid who cleaned the room daily, and with the hotel staff was excellent and always provided with a smile. There's a nice roof top restaurant, overlooking one of Rome's many Bascilicas, where we had an included breakfast every morning. The hotel is convenient to the train & bus terminal for getting to places easily, but far enough removed for a quiet and safe stay. The area around this hotel has many nice shops and small restaurants and it's in a friendly and safe part of the city. Reminded me of Boston's North End.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real find, the room was very tastetful, comfortable and cool. The view from the breakfast room was amazing, the Piazza Santa Maria Magore and the Colosseum were just a few of the highlights you could pick out. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms and common areas were spotless. The cafe next to the hotel was great, we eat there twice, and it has a huge selection of pastries, cakes and gelato. If you are on a budget, there is the SMA supermarket across the road, so you could pick up snacks from there.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my mammy at the start of the month and it was brilliant. Room was lovely, and we were upgraded to a deluxe room overlooking St Maria Maggiore. Area is a bit rough but well-located to catch the green line bus from outside Termini (much better than the open-top buses because it's air-conditioned) Two minute walk from the Terravision bus stop. Two excellent restaurants nearby, the Trattatorria Monti down the Via Carlos Alberto and one next door to the hotel. Roof-top garden is excellent and a short walk to the Collisseum. Receptionist looks like Jay Leno.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Value, Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: fogman444
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our last night in Rome to be close to Termini Station. For that purpose the hotel is in a great location, we were able to walk with our bags to the station in less than 5 minutes. However, if your going to be doing a lot of sightseeing, you may want to stay somewhere closer to the Piazza Nuova area, or buy a multiday subway pass from the closeby Metro Station and ride the subway everywhere. For the price, however, the Golden Tulip's not bad. We were pleasently surprised when we checked-in and were upgraded (free of charge) to a Superior Suite on the top floor. The Suite was VERY large, especially by European standards, and we made ample use of the complimentary tea/coffee making facilities provided in the livingroom. Unlike most hotels, the prices on minibar and "tv snack" items were accually reasonable. The bathroom was equipped with a Jacuzzi/Shower, Toilet and bidet, with double sinks. Our two twin beds were comfortable (if firm) and positioned to view the second television in the bedroom. We did not stay at the hotel long enough to need much staff assistance, but the frontdesk staff and bellman were friendly. We did not get a chance to try the hotel's restaurant but it looked reasonably priced. Also, the terrace on the top floor provides a nice view of the nearby Piazza Santa Maria. Overall we were pleased with our short stay at the Golden Tulip and would highly recommend the hotel to those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent five nights in Rome last week at the Mecenate Palace Hotel. We'd found the hotel through this site and were a little anxious as reviews we'd seen in recent weeks had been a little luke warm. We needn't have worried. From the moment we saw the classy exterior of the MP and walked into its wonderfully cool marbled lobby, we were sure we'd made the right decision. The staff were real professionals who spoke excellent English and who warmed to us when we tried our best to ask for our room key in broken Italian - and they remembered us with a warm smile every time we returned. The room wasn't huge but it was very cool - we didn't once need to put on the air conditioning despite 80+ heat outside. We were on the second floor in the front of the building (with a view to the side of Santa Maria Maggiore). It had a mini bar (where we stored cans of our own coke) and it had tea and coffee making facilities (but no milk - although if we'd have thought of it we could have bought some of our own and stored it in the mini bar). The bathroom was elegant marble with free soap, shampoo, bath foam, a comb, shoe cleaner, shower cap and tissues. There is a wall hairdryer. The shower was nice and fierce. The terrace was open for breakfast when we went and it was a joy to eat there. It's all in the shade so you don't bake in the early morning sun. The food was good - fresh pastries and rolls, yoghurt, apples, fruit juice, ham, cheese - oh, and my partner was especially pleased to find coco pops! The location is fine. A Metro just down the road (although after our first horrendously crowded trip we avoided it like the plague and stuck to buses or foot power) and a five minute walk from Termini train station. It's a bit daunting at first to see so much graffiti and rubbish everywhere but actually this is not just something you find in this area - it's all over Rome. A pity. But we never once felt threatened or intimidated here and never had any trouble with pickpockets. Across the road and to the left is a supermarket (Supermercado) - it doesn't look like one - you have to go downstairs to shop. We didn't find this till later in the trip, instead walking to a Chinese store down the road to buy snacks and cans of drink. Our total holiday cost was 359 pounds which included a return flight from Birmingham which cost about 100 pounds making each night of our five night stay about 50 quid a night! An unbelievable bargain for a four star hotel. I have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this hotel and am very grateful to all the excellent reviews from others in the past that led us to choose this hotel. Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “You can do much better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a mistake it was to choose this hotel and to stay in the Termini area. Prior to our stay here we travelled all over Italy and stayed in four hotels that we loved. So we knew how nice the Italian people are and how were the other hotels and that there was no excuse for how the staff at the Golden Tulip Mecenate Palace Hotel treated us. When my wife, eleven year old daugther and I arrived to the hotel no one would help us with our luggage, there were revolving doors that we could not use with our luggage, and the regular door was locked. After several unsuccesful attempts of trying to open the locked door (while the staff looked through the glass windows motionless) someone finally came and unlocked the door without saying a word in a completely rude manner. After we checked in, the bellboy took our luggage and walked out the door into the street ??? and asked us to follow him. He walked down the sidewalk and finally stoped about three doors down in front of this unappealing, old and plain looking residential building. Went up the steep stairs, (about twenty of them) no elevator of course, and opened a door. There was a guard sitting next to it and there was a hallway with many other doors. The bellboy then opened the first door on the right (next to the guard ) and directed us to the room. I could not belive it, what in the world was this?, I mean the room was decent and clean, but this was not the hotel!!! This was a room in some other building with no lobby, no restaurant, no facilities other than my room! This was definitely not what I have booked. I went back to the reception (in the real Mecenate Palace Hotel) and asked to be moved and the receptionist told me that they were fully booked and that there was nothing he could do. Then he actually tried to convice me that my room was the hotel, that it was the same thing as staying in the hotel building. This person showed no concern or respect whatsoever and it seemed as if he was used to listening this kind of complaints and he just didn't care. I don't know what they call that in the Mecenate Palace Hotel, but in this country we call it lying to the public, false representation, and it is heavily fined. We were tired from our long vacation in Italy so we decided to forget about it and enjoy our last day in Rome. Like if that wasn't enough, the guard next to our room kept talking on the phone and the sound insulation was so bad that it sounded like if he was inside our room. I asked him in a polite manner to lower his voice and he did, for about 15 minutes, then he started talking again. Every time he talked or walked or moved the chair, he disturbed our sleep. It was a sleepless night. The Termini area is a uninteresting, impractical side of town to stay in. It is filled with budget hotels, mediocre restaurants with rude staff on the average. The first days of our trip we stayed in the Spanish Steps area and if you are a tourist this is the place to stay. It is packed with restaurants, designer shops of all kinds, very picturesque small, pedestrian streets were you can do plenty of walking around. This is not the case in Termini, you will need subways or ground transportation all the time. If you go to Rome you can do better than choosing the Golden Tulip Mecenate Palace and the Termini area.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed views”
Reviews.Author: WilliamD
Reviews.Content: After 2 weeks travelling Italy, our last night was spent here. I was ratrher stressed from travelling when we arrived, but genuinely this was the WORST check-in I have ever experienced. I have worked in the 5* hotel industry for many years and there is just no excuse for this service. However most other areas were fine. We were upgarded to a suite which was great, although a dirty bathroom. We ordered room service at 6pm but was told they were too busy, I argued that it's 24 hours and they took my order but it never arrived. We took dinner on the terrace at around 10pm, and have a few drinks and light meal. 4 different people served us, so we ended up having wrong food and also underpaying, which took a while to sort out. Overall, not a bad price (£150 b&b) but would probably not return because of the terrible service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient for the most of the sights of Rome. We took the Metro to the Vatican but walked to other places. The staff were friendly and breakfasts in the rooftop area were good. No hotel restaurant so needed to go out for evening meal but this was no problem. Also rooftop bar was very relaxing to watch sunset over St Peter's.

Reviews.Title: “a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: gpp
Reviews.Content: Mecenate Palace Hotel has become our family's pied a terre when visiting Rome. The rooms are excellently appointed, quiet, and immaculately clean. The staff, especially the gentlemen at the reception desk, are paragons of professionalism, efficiency, and courtesy. The hotel’s central location is excellent for walks to sights/sites of historical, artistic or cultural interest in the old city; the stazione Termini is only a few blocks away (a real advantage); and there are always cabs waiting at the S. Maria Maggiore piazza just across the street if you prefer not to walk or take the Metro. Contrary to some of the guidebooks which give caveats about the area the hotel is situated in, our family on each of our stays at the Mecenate has found the location to be quite safe, even late at night. In fact, I would describe the area as bustling with energy and diversity, two of the qualities which make a great city great. (As for a place to enjoy an espresso, a campari, or to get something to eat and then sit and watch the world go by, I would suggest by-passing the restaurant next to the hotel, going instead to “Le Due Colonne”, a little ristorante on the v. Liberiana, just a bit around the S. Maria Maggiore to the left (another minute or two away). It’s far less expensive, the food and drink are better, and the service is friendlier.)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: sugarpine
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my daughter in March, having chosen it due to Tripadvisor reviews. We were given a lovely room with a fantastic view of the Basillica right over the square. When we opened the cutrains on our arrival and saw the Church lit up, it was a real treat. Our room was excellent. It was lovely to be able to go back for a nice cup of tea after a long day! The staff could not have been more helpful. They instantly answered questions via e-mail before we arrived and they were really helpful re. restaurants and transport etc. The staff at breakfast were efficient and cheerful and the hotel was clean and well maintained. Rome was fantastic, we walked everywhere and saw so much. The Greenline tour bus leaves from only a couple of streets away and acted as a good way to get our bearings on the first day. After that, we were able to walk. We had a wonderful trip.There are some miserable people who will find fault with anything! I have stayed in many hotels around the world and found this one to be very good indeed.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: LOS72
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic weekend myself and two friends have just had in Rome. We stayed at the very lovely Mecenate Palace Hotel. The triple room was an adequate size, spotlessly clean and tastefully decorated. The beds were comfy and everything seemed very high quality in the room. It was also extremely quiet and no noise from other rooms could be heard, which makes a pleasant change from other hotels I have stayed at. The staff were very friendly and helpful.
