The other thing which made the Mecenate stand out from other hotels was the breakfast room. The fifth floor roof terrace had a stunning view of the Santa Maria Maggiore church and of Rome. What a great start to the day having a nice continental breakfast, with a good choice of food, in such a lovely setting. The hotel's location was great for the Termini Station which was a five minute walk, though I wouldn't recommend walking to/from the station at night as the surrounding area didn't feel that safe. We walked to all the major attractions, including the Vatican (the Colosseum is only 10 minutes walk away). On the whole I would highly recommend the Mecenate Palace and would definitely return there myself. My only regret is that we could not stay for a couple more days!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings, but overall a fine Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lukebabs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mecenate Palace March 31 through April 5, 2005 and was, overall, a pleasurable stay with them. The staff at the reception desk was very indifferent, which after 17 hours of travel to get there, was not the most comforting feeling. It is important to us to be near transportation when staying in a city, and this Hotel met that requirement, with the train station, Metro three blocks away and a Taxi stand right across the street. (Most places in Italy one cannot hail a cab from the curb) Once we were checked into the room, we found it to be quite nice and comfortable. Most sites are walkable from the Hotel and the Santa Maria Maggiore, a landmark church in Rome, is right across the street and worth seeing. (For you Dan Brown fans "Angels and Demons", there is surprise in this church. Hint: it's in one of the stained glass windows) The weather was beautiful and the rooftop breakfast had the best selection and quality of items during our two-week stay in Italy, which included Sorrento, Florence, and Venice. The staff in the breakfast terrace was very nice and attentive. Eugenio, the bellman (and general do-everything person) is a great guy and very helpful. Choosing a hotel in Rome can be a daunting task, but if you need to be close to transportation and get some value for your money, the Mecenate Palace will suit your needs adequately. The neighborhood is OK as the Hotel is just far enough away from the train station where you can run into some unsavory types.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: OggyDoggy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in July 2004. I loved it. Excellent value. The the room was quite small, but since we were out sight seeing most of the time this did not matter. For the price, it is a fantastic place to stay. The breakfast on the roof terrace is a joy. What a great way to start the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Not much to shout about!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this hotel having booked it trough expedia because of the fantastic reviews, although i don't see what the fuss is about. The staff were OK although didn't seem interested and sometimes seemed annoyed with us being there. The terrace was out of bounds even though there was lovely weather. We asked the staff why it was closed and they said that it wasn't the right time of year which we accepted since it did say on expedia that only in some seasons. We then asked if it would be open on the 28th of June because we were returning then for another week. They said that it would be closed for two or more weeks during early July but should be open for when we were staying. So word of warning if your plannibg to stay during early July don't. The breakfast was reasonable but was nothing special and i agree that the terrace would have made the breakfast much better!! The area is OK farely near all the sites but the area was slightly dodgey at niht. It was scarey because of the amount of homeless and theifs reported in the area but we never encountered anything never the less we did feel insecure most of the time. Rooms were reasonable apart from the horrid decor. Bathrooms were reasonable. They were farely small and the showere wasn't ver powerfull but they were clean enough. Some rooms seemed noisy when we asked to look at a few of them at the end of our break. We had a room near the back that was fine but the rooms at the front had lovely views but you could hear everything and the road is farely busy all the time. All in all an average hotel NOT as good as i expected and definately NOT 18th in Rome. There seemed some much better hoel near by and one hotel in the same square as the Golden Tulip Mecenate Palace seemed very nice it was cheaper and looked much cosier inside. It was something like the hotel Gilla or maybe Gallia.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: anyscreenname
Reviews.Content: Lived up to the good reviews. Great room looking onto Square.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Content: As reported by other reviews, the Mecanate Palace is a beautiful hotel. We had a suite on the top floor that was decorated entirely with Art Nouveau antiques. The bathrooms are big and luxurious. They even provide bathrobes. There is also a coffee and tea service in the room. I see a previous review says that the staff is snotty. I wonder how that can be when we stayed at the Mecanate at the same time. (We are a family and were not dressed up -- ever.) All the men at the front desk were most helpful, either in suggesting restaurants, calling taxis, making reservations for the Villa Borghese, and even breaking a large 50 euro bill to facilitate our shopping from street vendors. They even provide umbrellas when it rains! The breakfast is not a hot breakfast, but it is included in the price and the food is abundant. An ala carte hot breakfast is available at extra charge, but we did not see anyone order it. A couple of restaurant suggestions. The front desk people sent us to L'Archetto's which is a 10 minute walk. Loved it. A previous review suggested Unicum which is a 5 minute walk. Loved that too. A little farther is Hostaria Romana. Might be just a little too far to walk comfortably and hard to find by yourself, so take a taxi and walk back! We utilized Vatican Tours and Beyond during our stay, which can be reached through a website. We recommend them too. Especially the 5 hour Vatican Tour where you are taken into some private areas at the Vatican which aren't open to tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but beware the staff”
Reviews.Author: Mikegrif
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved the room, which was beautiful and large. That said, the front desk staff is snotty if you are young or not wearing a suit. Whether that bothers you depends on your perspective, but my favorite hotel, The Peninsula, manages to be elegant without contempt. Anyway, the staff is generally not helpful for -- for example -- acquiring taxis. They generously offered us a taxi to Fiumicino for 70 euros; though my wife and I declined and found a company that took us for 31 euros. Keep in mind that the owner is a grad from Cornell's great hotel mgmt program; accordingly, you'll find minibar prices much more like the quality American chains rather than the "It's a steal" prices I've typically found in Italy. The rooftop terrace is breathtaking, but the food is vastly overpriced and you would do well to head farther down the street for good eating. The neighborhood is just OK at night. Overall, the beauty of the place is magnificent, but the service experience is overpriced and substandard.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and OH what a view!”
Reviews.Author: deblemint
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mecenate Palace in April 2004. Overall the room was quite comfortable, nicely furnished and included extras like thick robes and slippers. The room was small but tastefully decorated - definitely not your cookie cutter USA hotel room. We were thrilled with our view of the Santa Maria Maggiori across the street - it was stunning! The location is wonderful - we were within walking distance of the Colosseum and various shops and restaurants. The area across from the hotel entrance looked a little seedy, but the overall area was actually pretty safe, even walking with our 10 year old at night. The front desk staff was courteous, some more friendly than others. The rooftop dining (buffet breakfast included in our room price) was adequate, but seemed nicer thanks to the view. It was easy to catch a cab or take a bus from this location, and there are many great sandwich and coffee places around the square.

Reviews.Title: “So Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: tracyhhblue
Reviews.Content: I spent hours on the Net reasearching hotels in Rome before finally deciding on The Mecenate Palace. Having worked in Hotel Management for years,I am hard to please but do not have the budget to always get what I want. The Mecenate really hit the spot. Even though our room was small,everything was really good quality. It was very clean and quite luxurious. Breakfast on the rooftop terrace was wonderful - a real memory. It was also well located. We got the bus from Ciampino and were then able to walk to the hotel so no need for expensive taxis. We were able to walk to the sights too. My romantic break was just that - and the hotel played a large part!

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel, especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: JulesInSwindon
Reviews.Content: Just come back from 3 nights here, 11th to 14th March 2005 (a long weekend.) Booked the trip 8 months ago as a present for my stepfather's 50th, based on reviews on this site. Stayed with boyfriend and parents so had 2 adjoining rooms. Was not disappointed with the hotel. Got a great rate of 130 EUR a night for a double room including breakfast - which for a 4 star hotel in Rome is very good (book online.) Having read a lot of the other reviews on this site, my random bullet points are: * don't worry about it being in a rough area, it's absolutely fine (not the prettiest - although the basilica opposite is great! - but fine). Also very convenient - 5 mins away from Termini with great trains, buses, taxis, metros. Location 10/15 mins stroll from the main Ancient sites (Colosseum, Palatine Hill, Forum etc) and 15/20 mins from Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain etc. 45 min walk to Vatican so advise take Metro from Termini, then walk back via the Centro Storico sites! Take good shoes and walk everywhere (and it's nicer that way - there are loads of random bits of Roman building that aren't in guide books that you just fall over when you walk anywhere!) * breakfast great - all you can eat & drink - tea/coffee/juice, yoghurt/cakes/pastries, bread/rolls/crackers plus cold meat, cheese, jams/marmalade, Nutella, selection of cereals... the list goes on. As long as you're not looking for a Full English, you'll be happy. * hotel was very clean and well decorated with lovely rooms. * reasonable selection of inhouse TV channels including BBC World and CNN in English language - also Italian obviously plus French and German channels. * rooms are perfectly adequately sized - unless you're American and are used to massive warehouses to sleep in, in which case you might find the rooms a bit small. * bathrooms lovely with great water pressure in the shower! and a really cool night light thing where if you get up to pay a visit in the light, you can turn on a really dim light that lets you see what you're doing without waking up properly! * streets are indeed a bit noisy but the double glazing blocks this out fine. * all the staff were lovely to us. Example: our flight was delayed so we arrived at almost midnight on a Friday but they cheerfully took our order for pizzas and salad in the bar, even though they were supposed to close in 5 minutes. The check-in staff were also really good. * if you're British, it's a really great thing to have not just coffee but also tea making facilities in the room - although you might want to buy some milk instead of the creamer! * the mini bar prices are on the cheaper side of average for a hotel - although particularly for the snacks and soft drinks, you might want to pay a visit to the supermarket across the road rather than pay EUR2 for a packet of peanuts! Overall, I'd recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome - I just don't see the point in paying twice the amount just to get a slightly larger room or a slightly more central hotel (but that's obviously up to you.) This hotel was good at any price, and absolutely great at the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “A great retreat from busy Rome!”
Reviews.Author: MiB
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we had been anywhere in Italy so wanted to make sure we would in a hotel that was both authentic and inviting. Sightseeing was obviously high on the list as was seeing Rome at night so somewhere to relax after busy days (and nights) was high on the list. The Mecentate Palace ticked all the boxes. The staff were very welcoming and friendly, always happy to help! The pick up and drop off to the airport arranged with the hotel was quick, convenient and on time too. Well recommended as it does make the airport trips much more relaxing and for a reasonable fee too. It's close enough to Termini to get around the city though be prepared for a considerable amount of walking if you want to see everything! A final recommendation must be to try the Ferrara restaurant in Trastevere (huge selection of wine - see picture!).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got married in Rome last Sept (only getting around to reviews now!) and stayed here for 2 nights. We had our reception there also. All I can say was that the reception was the best day ever. The food was superb, the staff extremely courteous and accommodating and the location was perfect. Yes, rooms a little on the small side but who spends much time in the room when in Rome? Also have to say that Management at the property was top class at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good value and very central. It is right next to the Termini station. The staff were not very friendly. We asked for information on getting to Ciampino airport by train. The man on the desk said that it was not easy and was better to go by their car seviuce, which cost a monstrous 55 euros! We found out about the train at the station, which was only 2 euros plus a short cab ride. Plus it only took 15 minutes. He clearly wanted to get a backhander from the car company.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was very average, location isn't great”
Reviews.Author: Antonia
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very average, the rooms not being particularly large and the bar threw us out at midnight leaving us with nowhere in the vicinity to go. We had to queue for breakfast and the food ran out which wasn't particularly impressive. On the plus side, the rooms were clean, we were given complimentary bath robes (after requesting them) and the concierge was very helpful in terms of directions and sightseeing. The tube station is within walking distance for easy access to the sights. The location isn't great for Rome, you would be far better situated near the Spanish Steps as there is an abundance of nightlife, shopping and restaurants in that area. We wouldn't book again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I had a Lovely time at the Mecanate. All around room and Bar and staff were very nice. It would be nice to see the roof area open in January,but i understand it was under renovation. it would be a bonus for Breakfast in good Weather, even out of Season.

Reviews.Title: “smart option”
Reviews.Author: turmogo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two days , the staff was helpfull , good english and a comprehensive spanish level, the surrounding area is safe but not a pretty area , especially near termini station ,there are better hotels in rome but the value/price ratio is very high. I strongly recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel near the central station. Very good value for money, comfortable room with large bathrooms. I stayed there 2 days before Cristmas and i surely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location near main train station, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: fdipace
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights recently and picked the Mecenate Palace from the reviews at tripadvisor. The reviews are right on target regarding the Mecenate. The location is near enough to walk to the main city attractions and yet walking distance from the main train station. My room on the 5th floor (deluxe room) was on the smallish side but the ammenities, room decor and price made up for the size. The breakfast buffet is good however there is no hot food. My only complaint is the hotel a/c and heating system only has either heat or a/c so if its a hot night out in the fall and the system is on heat you do not have access to a/c. So if your staying during a "shoulder" season make sure to request a room not facing the street or it can be noisy with your window open. Other ammenities include wonderful sheets, a comfortable bed, tea/coffee making facilities in the room, marble bathrooms, a mini bar and a room safe. It is also nice that the hotel provides umbrellas for rainy days.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dede321
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the weekend. The staff was very nice and the rooms are practical and upscale. The ones with the view of the church are a little smaller than the new rooms decorated very modern and located on the next building. The entrance for the new renovated rooms is not as nice as the main entrance. It is close to metro, bus stop and the train station. Although the walk to the train station is not the nicest area of Rome... Good choice overall.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL & LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: REL
Reviews.Content: This was the last leg on a trip across Italy (Venice, Florence, Rome). I originally selected this hotel due to its favorable reviews and location near the Termini. It is a SHORT walk from the Termini (maybe 3 blks) from the airport train (it will take MUCH more time to find a cab, and drive in circles vs. simply walking if your bags aren't too heavy). The surroundings of the hotel are interesting as it is populated with storefronts, some homeless but nice residential and restaurants. Across the street from the hotel is an ATM, supermarket and department store. I forgot the church. Down the street (opposite the round-around) is the Metro/subway station and Termini is 3 blks which gives access to all buses, and trains. The hotel itself has a staffed bar, and nice social lobby area. They have a bellhop and elevator/lift to get you upstairs. Breakfast is served on the top floor with a nice view but the food isn't worth the trip. I felt it was less desirable than all the other hotels I stayed at during my trip but you have the basics - yogurt, cereal, crossiant, cheese, etc. Bathroom/room have nice touchest and I felt an adequate size for Europe. I had NO complaints of this hotels and would definately stay here again. It is within walking distance of a few tourist sites and due to a national strike during my stay I walked from the Vatican back to my hotel with numerous stops along the way. I would STRONGLY suggest staying at the Mecenate Palace if you want a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: higo
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Mecenate Palace for 4 nights. This is a lovely maintained hotel with fantastic beds! The rooms are kept to high standard and are very clean, in all honesty the rooms are quite small but they are good quality. The bathroom was very good too. The Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was a bit basic in all honesty, you could do with fresh tomatoes to go with the cheese and ham. You will have to be prepared to walk, but don't let this put you off, all of the main sites are in walking distance , the Coloseum is about a 15 minute walk and that's the nearest, then if you carry on towards the Forum you just keep coming to the sites after that, the Hotel map was great. We found an excellent Piano Bar Restaurant on the way to the Coloseum, food, wine, service and entertainment were world class! Ask the staff in the Hotel for directions. We would definitely return to this Hotel and would recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Less than nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Italy where I stayed at the Mecenate Palace in Rome. Must say I found the hotel to be extremely nice, especially given the price. The location is convenient to the train station, though a bit far from many attractions outside of the Coliseum. Would have rated it a 5 instead of a 4 if the staff were friendlier. As soon as most of them realized I didn't speak Italian, it was difficult to get help. I realize it must be a bit frustrating for them, but I really tried to be nice about it to no avail. (Though I must say the man who worked at night was very nice.) Too bad, because it really is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel convenient for the Termini”
Reviews.Author: trickychicane
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Rome but my third to Italy. The Mecenate Palace is well-presented and easy to find from the Termini. Although the standard bedrooms are quite small, the overall footage of the rooms is considerable, due to huge bathrooms and the triple wardrobe at the end of the hall. The walls are covered with fabric, rather than paint or paper, which seems to keep the warmth in and the noise out! With the windows closed, the only 'disturbance' you are likely to hear is the bells of the basilica - hardly a bad thing! Breakfast is light but you can eat as much as you like and hot food can be ordered at extra cost from the a la carte menu. The staff are very polite and seemed particularly amused (but very helpful) with my occasionally shaky Italian! The Italians are a great, warm, entertaining bunch but it helps if you are similarly open! Rome is a fantastic city; vibrant and entertaining. The Mecenate is about 10 minutes away from the Colosseum by foot. The Spanish Steps and main shopping areas (all the expensive names ending in 'i' and 'e'!!) are about a good 30 minutes away on foot but it's worth the walk, if only to be entertained by Italian driving! The route is very straightforward. I encountered no problems with beggars or suchlike, only street vendors determined to sell me an umbrella! Go to Rome and enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 8-night stay at this hotel. Was very pleased. Had upgraded to superior room. No view, but decent-sized room for European standards. Large marble bathroom, however, no shower curtain and glass partitian leaked water on floor each time we showered. Room spotless and well cleaned everyday, had coffee maker and small honor bar too. Hotel staff very pleasant, especially Roberto. Small TV with only 2 US speaking news channels. Hotel had nice lounge that had happy hour each night at 6pm. Small finger foods, nice to come back and relax. Prices a bit steep, but do able. Internet (for a fee) also in lobby as well as USA Today papers. Breakfast got boring after a few mornings. Ham, cheese, yogurt, cereal, bread. Same stuff everyday with no variety, so we hit the McDonalds at the train station for "american" breakfast on occasion. Hotel's location was good for us. Yes, in a bit of a seedy part of town, but never once did we feel threatened or scared. As a matter of fact, probably the only place in Rome we WERN'T hit up by beggars. Yes, a few homeless, but they didn't bother us one bit. Metro station 5 blocks to hotel. DO NOT pay cab driver from Termini to hotel, just walk it. (can catch a train from the airport to Termini for 9 euros). Also, Gray Line Tours and GreenLine Tours both had offices 2 blocks away. Nice little grocery store on corner where we bought snaks and wine for room, or any necessities. Can (and did) walk to most sites, but it's only for the fit with a good pair of shoes. Metro takes you to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and Vatican. Save cab fare and see the city by foot. Being our third trip to Europe, this was the best hotel we've chosen to far. Can spend way more, but you're only there for sleep and shower. This was more than adequate for that, and a quiet place to return for short nap in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: idajimmi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year and loved it so much that we stayed here again. The hotel has a very luxorious feel to it, the room are small but very elegant. It is close to the train station and close to all the sightseeing you want to do. The breakfast buffett is very nice. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: Tjockey
Reviews.Content: Just back from 5 nights at the Mecenate Palace. Had upgraded room with view of Basillica. Staff professional and responded promptly to all requests. Room and facilities well maintained. Tv small with limited chanels. Good sound proofing with window closed, important as lots of traffic in area. Breakfast on par with other hotels I've stayed at in Italy. Nice breakfast room on roof with view of city. Only downside to this hotel is location. Area is in transition with lots of non Italian immigrants as well as more than it's share of homeless people. Did not feel unsafe, but was less than uplifting. Location is probably ok for those familiar with Rome's bus and subway system. Otherwise be prepared to use taxi's as it is a long walk to most major tourist area's. Would stay there again if price discounted to reflect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal quality/price/location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just stayed the three last nights at the Mecenate Palace. Convenient location nearby public transportation (metro/bus/tram) Friendly and efficient staff, no pb for late check out Nice and confortable rooms up to roma standards Ask for a room with church view. Breakfast room on the roof-terrace Very good hotel for few days in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our honeymoon in Rome (Nov. 1 - Nov. 8) where we stayed at the Mecenate Palace. The staff was most helpful and almost all had a great command of English. The rooms weren't American-sized, but we never felt cramped. The bathroom was plenty big with marble counter and floor and double sinks. Fresh bathrobes and slippers each evening and huge fluffy towels. Breakfast each morning wasn't American (greasy meats and greasy eggs) but was somewhat healthy and quite filling. Ham, cheese, pastries, fruit, yogurt, cereal, orange juice, coffee, toast, etc. We had a great view of the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore across the street. Speaking of the street, even though our room faced a very busy street, with the windows closed we couldn't hear a thing. We never once felt unsafe anywhere in Rome, much less around the hotel. True, there were a few homeless people sleeping around it, but they were harmless. The cafe just next door was tasty and friendly. We sat on the corner nightly and drank coffee and wrote postcards. And, no, the hotel isn't close to the Vatican, but we truly enjoyed exploring the neighborhoods between the hotel and the tourist sites. Found some very nice shops, restaurants and views just by wandering around the city. I would highly recommend this hotel for both the room and its staff. Oh, but don't take the Rome at night bus tour. Not worth the money since the Colisseum is no longer lit and the Trevi Fountain isn't currently filled with water or lit.

Reviews.Title: “Accurate Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Traveler
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews here are accurate. Rooms must vary, because ours was a little small; giant bathroom, tight bedroom; no problem though. Very helpful desk staff. Agree that the neighborhood can be a bit seedy. If you turn to the right when exiting the lobby, be careful at night; turning to the left (toward the church) is OK. Restaurant literally 50 yards away (Agata e Romeo) one of the very best ever. Quite expensive but an experience. MUST have reservations; they take no walk-ins; only 9 tables and they fill up every evening; open at 8 p.m.

Reviews.Title: “oct 29th to nov 3rd”
Reviews.Author: htc
Reviews.Content: just returned from a break to rome stayed at this hotel the facts .... room 303 if it was a double room then its the smallest ive ever stayed in ..... if it wasnt then ive just been ripped off!!!! perhaps that being alitte harsh but they class this hotel as four stars and in truth its more 2 starish compared to a standard uk hotel. breakfast was very continental but excellent since the weather was warm so what was on offer was spot on .... a selection of rolls and cereals yoghurst and fruit ... meat and cheese ..... the location of the hotel was excellent for those who like to walk ...... 10 minutes and at the back of the colsseum .... 1 hour at afairish pace and at the vatican ...... 45 minutes to the trevi and pantheon area ..... the hotel is in a how to put it ..just out of the centre ...downtownish area.... I had read prior to out depature on these boards that the area was unsafe THIS WASNT TRUE !!!! just be sensible .....especially when the sun goes down ..becasue yes quite afew homeless peolpe gathered to sleep rough in the street !!!! i had arranged a bus transfer from the airport to the termin station but decided to taxi it instead cost 40 euro arranged via roma.clickon the web ... but did it feel threatening no !!! but would i have wanted to have been there with my daughter ...no !!! the satff behind the desk where well in truth ..not happy at there work sort of feeling ..except the chap called roberto who was most helpful ..... in essence ..would i stay there again ..... probably not .......i like 4 star hotels to be 4 star hotels and in rome perhaps it would be best to book in 5 stars and stick with abrand name ...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jsenkel
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first trip to Rome and stayed at this hotel. Lovely hotel, lots of beautiful marble and pretty decor. Location is within easy access to the Metro (beware pickpocketers) and is right across from Santa Maria Maggiore church (beautiful). You will actually be able to hear the bells ringing at breakfast. Breakfast is served on the rooftop and is bread/cereal/canned fruit/coffee/juice only, but the rooftop view is very nice. You can not see it when seated though, only when standing up. We walked around late at night every night- the area is quite busy and safe. Great little outside restaurant right next to the hotel facing the church. No violent crime risk here, just beware pickpockets. Wonderful hotel, very helpful staff. A lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mecenate a Class Act!”
Reviews.Author: Mzscahlett
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mecenate is a classy, upscale "city" style hotel with a professional and helpful staff. The assertions made here by some former guests that their kindness in assisting with procuring a taxi service is an attempt to operate a "scam" of any kind are absurd. Most hotels that book outside services, like tours, taxis or trains, will ask to be paid in cash because they have essentially lent you cash out-of-pocket and for no other reason. If they charge it through the hotel, then they lose a percentage of their loan in charge card fees, and they should hardly be penalized for having done you a favor by arranging for a taxi or a train reservation. Honestly, sometimes I am embarrassed to be an American. (That said, do watch out for the taxi scam artists at the train station, they are quick to grab your luggage as you get off the train and then push you into a cab with no running meter.. definitely a rip off.) That argument aside, this hotel is a delightful find. Reasonable rates and lovely appointed rooms. Concierge Piero went out of his way to find us lovely restaurants (try Caruso for a very high end evening in Rome) and provide us with excellent service. The location is good, and within walking distance of the Coliseum and the Palatine hills (Ancient Rome). This is a lovely hotel, on a class with many of the nicer hotels one would find in SF. I highly recommend it and would return in a heartbeat without any reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Golden Tulip in Rome”
Reviews.Author: rgamb117
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful!! We stayed there in mid-September 2004 for six nights and the staff could not be more helpful!! We got in late in the day on our first day & asked for a recommendation for a restaurant - when we got there a table was reserved for us by the hotel. Pietro (one of the main hosts) at the hotel was EXCELLENT!! He went out of his way to assist us. He called for cabs & told us where the "not to miss" places were...We requested a top floor overlooking Basillica Santa Maggiore & we were dead center - it was great! The hotel itself was very classy - marble floors, very italian looking, the bathrooms were all marble - very long tub, the beds were changed daily (sheets & all). The continental breakfast that was provided free of charge was more than sufficient...rolls, bread, crossants, all kinds of jellys, cream cheese, cheese, ham, fruits, yogurt, juice, coffe, tea and pastries....more than enough for a light breakfast. And if you needed more - you could order eggs, etc for a nominal fee. The hotel itself is in a city area - if you don't like the city - don't stay here. It's a busy area (think NYC) - but if you want the true italian experience you will see everything here!!! One of the best restaurants we ate at (2) times during our six night stay was UNICUM it's at 164 VIa di S.M.Maggiore.....Giovanni the main waiter was exceptional....a definate not to be missed!!!! ENJOY YOUR TRIP!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Value If The Price Is Right”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: was at the Mecenate in Feb 2002 which is low season naturally. I negotiated the price of US$100/night with the manager and enjoyed my stay very much. Rooftop breakfast is great. You can see the Apennines on a clear day. Located 1 block from Santa Maria Maggiore on the Esquilino, Mecenate is convenient to most sites as well as Termini (Rome's main train/bus station) and the Cavour metro stop. The lobby and room were immaculate; hotel must have been recently renovated. Windows are triple glazed and soundproof - necessary to lock out the piezo police sirens you hear in every European city. Although Mecenate's website is cruddy, I hate the fact that it is so hard to find the official websites of hotels on the internet so here's Mecenate's: www.goldentulipmecenatepalace.com Website lacks many photos I would consider necessary before booking, but be assured the rooms are nice. Unfortunately, the standard room they show is not as nice as what I experienced. Thought the staff was pleasant but nothing extraordinary. I did read the review of another Trip Advisor user who stayed at Mecenate. While still maintaining that the hotel was nice and the staff pleasant, I absolutely believe this story, but not b/c of anything I experienced at Mecenate, but b/c such scams are typical in Europe. Mecenate popped that extra charge on as he was leaving so they could stuff that money in their own pockets. This is the net effect of socialism and its sky-high tax rate. Just remember that next time you vote Democrat all you ugly Americans. Caveat emptor no matter where you lodge! All in all, Mecenate is worth a try as a safe and predictable place to stay in Rome. The value for your money will depend upon what season it is. If you're strapped for cash, try the many clean, comfortable and inexpensive convents in Rome. Some even boast Frette linens and bedding! --------------------------------------------- Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in the summer and can't believe the negative reviews. Rooms were clean, comfortable, breakfasts good, roof terrace has great views and staff were v. helpful -- even translating parts of our car hire manual for us when we couldn't open the boot! Location is a little out of the centre, but if you're fit walking is no problem and a good way to see the city and Santa maggiore itself is an inspiring site.

Reviews.Title: “Met all our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Mercenate Palace was everything we expected and more. It was top notch. The hotel was beautiful. We had an upper room with a spectacular view of Santa Maria Maggiore. The breakfast, which is included, was very nice. The rooms were immaculate and we got clean sheets everyday.I would recommend this hotel to anyone and I would book it again when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wedded Bliss”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had my Wedding Reception here in December 2002. Gianluca Giannai was excellent. Many of our guests stayed at the Hotel, as did we - the Suite Virgillio is amazing. The staff are indeed NOT very friendly, but just take it as part of the experience...when in Rome - be rude back.....There is the most charming little coffee shop next door - their warmth more than makes up for the frost-bite next door!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and superb location”
Reviews.Author: RandT
Reviews.Content: I am surprised at the two recent negative reviews of this hotel---I seems like a totally different hotel than I stayed in around the same time, my associate and I stayed here 8/27-29/04 and found the staff to be helpful and friendly, most of them spoke good English and they were very professional and courteous. I have to say we paid a lot less than some, our room was booked on Orbitz for $110 Euro a night. I have found it definately pays to shop the websites for the best deal. Our room was comfortably appointed, clean and large enough that we never felt cramped. The breakfast was very good, even though it didn't include any warm breakfast foods, we found that to be traditional in all of Italy. I would say this was one of the best. As far as the neighborhood, we never felt threatened and I was much more comfortable walking at night here than I would be in San Francisco, Los Angeles, New York - or most large American cities. Certainly a central location to see the historical sites and the metro stop is just a block away for the Vatican...but we loved the walking!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: BetteNoir
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our Italy trip, and I wanted to leave my two cents about the Mecenate. I ended up booking this hotel (great price through Expedia link) mainly based on the strong reviews on Trip Advisor. We were certainly not disappointed. Compared to some of the other places we stayed at in Italy, the Golden Tulip was like the Ritz! We found the rooms clean, well appointed, quiet, and comfortable. The bathroom was the only decent one we encountered in Italy (by American standards). We also got a kick out of the turn down service that comes with individual slippers and a bedside linen. (I took an extra pair of slippers with me and used them in the "less sanitary" hotel we stayed at for the return trip). The rooms might seem small by US standards but just fine if you are more used to international travel. (yeah, welcome to Europe...deal with it) We had no problems with the service, and found everyone to be polite and helpful. I think some others have had worse service experiences with this hotel, but we didnt find this to be the case. (one note...I would not usually count on the staff of a bigger hotel to recommend a "good/local" restaurant in a tourist heavy city...don't expect it and you won't be disappointed. Get a good guidebook instead.) I would definitely stay here again, and definitely recommend it to others. Good value for the amenities, good rooms/bathrooms, good breakfast and terrace, good/convenient location. Nobody said it was perfect, but unless you want to spend the big bucks for the Exedra or other luxury places, staying at the Mecenate will give you a level of ease and comfort that will make your trip enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad attitude and staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Keep in mind that Rome is very expensive for this season, and tourists are generally treated as second class people in town (at least at this time of the season). The hotel was expensive (200 euro per night) for the bare minimal service it provides – no internet and gym, the breakfast is also not very exciting (no eggs at all). But I am turned off by the coldness of the staff (could use a smile or two for the price you have just paid them). They also don’t do a good job of explaining charges to us. (The mini story follows later). There are a few things that I particularly disliked: -Bad recommendation: They recommend us to go to really bad and bossy restaurants and trick you into thinking they are “good restaurants that locals go to”. I think they might receive some commission. There was a very good, close-by local restaurant that we found later, but they did not mention it to us and upon asking, said it was “just so so”. -At mid night some kids group were making a lot of noise on the nearby basilica square, right underneath our window. I called the front desk and the person refused to do anything about it. Here is the mini story about the charges: Upon making a reservation on line, the hotel sent us email telling us there is a 55 euro pick up service from the air port that we could take advantage of. Fine. But I asked for information about train service between the airport and the termini (central train station of Rome) – they never got back to us. (The train ride was 9 euros per person, as we later found out). When I signed up for the pick up service, they said they would collect the charge “upon arrival”. They never ask us for the charge upon our arrival. When we were checking out four days later, the guy at the reception said I have to pay 55 euros in cash. Fine, except we don’t have that much cash left anymore. He reluctantly agreed to charge that to credit card, but want to charge 10% tax. Knowing that the Visa credit card service must charge them, I did not argue for the fact that there should be a fee but don’t think it should be that much. The reception person also said it was for “tax purposes”. Anyway, I argued with him that 10% is too much. He turned back and said something like (I am paraphrasing) “Let me check. If it turns out that you did were notified by us for the cash requirement, I WILL CHARGE YOU MORE”. This is the most outrageous part of our trip experience – a hotel employee threatening me. I understand there is differences of practices between US and Europe, but I would recommend you to stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad neighbourhood, unfriendly staff,”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 8th Sept to 12th Sept 2004 and whislt the decor and cleanliness could not be faulted, we found the staff to be very unhelpful, bordering on rude. They 'lost' the details of the credit card we gave them upon arrival and when transactions were charged against our card by the hotel they REFUSED to take any responsibility for them or provide details on what they were for. A reluctance to provide assistance following my friends' wallet being stolen on the metro was surprising, it took several efforts on our part to get details of the nearest police station from the sullen male staff memeber behind the counter. The view from our room was nice but somewhat ruined by the sight of the drunk / drugged up homeless people and beggars who seem to use the square & steps in front of the basilica as a public toilet / place to sleep and hassel passers-by for cash. Double glazed windows did not drown out the constant noise of traffic and wailing sirens from police cars and ambulances that raced round the square 24hrs a day. Would defintely stay in a different neighbourhood next time, preferably in a hotel where the staff were a bit more friendly too!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, Staff was generally friendly. Close to everything for walking to except the Vatican but the main terminal is just a few blocks away. Rode the train from airport for only 9.50 euros. Room was small but very comfortable. The best bed I have ever slept in at a hotel. Also, extremely quiet. Nice breakfast on the rooftop. Lots to choose from in the area for eating and shopping. At least 2 different internet cafes nearby. All in all a very nice stay. I would definately stay there again. For those with small children I will say there are some homeless type around the area of the church and towards the terminal. While this did not bother me it might those with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. From the time we arrived (2.30am) until we left the staff were most attentive, housekeeping was first class and the location and view from the rooftop terrace were perfect. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Golden Tulip Mecenate is a great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent value for its price. While I am sure there may be more posh hotels in Rome, this one definitely delivers on all your needs. The staff is professional and courteous, and the rooms are very nicely appointed, though the carpets were a bit dingy, but acceptable. The bathrooms are large and have double sinks, but one problem is that there was only a half shower door, so each time we took a shower, the water got everywhere! The room itself is compact by American standards, but it is not at all problematic. We got a room on the top floor with a gorgeous view of the Santa Maria Maggiore Piazza. However, I am not really sure about what the view is like on the other side of the building. There is a continental breakfast every morning with breads, spreads, and some ham, and it is pretty good. The location is not central, but it is a 15-20 minute walk to the Colosseum. The main train station (Roma Termini) is about 5 minutes away, and there is a metro stop that is just a few steps away. The metro can take you very close to most of the major sites such as the Vatican and the Spanish Steps, so its location is not much of a problem. Also, the neighborhood is not nearly as creepy as other reviewers may have you believe. Some nice conveniences in the neighborhood include a nice laundrymat with good service just a few blocks down cavour towards the Colosseum (those who like to pack light and don't like hotel prices for cleaning services will love this), a grocery store across the street (cheap drinks and eats), and many internet and telephone points scattered around. Expect to pay 10 cents a minute to call the US and about 2 euro per hour on the internet. I know that these were a godsend for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Break at the Mecenate Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned (July 04) from a three day break at the Mecenate Palace Hotel. The room was well furnished, very clean and well attended and the reception staff were really helpful. The hotel is within 10 minutes walking distance of the Termini Station and within 15 minutes walking distance of the Colosseum. We would certainely use this hotel again. Look out for deals as the list price is quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Mecenate Palace very good for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Mecenate Palace was overall a very good hotel for the money in Rome. Located directly across the street from Santa Maria Maggiore, within walking distance of the train station, pretty good location overall. We were able to walk to most major attractions except the Vatican (and we could have walked there if we didn't get lazy at the end of our vacation). The room was very small, but we paid a very low rate. Breakfast was fantastic on rooftop terrace. Shower didn't drain particularly well and tended to leak, but water pressure was strong and hot. Carpets a bit worn, but room overall was very clean and we ended up having plenty of space for our clothes, etc. Good location, good price, would go back when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at this wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 glorious nights in this extremely charming hotel the first week of July this year. We had a lovely view of the Basillica Santa Maria Maggiore (do go take a look!) From the Concierge, to bartenders, all were personable, friendly and helpful. The rooms are extremely clean, have individual air conditioning thermostats, in-room tea/coffe and wet bar. Maid service is A+. This great little gem is so centrally located, most major tourist attractions are within easy walking distance; the Colosseum and Forum just two blocks away. There is a large grocery store across the street from the hotel. Breakfast buffet was continually fresh and delicious and the view from the rooftop breakfast room is delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view & a great rooftop garden”
Reviews.Author: MrsPaterson
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this beautiful hotel. We had a room with a view of the Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore. The room was small but very nice decorated. The staff at the front desk was very helpful in booking tours and recommending restaurants. We loved the rooftop garden where they serve breakfast in the morning and drinks in the evening until midnight. It is centrally located to the train station and the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Karen026
Reviews.Content: I booked all of our reservations online for our May trip through Italy based on reviews. We were thrilled with the Mecenate Palace and would definitely stay there again. The staff went overboard in helping us with restaurants, tour suggestions and just getting around. I had read somewhere that this is not a safe area ... it's fine and we had no problem walking the streets at night. Although the rooms are a bit small, they are immaculate and the marble bathrooms are more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mds_007
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best we stayed at in Italy. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and a decent size. The hotel's location is close to the city's major sights and a short walk from the Termini train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel definitely would recommend”
Reviews.Author: shahug
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel from 14th June - 18th June, I found the room very clean and spacious and the bathroom was beautiful decorated in marble and was extremely big. The buffet breakfast was beautiful and the staff were very friendly and helpful. All the attractions are within walking distance but do wear comfortable shoes as it is quite a walk. There are nice places to eat nearby and not to expensive and a really good Irish Bar nearby(Druids Den). We were lucky enough to meet Matt Damon at the spanish steps while we were there which did make my holiday. Would definitely return to Mecenate Palace - big thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel not so nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Mecenate is a nice hotel. The rooms are large and clean. The staff on our stay were not friendly, the neighborhood was very anti Bush, with lots of a nasty grafitti on the buildings.

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wieles
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from June 1 till June 8. It is a good, comfortable hotel. Our room had a great view on the Maria Maggiore Basilica. Rooms are clean and well cared for. Staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast is good. The price is fine; good value for money. Neighbourhood is not excellent, but sights are within walking distance and there are some good restaurants and pizzerias nearby. We definitely enjoyed our stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the last night of a 12 day vacation to Italy. It was a very pleasant surprise. It was one of the nicest hotels that we did stay in. It was very clean and modern. It was about a 20 minute walk to the Spanish steps area and it is only a few minutes away from the main train station by taxi. My wife really liked the large bathroom and nice shower. It was a very good value for the money. I booked it on Expedia for about $200 per night. The staff was nice ,by European standards. Breakfast was very nice on the terrace with standard continental breakfast. Be sure to go out on the terrace in the evening for a drink and a beautiful view. I would definitely recommend this hotel in Rome, especially for the price. Are certainly nicer hotels , but also much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice - latest was April 2004 - Rooms are small but quite cute with fabric walls and an attempt at fin-de-siecle style decor. The breakfast is pleasant on the terrace (be warned, the lift does not take you all the way up there, you have to walk up steps in the morning). They will cook you great eggs and bacon if you ask. If you get a room with a view over S.Maria Maggiore, which is an inspiring sight, you will have more traffic noise than if you are on the quieter via Carlo Alberto side. Bathrooms are very nice. Staff is helpful, good looking, charming really. Position? well...it took us a LONG time to walk to the Coliseum, and I had a 7 year old in tow, so it was hard going. We always ended up catching a taxi back from places like Pantheon or Piazza Navona. Area? well...at night time it was creepy stepping over the homeless and professional beggars right across the road in order to find the pizzeria Il Gallino Bianco that was recommended to us by the concierge. My son felt uneasy too. That pizzeria had a queue half way down the block and we ended up at possibly the nastiest restaurant in Rome, a block the other way, toward the railway station which promised Pizza Al Forno Legno (real wood fire). It had something to do with Sardegna I think, in the title, just avoid it. Also, the hotel has next to no room service, so be prepared. Only a few cold plates. If you stay there, my advice is never exit the door and wander off in the direction of the Railway Station, just always head toward the centre of Rome. I would stay there again, but only because I have not yet discovered a better solution. I would like bigger rooms and better room service - useful when you have tired children.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just completed a week-long stay at the Mecenate for our honeymoon (we checked out Monday May 31). This is a great hotel. The room was a little small (but typically small for a European hotel, nothing unusual). It was clean, the bathroom was quite good, and it was very comfortable. The AC will turn it into an icebox if you want! The pillows were a little hard but that's probably my biggest complaint. The location is actually great. It's about a 10 minute walk, maximum, to 2 different metro stations and the Termini where a large number of buses leave from. We were able to go all over Rome and even outside of Rome very simply from this location. It's not a great location immediately next to the hotel, sure, but it's in no way unsafe, and there are a few decent little restaurants. The Estrella (sp?) near Termini was quite charming, for example. But it's hardly a big deal to take public transportation and the buses will get you to Campo de Fiori or Vatican City or anywhere you want very quickly. We walked to Campo de Fiori a few times - if you're here for a vacation, walking is the way to go. The breakfast every morning is fantastic - the rooftop buffet was a GREAT way to wake up with a coffee and a continental breakfast. The rooftop bar isn't much in the evenings, but if the weather is nice it's a good place to have a quick little pre-dinner or after-dinner drink. The staff were always pleasant, helpful, and unobtrusive - they have free newspapers all over the place, it's quiet, the location is fine, and loads of public transportation nearby. The rate was fine - the only problem was the weak dollar, really. Stay here! A great place! We will definitely stay here again when we come back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good accomodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All in all an excellent choice. We stayed for four days during Easter 2004. I picked the hotel based on the reviews I had read and I can honestly say that I enjoed my stay. Staff are very friendly and helpful, rooms were very clean, location was just fine. I would recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mecenate Palace from April 1st through April 5th and returned for our last night in Rome after traveling Italy for 2 weeks. Our luggage was lost for 3 days and the concierge was helpful in dealing with the airlines. The restaurant recommendations were outstanding! For the price, we had a wonderful view of the Santa Maria Maggiore, spacious room and bathroom (with terry cloth bath robes! one of my favorite perks), and we generally walked everywhere. Maybe coming from a major city, the location of the hotel didn't bother us. We found it safe. We even walked around the park at night (where my husband romatically purchased flowers from a street vendor). Overall, starting and ending our trip at the Mecenate was one of the best choices we made! Now that our laundry is done, we would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel, our last in Rome after a week's stay. It was conveniently close to the Termini station where we arrived from Positano. My husband liked that we could walk the three blocks and save cab fare. The lobby is the best part: pretty and elegant. It is in the traditional style. Carpet upstairs is very worn in the hallways. Our room on the 4th floor was the typical small room with traditional decor. Traditional style, pink wallpaper, a pretty chandelier, but worn carpeting. They have not updated in awhile. The bed needed replacement also. A decent bathroom with marble shower. All-in-all nice, but not luxurious or special. The location was not central enough for us. We like to walk everywhere. The breakfast was fine, served at the top of the hotel. The yogurt is typical Rome--excellent. The location reminded me of the average parts of Manhattan. It's like a side street off Times Square. I would much prefer a location like our other hotel in the Spanish Steps area. Hotel San Carlo! Cost a bit more but was worth it! Tip: if you prefer to take a cab to the airport-- Walk to the left of the Maggiore church and look for the taxi stand. The hotel wanted to charge us 52 Euro for a ride we got there for 36 Euro. Be sure to ask the Taxi price up front since it changes with the driver.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with this choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the many reviews and I was pleasantly surprised by it - it was attractive and comfortable. It was a 10 minute walk from the train station and we walked everywhere except the Vatican (metro). It's a city neighborhood - but not a bad one. We asked for restaurant recommendations that were within walking distance and were happy with the restaurants. No complaints - I thought it was a good choice and a good value for 159 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Just book it, fare price and walk every where.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well I booked this hotel due to the reviews. I looked at the negatives ie: location, bad area plus all the other bad points listed and my honest remarks are as follows:Train station transfer time to hotel 10 mins walking. Area around station like any other in the world. Hotel excellent, people kind, rooms excellent, people say small but how big a bed do you want, marble every were romantic is a nice word. Locaction excellent walked every where, do it as you will miss so much. Food so many places, Irish pub 2 mins away. Buy the DK pocket guide to Rome excellent. To many good things to mention and not enough space to write Just book it and walk, fantastic Hotel and location. Price paid 150 euros per night, Age 42, smoker, weight 15 stone, just in case you thought I was an athlete.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our two night stay in Rome, April 22 -24. The hotel is very well maintained, and decorated lovely. Our room, on floor 4A, was very small, but that was fine and expected for European accomodations. I also found the employees friendly and helpful. The one MAJOR disadvantage was location. It was somewhat inconvienent... and you walked alot. The surrounding area is in the older part of Rome, but not once did I feel uncomfortable. The Breakfast, continental, was adequate... although a few more selections would have been nice. All and all, for the dollar an excellant choice, but be aware that the location is a very big negative

Reviews.Title: “Nicest we stayed at in Italy for the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during Easter weekend and were very pleased that we did so. We stayed in a standard double room and found the accomadations very pleasing. The room was a bit small, but nicely appointed with an in-room safe, mini-bar, satellite TV (with CNN) and comfortable beds (minus the flat pillows). The bathroom was nicely appointed with marble & brass fixtures. I felt the location was fine and I offer the suggestion of using the Vittorio metro stop rather than the Termini stop. The walk to the hotel from this stop was better than termini. It was very easy to walk to all the major sites and plenty of restaurants & gelato places in the area. There is a great pizzeria right up the street near the Vittorio stop that we enjoyed more than any other restaurant on our trip. There is also a grocery store right around the corner if you so desire. All in all we enjoyed our stay and the lovely breakfast on the roof top terrace. We made sandwiches every morning with the ham & the croissants which was rather satisfying. It was better than the average continental breakfast. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a moderatly priced 4 star hotel in an adequate location.

Reviews.Title: “Small but luxurious”
Reviews.Author: aurorabrchicago13
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in early April and was very pleased with the room, service and price. Though small, the room I stayed in was comfortable, immaculate and beautifully decorated. The walls were covered in fabric, the furniture (including a built-in vanity) was dark wood and the bed was super comfortable. The bathroom was HUGE and very modern. My room faced the street but was extremely quiet. The only sound heard was the charming toll of the adjacent St. Maria Maggiore church. The breakfast, like most hotels I stayed in while traveling through Italy was sparse but good enough. Overall, the Golden Tulip was one of the best experiences in Italy. The only negative comment I could make was the location, the area near the Termini train station (which is less than a 5-minute walk from the hotel) is sketchier than that in other large Italian cities. However, all major attractions are within walking distance, including Vatican (about 20-30 minute stroll).

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel we stayed at in Italy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am shocked to read all these great reviews! We stayed our last 3 nights here, and it was by far the worst hotel. The breakfast was entirely inedible. Canned fruit, disgusting coffee and hot chocolate, ham that looked like Spam, and that's it. The hotel spelled of overused cheap cleaning products. The shower drain was clogged. Laying in bed, we heard the person in the next room over sneeze. So much for "sound-proofed rooms". Our "kingsized bed" was really just 2 twin beds pushed next to each other. There was a big gap inbetween the beds, and they were made with their own twin sheets (with dirty comforters on top). For the same amount of money, we stayed at the Hotel Splendide Royal overlooking the Villa Borghese right by the Spanish Steps. The breakfast there was phenomenal, as were the rooms, the restaurant, and the view. Don't stay here. It's smelly, dirty, and simply not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very pleased with Golden Tulip Macenate Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Golden Tulip Macenate Palace definately exceeded our expectations. We stayed at the hotel five nights and were extremely pleased with everything. Our room was on the 5th floor overlooking Santa Maria Maggiore. The room was very ample in size, spotlessly clean, and the bathroom was exceptionally nice. We had booked a triple room and the 3rd bed or cot was somewhat small but we got along just fine. The breakfast room on the roof of the hotel was very, very nice and so was the food. It was continental but it included cold cuts and cheese along with pastries, cereal and fruit which was certainly ample. The hotel is located within a 5 minute walk from Termini Train Station which also has a metro. Since we took the train to Pompeii and the metro to Ostia Antica and the Vatican stop this was perfect. The hotel is in walking distance of the wonderful things to see in Rome. The staff of the hotel was courteous and helpful. In our opinion the hotel definately deserve a 5 star rating. We booked this hotel due to the reviews on this tripadvisor forum and we certainly are glad that we did.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Good Location, Tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Moneyneversleeps
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was in a good location. Very close to the train station and easy to find. I was a little disappointed in the size of the room. It was very small but I guess that is typical for Rome. I would stay there again because of the price (130 Euro) and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: AliRookes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent weekend of 6th February at the Mecenate and were very pleased that the hotel lived up to expectations. Although the bedroom was small it was spotless and well appointed. We found the location good with a very nice 'family' restaurant just up the road (booked for us by Roberto) at approx Â£30 per head with wine for 4 courses. We were able to walk to all the main attractions from the hotel (including Vatican City) although we did cover a fair few miles! The hotel overlooks the Santa Maria basilica which is absolutely stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Suite”
Reviews.Author: hobe8000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Virgilio suite in October. The room was a bit small by US standards however it was well appointed. Spa Tub was fantastic after long walks thru Rome! The private roof-top patio outside our room was huge! Great view! Service was excellent and so was the breakfast. A good value. Definately going to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel; so-so location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, good sized rooms. Staff was helpful if a bit formal. Breakfast was good except the fruit was canned. My only caveat- stay away from the Termini area. Not safe for two women - we were cursed at twice by men for no reason as we walked down the street a block from the hotel and two blocks from the Termini! Next time, I would chose the Spanish Steps area as it seemed more safe.

Reviews.Title: “As advertised-great value”
Reviews.Author: landsharmony
Reviews.Content: I carefully researched hotels in Rome before choosing the Mecenate Palace. My only concern were comments regarding its location. Here's the facts: the location is no more than 1.5 miles from any major site in Rome and less than a mile from most (only a few hundred yards from the Colliseum and Roman Forum). We easily walked with our toddler in a stroller from the Pantheon--one of the furthest sites. It's about 7-10 euros if you need to take a taxi. Secondly, the area is not bad at all. True, it's not located in the high fashion district, but the neighborhood is authentic Rome. We found quite a few excellent restaurants within 500 yards of the hotel (try Le 2 Colonne next to the Maria Maggiore church for a terrific family restaurant). Once you tire of Italian food, there's a delicious multiple award winning chinese restaurant within two blocks--very inexpensive--that gobs of Italians came to while we were there. As for the hotel, we splurged for the Orzio suite on the top floor--a two room suite separated by a hallway with a huge double bath and jacuzzi tub/shower (190 euros per night). The room was amazingly quiet with fabric covered walls and double windows. The hallway was perfect for separating the bedroom from our toddler's room. The breakfast was nice, but as noted by others, lacking in hot food. The service was friendly. All-in-all, the hotel, while not perfect, was a superb value for the money. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but avod the food & drinks!”
Reviews.Author: StyleTraveller
Reviews.Content: Five minutes walk from the Coliseum which is a great starting point for a long circular walk with all key sights (except the Vatican) easily do-able in a long day.Nice lobby, nice staff some of whom speak no or bad English. Get a room with a view on the square and church across the street. If you don't go for the suites, try the ones ending in 23, semi-corner locations with a great view (higher floors are better).Rooms have all they need with multi-language TV. Bathrooms have aging marble and could use some minor TLC. The only thing to really complain about are the filthy carpets, not visible to the eye but to your socks! Bathrooms are well stocked, only slippers and hair conditioner are missing.We paid 200 Euro for a triple which was good value I think. My only other Rome hotel experience was at the Hotel Hassler which was definitely not better (except the location & view) for more than double the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the M Palace - very nice hotel, decorated in the traditional Rome way - lots of Marble and flowery wallpaper. Breakfast was a bit disappointing - nothing hot except drinks. The toasting machine needed 4 attempts to put bread through before it turned into toast! Despite this the rest of the breakfast was plentiful. The staff were very helpful and things like early morning calls were made on time to the minute! I would recommend staying there despite the neighbourhood which has some dodgy looking characters hanging around once the sun goes down.

Reviews.Title: “The Mecenate did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Mecenate recently based on the many positive reviews we read. We got a great deal on both a single and double room and felt it was a great value. The staff (esp. Roberto) was very friendly and accommodating, and the breakfast included was definitely a bonus! The rooms, although small, were quiet, neat, clean and quite charming. The location may be inconvenient for some, however, it is very close to a Metro stop, which we used to get almost anywhere with ease. Also, Termini rail station is only 3 blocks away, which has a train that runs to and from Fuimicino airport every 1/2 hour, way less expensive than taking a taxi (and probably faster). In short, our experience at the Mecenate was very positive and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “12.29.03 - 01.04.04”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for our honeymoon. We arranged for their helpful taxi service and were picked up promptly at the airport. The guy picking us up was really nice and had a big sign that had our names on it. When we arrived at the hotel, we were pretty excited with the lobby. The rooms were a little on the small side, not bad for us since we're small peoople. Beforehand, I emailed them and asked for a room with a view. We had a corner room on the fourth floor overlooking the SM and the side street. It was gorgeous! We set up our little table in front of the window facing the SM and had a little cafe table. Very cute. The bathroom was also very nice and they had a safe in the room as well and they had robes and new towels every day. I think they clean your room like 4 times a day! The supermarket, which was right around the corner is a good place to get some inexpensive wine, cheese, and meat. And, if you go down Via Panispermia (pretty safe too) its not but a ten minute walk max to the Vittorio Emmanuele. I don't suggest any of the restaurants around the Esquilino hill, very expensive and not great. And make sure the cab driver doesn't screw you, just be aware. We didn't go near the termini at all. We walked the whole time or took the taxi. Anwyays, I would suggest the Mecenate Palace. Everyone was very helfpul there. If you can get a hotel near the Piazza Navona and Campo D'Fiori area, even better so you don't have to walk so much, but with all the eating we did, it was probably better we stayed where we did. Also, the Lets Go Rome book is wonderful!!! And try the Pizza at Pizzeria Bafetto on Governo del Vecchio (it doesn't open til like 7 p.m. though).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mecenate 1/8-1/14/04. The staff and hotel are fabulous. The rooms are well appointed and are very comfortable and quiet, with all the amenities you would want from a 4 star. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful - from the check-in, porter, bartender, breakfast staff, etc - they were all very nice. The only thing to keep in mind is the location. There is a grocery across the street, and a metro about 10 minutes walk down the street. But you need to do a good 20 minute walk to go down to the ruins, or to get up to Spanish Steps/Trevi Fountain areas. The poor metro system and spontaneous strikes made the metro a very poor choice, so expect to walk a lot or taxi it from/to the hotel. Otherwise, a great place to stay, within a five minute taxi ride to Termini station. A very safe and bustling neighborhood, but there isn't a lot for lunch/dinner around that area.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible area, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richtravels_7
Reviews.Content: We (a family of 5 Adults) just returned from our trip to Italy (Jan 1 to Jan 12). We stayed at the Mecenate Palace for 4 nights in a double and a triple. The hotel is very nice with marble baths, fabric covered walls and comfortable beds. The employees were all very nice. Breakfast included nice ham (american style), various canned fruits, rolls and croissants, the coffee and hot chocolate, unfortuantely, is probably the worst in all of Italy. I would not stay at this hotel again or recommend it based primarily on the area it is in. It is not centrally located and the area while probably safe does not give you that impression. Stay within 500 meters of the Pantheon if you want to be centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Travel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Looking at the price - value ratio for this hotel one has to go for the 5 star rating in this survey. Of course there are more elegant and grander hotels in the city but you simply have to consider what you want. Either spent twice or three times at much at for a bit more glamour and attitude or pay the extremly competitive rates at the feel-good Mecenate. Rooms: Like pointed out in the other reviews. Extremly clean, up-to-date with good air-conditioning or heating, comfortable beds, slippers. bathropes, good-sized marble bath rooms and if you are lucky some rooms offer a wonderful view of the impressive Church of Santa Maria Maggiore or with nice little balconies. Service: We received extremely friendly service. No matter if you addressed a request to the bellman, the check-in staff, the maid or the breakfast (rooftop breakfast room with a panoramic view) staff everybody was helpful and serviced with a smile. Especially the front desk staff did an extremly good job with recommendations for tours or restaurants. They will not send you to overprices tourist traps!!! Location: Safe area, far enough from the main railway station - right at one of Romes major Churches: Santa Maria Maggiore. About 20 minutes by foot to Trevi Fountain or Spanish Steps and major shopping. Easy subway access (station is right down the street). Stayed at 5 Star hotels before in Rome and think that they are not worth the significant premium over the Mecenate. Especially it you can use all the saved money on buying other things.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not as good as other reviews make out”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was average, and certainly not as special as some of the reviews below would have you believe. The location is ok - not right in the centre but by no means out in the sticks. The staff are very polite, the rooms are clean and tastefully done - but they are quite small, the breakfast was mediocre and there was little choice from room service or in the bar. Be careful to get a room with a view - ours simply had a view of the back of another building and a discarded bicycle !

HotelInfo.Name: Mecenate Palace
HotelInfo.Address: Via Carlo Alberto 3, 00185 Rome, Italy
